('29', 145, 1, 2, 305335) 105. CAUSES OF FAILURE
('29', 145, 2, 3, 305358) Swaraj cannot be secured within the time limit set by us; besides this, the situation which we wished to end seems to be striking deeper roots.
('29', 145, 2, 4, 305502) Not only have we not secured swaraj!
('29', 145, 2, 5, 305539) we have developed a fear of swaraj.
('29', 145, 2, 6, 305575) Hindus say they do not want it, so also Muslims and Non Brahmins say they do not want it—who then wants swaraj?
('29', 145, 2, 7, 305687) What sort of people are they if they are afraid of freedom itself?
('29', 145, 2, 8, 305754) Thus we have been reduced to a peculiar plight.
('29', 145, 3, 9, 305802) Let us examine the causes.
('29', 145, 3, 10, 305829) If you take a potent medicine without circumspection, it leads to a relapse; this is the very thing that has happened with non co operation, which is like a potent medicine and cannot be taken casually.
('29', 145, 3, 11, 306032) If there is any error in employing it, serious harm may result.
('29', 145, 3, 12, 306096) A son co operates as a rule with his father, so does a wife with her husband, or a people with their king.
('29', 145, 3, 13, 306203) There is a bond of love between the two; but there are occasions when there is and ought to be non co operation between the two.
('29', 145, 3, 14, 306332) If that non co operation is virulent, it is detestable and sinful.
('29', 145, 3, 15, 306399) Between father and son there can be no enmity.
('29', 145, 3, 16, 306446) If it does arise, it is more dreadful than ordinary enmity.
('29', 145, 3, 17, 306506) The Germans and the English are cousins.
('29', 145, 3, 18, 306547) When they fought, one had to go down to dust.
('29', 145, 3, 19, 306593) By refraining from such blood thirsty non co operation and calling our non co operation peaceful, we have completely transformed its character.
('29', 145, 3, 20, 306737) Our peaceful non co operation must needs be constructive, not destructive.
('29', 145, 3, 21, 306812) Poison should not emerge from the throes of love.
('29', 145, 3, 22, 306862) We wished to end our enmity with Englishmen and make friends but it could not be.
('29', 145, 3, 23, 306944) The adjective ‘‘peaceful” was under emphasized in our non co operation.
('29', 145, 3, 24, 307016) Our non co operation turned out to be that of the weak.
('29', 145, 3, 25, 307072) In spite of this, we have been able to achieve good results, our spirits have risen, the people have become aware of their power, we have got a glimpse of an irresistible weapon; but we have not learnt how to make full use of it.
('29', 145, 4, 26, 307302) Therefore, we retreated.
('29', 145, 4, 27, 307327) Our love, which was only skin deep, vanished.
('29', 145, 4, 28, 307373) Only non co operation was left behind and we did not succeed against the Government; that is why we started to non co operate among ourselves.
('29', 145, 4, 29, 307516) Once we take a weapon out of its sheath, it does not turn back but leads to our own destruction.
('29', 145, 4, 30, 307613) Hindus and Muslims started non co operation with each other, so also did
('29', 146, 0, 1, 307686) VOL. 29 : 16 AUGUST, 1924 26 DECEMBER, 1924 147
('29', 146, 1, 2, 307734) Swarajists and No changers.
('29', 146, 1, 3, 307762) In these two instances of non co operation, there is war instead of peace, hate instead of love.
('29', 146, 1, 4, 307859) There is no mutual confidence, they don’t want even to see each other’s face.
('29', 146, 1, 5, 307937) Those who look upon pure love as a potent weapon, what are they to do in such circumstances?
('29', 146, 1, 6, 308030) What is the duty, in these circumstances, of a man like me who claims to be an advocate of non violence?
('29', 146, 1, 7, 308135) I am in the forefront of the struggle against the Swarajists.
('29', 146, 1, 8, 308197) I do not in the least approve of their programme of entering the Councils.
('29', 146, 1, 9, 308272) Therefore I fought them hard in the Congress, acknowledged defeat and announced my intention to fight again.
('29', 146, 1, 10, 308381) I suppose that my good faith will be recognized and both the groups will engage themselves in their respective programmes, thereby helping each other.
('29', 146, 1, 11, 308532) But my expectations proved wrong.
('29', 146, 1, 12, 308566) There is disquiet in the minds of both.
('29', 146, 1, 13, 308606) Preparations are afoot to capture the Congress at Balgaum by majority strength.
('29', 146, 1, 14, 308686) This is no sign of love.
('29', 146, 1, 15, 308711) The principle of majority does not work when differences on fundamentals are involved.
('29', 146, 1, 16, 308798) If both the parties are suspicious, bitterness is intensified.
('29', 146, 1, 17, 308861) If the voters cast their votes not intelligently but out of blind faith, then such voting does not serve an educative purpose, but only leads to their degradation.
('29', 146, 1, 18, 309025) If the voters are trustful and cannot see the intricacies of a problem, the principle of majority may even lead to their destruction.
('29', 146, 2, 19, 309159) Knowing all this, how can I seek a majority decision in the Congress?
('29', 146, 2, 20, 309229) The members who will come there are bound to cast their votes not on the merits of an issue but with an eye on the speakers.
('29', 146, 3, 21, 309354) In these circumstances I should set forth an object lesson in love by sticking to my creed of non violence.
('29', 146, 3, 22, 309462) I must not desire to retain control of the Congress in my hands.
('29', 146, 3, 23, 309527) I should bow out of the Congress if I cannot win over the Swarajists through humble arguments.
('29', 146, 3, 24, 309622) The success of a non violent person lies in his defeat.
('29', 146, 3, 25, 309678) An advocate of non violence never fights for power; he even propagates his creed not on the strength of a majority but through spiritual power.
('29', 146, 3, 26, 309822) If his non violence is true, he believes that ultimate victory would be his even when he is alone, that is to say, the creed would win in the end if he sticks to it in the face of death.
('29', 146, 3, 27, 310009) The creed will have to adopt a human form in order to propagate itself among human beings.
('29', 146, 3, 28, 310100) It means that someone must prepare himself to die for the sake of the creed.
('29', 146, 3, 29, 310177) I have, therefore, made up my mind not to join a battle of votes with the Swarajists for the sake of the creed; and I tender the same advice to all peaceful non co operators.
('29', 146, 3, 30, 310352) This alone
('29', 147, 0, 1, 310363) 148 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('29', 147, 1, 2, 310405) will enable us to bridge the gulf that has yawned between us.
('29', 147, 1, 3, 310467) I wish to see not only the Swarajists but all parties participating in the work of the Congress.
('29', 147, 1, 4, 310564) It is only when the bulk of the people co operate heartily among themselves that non co operation with the Government can shine forth.
('29', 147, 2, 5, 310699) Is there any programme which may unite all parties?
('29', 147, 2, 6, 310751) That programme should consist of items essential for the general public.

('29', 147, 3, 8, 310954) Swaraj, I think, is unattainable if we fail to achieve any one of these three things.

('29', 150, 5, 8, 318138) INSTRUCTIONS TO SPINNERS
('29', 150, 6, 9, 318163) The following instructions 1 from the examiner of yarn appointed by the All India Khadi Board deserve the attention of every spinner.
('29', 150, 6, 10, 318297) It means spinners should not try to spin fine without knowing the test for yarn.
('29', 150, 6, 11, 318378) If fine yarn is weak, it is quite useless.

('29', 150, 6, 13, 318563) Yarn up to 30 counts is not considered fine.
('29', 150, 6, 14, 318608) If yarn is uniformly of 20 to 30 counts, we can save a lot of cotton; and saris, dhotis, etc., which are very heavy, can be made lighter and finer.

('29', 156, 3, 7, 329417) 113. SPEECH AT OPENING CEREMONY OF”THE HINDUSTAN TIMES”, DELHI
('29', 156, 4, 8, 329480) September 15, 1924
('29', 156, 5, 9, 329499) In declaring the press open Mr. Gandhi said that it was not without hesitation
('29', 156, 6, 10, 329578) that he accepted the invitation of Sardar Mangal Singh to perform the opening
('29', 156, 7, 11, 329656) ceremony, holding as he did very strongly that under the present conditions of the country he would, if he could, stop all newspapers except Young India.
('29', 156, 7, 12, 329810) But his intense
('29', 156, 8, 13, 329826) love for the Sikhs tempted him to accept the invitation.
('29', 156, 8, 14, 329883) The Sikhs position today
('29', 156, 9, 15, 329908) was full of difficulty and all that he would ask them to do was to have unflinching
('29', 156, 10, 16, 329992) faith in God.
('29', 156, 10, 17, 330006) He trusted that a paper beginning under such good auspices would prove
('29', 156, 11, 18, 330077) worthy of the responsible profession and be conducted with truth, tact and
('29', 156, 12, 19, 330152) fearlesness.
('29', 156, 12, 20, 330165) It was a religious venture and he hoped that nothing would compromise their great watchword Sat Sri Akal 2. Every word and sentence published in the paper
('29', 156, 13, 21, 330320) should be weighed.
('29', 156, 13, 22, 330339) There should not only be no untrue statements, but no suggestio
('29', 156, 14, 23, 330403) falsi or suppressio veri.
('29', 156, 14, 24, 330429) Truth and love of sacrifice was what their religion taught and
('29', 156, 15, 25, 330492) he hoped that the journal would carry this out in its service of the Sikhs and of India
('29', 156, 16, 26, 330580) under the able and educated editorship of Mr. K. M. Panikkar and the guidance of men
('29', 156, 17, 27, 330665) like Sardar Mangal Singh.

('29', 158, 6, 14, 332582) 117. NOTES
('29', 158, 7, 15, 332593) [Before September 17,1924]
('29', 158, 8, 16, 332620) NO CONGRESSMEN INVOLVED
('29', 158, 9, 17, 332644) The reader will recollect that the president of the Savarna Mahajan Sabha accused Congressmen of practically disorderly conduct.
('29', 158, 9, 18, 332773) I have now three letters of categorical denial.
('29', 158, 9, 19, 332821) One letter is from the conveners of the meeting.
('29', 158, 9, 20, 332870) I extract the following from that letter:
('29', 158, 10, 21, 332912) We have to make it clear that the meeting was not conducted”under the auspices of the adherents of the congress party”.
('29', 158, 10, 22, 333032) It was a meeting of the savarna Hindus of Central Travancore convened at the instance of the Vanjipuzha Chief, the most prominent Brahmin landlord of Chengannur, by a respresentative body of conveners consisting of four Brahmins and three Nair gentlemen of the place.
('29', 158, 10, 23, 333300) None of these were adherents of the Congress party.
('29', 158, 11, 24, 333352) The propositions adopted for presentation and the resolutions passed at the meeting were identical.
('29', 158, 12, 25, 333452) 1 From the reference to the 21 day fast which Gandhiji commenced on the 17th night
('29', 159, 0, 1, 333535) 160 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('29', 159, 1, 2, 333577) We are anxious to inform you of the perfectly non violent spirit that reigns in Travancore generally in regard to Vykom Satyagraha.
('29', 159, 1, 3, 333709) The letter contains a complete and detailed refutation of the charges referred to in Young India.
('29', 159, 1, 4, 333807) But as the meeting in question was evidently not called by Congressmen and as the general public cannot be interested in the detailed refutation, for the sake of brevity I have omitted the major portion of the letter.
('29', 159, 2, 5, 334025) NOT BY DEPUTY
('29', 159, 3, 6, 334039) A correspondent says his mother is an expert spinner and spins nearly 20 tolas per day.
('29', 159, 3, 7, 334127) On the passing of the spinning resolution he asked his mother to teach him spinning.
('29', 159, 3, 8, 334212) The poor mother did not know what to say.
('29', 159, 3, 9, 334254) She thought her spinning was enough for all her family, especially as she spun twice as much in a day as was required per person in a month.
('29', 159, 3, 10, 334395) If the quantity was the only thing aimed at by the resolution, her argument would be irresistible; but there are some duties which cannot be done by deputy.
('29', 159, 3, 11, 334552) We cannot bathe or study or pray by deputy, nor may we spin by deputy when, by individual spinning, each one of us has personally to identify himself with the poor, when the idea is to set a personal example and when we want to make a knowledge of the art so universal that by the simple system we can make hand spun cheap enough to compete with the machine spun cloth.
('29', 159, 3, 12, 334922) Underlying the good mother’s objection to her boy, spinning is no doubt the idea that spinning is merely a woman’s calling.
('29', 159, 3, 13, 335046) It is true that as a rule women only spin.
('29', 159, 3, 14, 335089) There are no doubt some light occupations which women are better fitted for than men.
('29', 159, 3, 15, 335175) But to argue therefore that they are derogatory to man’s dignity or that they may make him effeminate is a gross superstition.
('29', 159, 3, 16, 335302) Cooking is essentially a woman’s calling, but every soldier must not only know cooking but he has to do it himself whilst he is on duty.
('29', 159, 3, 17, 335439) The most accomplished cooks in the world today are men.
('29', 159, 3, 18, 335495) Woman is, by habit or nature, queen of the household.
('29', 159, 3, 19, 335549) She is not designed to organize on a large scale.
('29', 159, 3, 20, 335599) Being conservative and preservative, she is not inventive.
('29', 159, 3, 21, 335658) Man, being restless and often destructive, is inventive.
('29', 159, 3, 22, 335715) Whether this statement be universally true or not, the fact stands that all the greatest inventions have been made by men.
('29', 159, 3, 23, 335838) Our own spinning has been organized by men spinners.
('29', 159, 3, 24, 335891) All the necessary improvements in the machine have been made by men spinners.
('29', 159, 3, 25, 335969) Looked at from every point of view, hand spinning is as essential for man as for woman in India, so long as it has not become universal enough to be reinstated in our villages and to bring about total boycott of foreign cloth.
('29', 159, 4, 26, 336196) (The above two notes were written before the fast.) Young India, 25 9 1924

('29', 160, 3, 4, 336387) WHAT I READ 3
('29', 160, 4, 5, 336401) I must not omit to mention one little but precious book a dear friend sent.
('29', 160, 4, 6, 336477) It was Supersensual Life by Jacob Boehmen.
('29', 160, 4, 7, 336520) I notice it to enable me to share with the reader some of the striking passages I copied from it.
('29', 160, 4, 8, 336618) Here they are:
('29', 160, 5, 9, 336633) It is naught indeed but thine own hearing and willing that do hinder them, so that thou dost not see and hear God.
('29', 160, 5, 10, 336748) If thou rulest over the creatures externally only and not from the right internal ground of thy inward nature, then thy will and ruling is in a bestial kind or matter.
('29', 160, 6, 11, 336916) Thou art like all things and nothing unlike thee.
('29', 160, 6, 12, 336966) If thou wilt be like all things, thou must forsake all things.
('29', 160, 7, 13, 337029) Let the hands and the head be at labour.
('29', 160, 7, 14, 337070) Thy heart ought ought nevertheless to rest in God.
('29', 160, 8, 15, 337121) Heaven is the turning in of the will to the love of God.
('29', 160, 8, 16, 337178) Hell is the turning in of the will into the wrath of God.
('29', 160, 8, 17, 337236) Whilst I am turning over my scrappy notebook, I come across certain other passages collected in the course of my reading from other books.
('29', 160, 8, 18, 337375) Here is one for satyagrahis:
('29', 160, 9, 19, 337404) They are slaves who will not choose
('29', 160, 10, 20, 337440) Hatred, scoffing and abuse,
('29', 160, 11, 21, 337468) Rather than in silence shrink
('29', 160, 12, 22, 337498) From the truth they needs must think.
('29', 160, 13, 23, 337536) They are slaves who dare not be
('29', 160, 14, 24, 337568) In the right with two or three.
('29', 160, 14, 25, 337600) —Lowell
('29', 160, 15, 26, 337608) (Copied from Tom Brown’s School Days) Another bearing on the same subject is from Claude Field’s Mystics and Saints of Islam.
('29', 160, 16, 27, 337734) Sufi Shah Mullah Shah, when he was advised to flee from the wrath of Shah Jehan, is reported to have said,”I am not an impostor that I should
('29', 161, 0, 1, 337876) 162 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('29', 161, 1, 2, 337918) seek safety in flight.
('29', 161, 1, 3, 337941) I am an utterer of truth.
('29', 161, 1, 4, 337967) Death and life are to me alike.
('29', 161, 1, 5, 337999) Let my blood in another life also redden the impaling stake.
('29', 161, 1, 6, 338060) I am living and eternal.
('29', 161, 1, 7, 338085) Death recoils from me, for my knowledge has vanquished death.
('29', 161, 1, 8, 338147) The sphere where all colours are effaced has become my abode.” Mansuri Hallaj said,”To cut off the hands of a fettered man is easy, but to sever the link that binds me to the Divinity would be a task indeed.” Here is another from Lowell.
('29', 161, 1, 9, 338385) It helps those who would give to the Malabar sufferers to do so in the right spirit and to share their very best.
('29', 161, 2, 10, 338499) The Holy Supper is kept indeed
('29', 161, 3, 11, 338530) In what we share with another’s need.
('29', 161, 4, 12, 338568) Not that which we give, but what we share.
('29', 161, 5, 13, 338611) For the gift without the giver is bare.
('29', 161, 6, 14, 338651) Who bestows himself with his alms feeds three, Himself, his hungering neighbour and Me.
('29', 161, 6, 15, 338739) The following will strengthen those who believe in the gospel of non violence:
('29', 161, 7, 16, 338818) To wish ill, to do ill, to speak ill or to think ill of anyone, we are equally forbidden without exception.
('29', 161, 7, 17, 338926) —Tertullian (Copied from J. Brierley’s Ourselves and the Universe.) The last set of books I should like to mention are the histories of the Sikhs by Cunningham, Macauliff and Gokulchand Narang.
('29', 161, 7, 18, 339120) All those books are good in their own way.
('29', 161, 7, 19, 339163) It is impossible to appreciate the present Sikh struggle without understanding their previous history and the life of the Gurus.
('29', 161, 7, 20, 339292) Cunningham’s is a sympathetic record of events leading to the Sikh wars.
('29', 161, 7, 21, 339365) Macauliff’s is a life story of the Gurus giving copious extracts from their compositions.
('29', 161, 7, 22, 339455) It is a sumptuously printed publication.
('29', 161, 7, 23, 339496) It loses its value because of its fulsome praise of the English rule and the author’s emphasis on Sikhism as a separate religion having nothing in common with Hinduism.
('29', 161, 7, 24, 339665) Gokulchand Narang’s is a monograph supplying information not available in the two works mentioned.
('29', 161, 7, 25, 339764) Before concluding this review of my studies in the jail, let me draw the student readers’ attention to the value of doing things regularly and the way of making dry things interesting.
('29', 161, 7, 26, 339949) It had a mind, for my own instruction and guidance, to prepare a concordance of the Gita.
('29', 161, 7, 27, 340039) It is not a particularly interesting task to note down words and
('29', 162, 0, 1, 340104) VOL. 29 : 16 AUGUST, 1924 26 DECEMBER, 1924 163
('29', 162, 1, 2, 340152) references and index them twice.
('29', 162, 1, 3, 340185) I thought I should do it during the incarceration.
('29', 162, 1, 4, 340236) At the same time I grudged giving much time to the task.
('29', 162, 1, 5, 340293) My time table was packed.
('29', 162, 1, 6, 340319) I determined therefore to do what it could in 20 minutes daily.
('29', 162, 1, 7, 340383) Doing it for such a short time freed the task from becoming a drudgery.
('29', 162, 1, 8, 340455) On the contrary, I daily looked forward to it.
('29', 162, 1, 9, 340502) When it came to re indexing, it became absorbing.
('29', 162, 1, 10, 340552) The curious may solve the knotty problem for themselves.
('29', 162, 1, 11, 340609) The first indexing gave me the alphabetical order of the first letters of the words to be indexed.
('29', 162, 1, 12, 340708) But how to rearrange the words under each letter in their alphabetical order was a problem to solve.
('29', 162, 1, 13, 340809) I had never written a dictionary.
('29', 162, 1, 14, 340843) I had therefore to discover my own method.
('29', 162, 1, 15, 340886) I was glad when I made the discovery.
('29', 162, 1, 16, 340924) It was so good that it became deeply interesting.
('29', 162, 1, 17, 340974) It was neat, quick and infallible.
('29', 162, 1, 18, 341009) The whole work took me nearly eighteen months to finish.
('29', 162, 1, 19, 341066) I am now by referring to the concordance able to know where and how often a particular word occurs in the Gita.
('29', 162, 1, 20, 341178) It has also a meaning attached to it.
('29', 162, 1, 21, 341216) If I ever succeed in reducing to writing my thougts on the Gita, I propose to share the concordance and the thoughts with the public.
('29', 162, 2, 22, 341350) (Written before the fast) Young India, 25 9 1924

('29', 168, 5, 11, 349026) 129. NOTES
('29', 168, 6, 12, 349037) ANNIE BESANT’S DECLARATION
('29', 168, 7, 13, 349064) The reader will, I hope, join me in welcoming Dr. Annie Besant’s declaration on the situation.
('29', 168, 7, 14, 349159) It is to me a matter of great importance that she should recognize the necessity of spinning by way of example by every worker in the national cause.
('29', 168, 7, 15, 349309) Her example must mean much for the spinning movement.
('29', 168, 7, 16, 349363) That at her age the gifted lady should consent to devote half an hour in the midst of his incessant activity to spinning speaks volumes for her devotion to the national cause.
('29', 168, 8, 17, 349539) So far as the constitution of the Congress is concerned, there is evidently some confusion.
('29', 168, 8, 18, 349631) There is no question of suspending it.
('29', 168, 8, 19, 349670) It will need amending, if my proposal about spinning is accepted.
('29', 168, 8, 20, 349736) The non co operation programme, including civil disobedience, is not part of the constitution.
('29', 168, 8, 21, 349831) That programme will, if my proposals are accepted, be certainly suspended for one year.
('29', 168, 8, 22, 349919) My share in the framing of a swaraj scheme would be this.
('29', 168, 8, 23, 349977) I would attend, if required, any non official conference of different parties to frame the scheme.
('29', 168, 8, 24, 350076) I would be bound by the majority vote in the sense that I would not threaten civil disobedience or non co operation, merely because the scheme does not satisfy me—not even after the year of grace is over— provided the majority are satisfied with it.
('29', 168, 8, 25, 350326) 1 would actively work for the scheme, if it satisfies my minimum.
('29', 168, 8, 26, 350392) I may here say a word about the Congress constitution.
('29', 168, 8, 27, 350447) I observe critics ascribing to me the opinion that the constitution has been an absolute failure.
('29', 168, 8, 28, 350545) It has certainly broken down as measured by its own standard.
('29', 168, 8, 29, 350607) But in my opinion it cannot be seriously denied that the Congress still remains the most
('29', 169, 0, 1, 350696) 170 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('29', 169, 1, 2, 350738) national and representative of all the organizations of India.
('29', 169, 1, 3, 350801) It still has the largest number of original members on its books and has the largest number of volunteers and paid workers of any organization.
('29', 169, 1, 4, 350945) Nor do I wish to be understood to mean that non co operation has absolutely failed.
('29', 169, 1, 5, 351029) On the contrary, it has vitalized the nation as nothing else has.
('29', 169, 1, 6, 351095) But it has not come up to the expectations formed of it.
('29', 169, 1, 7, 351152) The response of the people was great, but not great enough for the purpose intended.
('29', 169, 1, 8, 351237) All this, however, is small comfort to the workers, who have yet much work to do before they can reap the harvest.
('29', 169, 2, 9, 351352) SUSPENSION OR REPEAL
('29', 169, 3, 10, 351373) A friend writes:”Is not your proposed suspension of boycotts only repeal in disguise?” Not for me.
('29', 169, 3, 11, 351472) I have no present intention of securing repeal of the boycotts.
('29', 169, 3, 12, 351536) If I had, I should not have hesitated to say so.
('29', 169, 3, 13, 351585) I hope that it may not be found necessary to resume them.
('29', 169, 3, 14, 351643) But I should have not the slightest hesitation in advising resumption if I found them necessary for national growth, just as I find their suspension necessary for national growth.”Are you not postponing the internecine feud for a year?” says the friend.
('29', 169, 3, 15, 351897) My answer again is,”No”.
('29', 169, 3, 16, 351922) We would know at the end of the year where we stand.
('29', 169, 3, 17, 351975) The boycotts certainly cannot be revived, if at the end of the year there is still a likelihood of sharp divisions.
('29', 169, 3, 18, 352091) They can only become the national programme if the active workers on the political field can be persuaded of their necessity.
('29', 169, 3, 19, 352217) Till that happens, they must remain a policy or a creed with a minority.
('29', 169, 3, 20, 352290) We must not shut our eyes to the fact that whatever the Government yields will be yielded to the demand of the small, vocal and active section of the nation.
('29', 169, 3, 21, 352448) Nothing will be yielded if this section is divided into many warring sub sections.
('29', 169, 3, 22, 352531) I should expect one of two things at the end of the year, either the No changers will be converted to the purely political, i.e., external activity or the pure politicians will, recognizing the futility of mere external activity, devote themselves to the intensive internal development which would necessarily involve acceptance of boycotts.
('29', 169, 3, 23, 352873) It may be also that the internal development as well as political activity will command far more general acceptance and, each party helping the other, we shall compel the Government to accede to the minimum joint demands of all the parties.
('29', 169, 3, 24, 353114) The central idea underlying my proposal is to unite the nation on a common platform and to hope that each party, honestly acting upon the other, would be voluntarily converted to a common form of
('29', 170, 0, 1, 353310) VOL. 29 : 16 AUGUST, 1924 26 DECEMBER, 1924 171
('29', 170, 1, 2, 353358) action.
('29', 170, 1, 3, 353366) Even if this grand purpose fails, we may expect at least to part company with the best grace possible and without imputing motives to one another.
('29', 170, 1, 4, 353513) Suspension is not an unusual state in a movement.
('29', 170, 1, 5, 353563) It often brings greater strength to a suspended plan, if it has innate vitality.
('29', 170, 1, 6, 353644) Those, therefore, who believe in the intrinsic merit of the boycotts need not fear their permanent disappearance because of a brief spell of suspension.
('29', 170, 1, 7, 353797) They, the believers, ought to be the surest guarantee against any such catastrophe.
('29', 170, 2, 8, 353881) “HEART UNITY”
('29', 170, 3, 9, 353895) A correspondent writes:
('29', 170, 4, 10, 353919) In your reply to the Bombay Municipal address 1 you have used an expression—heart unity.
('29', 170, 4, 11, 354008) I pondered and meditated on it and saw that in the core of the universe is the secret of heart unity.
('29', 170, 4, 12, 354110) One has to go down far into the fathomless depths, grasp and run away with the divine touch stone and touch with it the sundered and discoloured parts of human associations to bring back colour and happiness.
('29', 170, 4, 13, 354319) It is in the inner being of Satya and Rita, of Truth
('29', 170, 5, 14, 354372) and Law of Nature.
('29', 170, 5, 15, 354391) It is heart unity that binds planet to planet and holds planets aloft in space, and it is heart unity that keeps elemental matter bound each to the other.
('29', 170, 5, 16, 354546) Chemists had discovered water was a compound of hydrogen and oxygen but by bringing the two together, they could not get water till an electric current passed through them.
('29', 170, 5, 17, 354719) That electric current is the heart unity in Nature.
('29', 170, 5, 18, 354771) It is heart unity that transforms things—melts ice into water, and freezes water into ice, evolution and involution, the descent of spirit into matter and the return of matter to spirit are all the work of heart unity.
('29', 170, 6, 19, 354990) Parvati’s tapasya for heart unity with Siva is a wonderful piece of Hindu imagery.
('29', 170, 6, 20, 355073) Parvati is God’s Shakti or the active principle in the universe, incarnate in human form.
('29', 170, 6, 21, 355163) I feel it was a direct vision from God to some sadhak
('29', 170, 7, 22, 355217) ancestor of the race.
('29', 170, 7, 23, 355239) The force of activity in the Almighty was revealed in its most beautiful aspect, in the place of matter, as Parvati engaged in tapasya—
('29', 170, 8, 24, 355375) for what?
('29', 170, 8, 25, 355385) for nothing less, i.e., denser than heart unity with the Heart of Hearts—çk.kLFk çk.ka, a lesson for humanity to con and master.
('29', 170, 8, 26, 355514) You have mastered it and applied it in the political field by heart unity with the Alis and others, with the result that we are well on our way to get the compound of an Indian Nation made out of several distinct elements of various races and creeds.
('29', 170, 8, 27, 355765) May the country take the cue from you and be firm in her tapasya of activity in
('29', 170, 9, 28, 355845) the direction of heart unity.
('29', 170, 9, 29, 355875) I print the letter not for the compliment it pays me but for the
('29', 170, 10, 30, 355940) 1 Vide”Speech in Reply to Corporation Address, Bombay”, 29 8 1924.
('29', 171, 0, 1, 356007) 172 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('29', 171, 1, 2, 356049) heart unity the writer emphasizes and truly sees in my association with the Ali Brothers and others not of the same faith or even of the same mode of thought.”What is it”, the Big Brother said to me last week,”that binds us so indissolubly together, though we are so dissimilar in most things.
('29', 171, 1, 3, 356343) Is it not after all the allegiance to and the fear of the same God?” What he said was so natural and true.

('29', 171, 2, 8, 356899) VYKOM SATYAGRAHA
('29', 171, 3, 9, 356916) The Vykom Satyagraha has perhaps a meaning deeper than is generally realized.
('29', 171, 3, 10, 356994) The young men who have organized it are stern in discipline and gentle in their dealings with the orthodox section.
('29', 171, 3, 11, 357110) But this is the least part of their trials.
('29', 171, 3, 12, 357154) Some of them are suffering too the persecution of social boycott.
('29', 171, 3, 13, 357220) We, of the western presidency, have no idea of what this persecution can mean.
('29', 171, 3, 14, 357299) These young men who are taking part in the movement are not only being denied social amenities but are threatened even with the deprivation of their share in the family property.
('29', 171, 3, 15, 357478) If they would go to law, probably they would get their due.
('29', 171, 3, 16, 357538) But a satyagrahi cannot go to law for a personal wrong.
('29', 171, 3, 17, 357594) He sets out with the idea of suffering persecution.
('29', 171, 3, 18, 357646) In a reform that the Vykom struggle seeks to achieve, the satyagrahi seeks to convert his opponent by sheer force of character and suffering.
('29', 171, 3, 19, 357788) The purer he is and the more he suffers, the quicker the progress.
('29', 171, 3, 20, 357855) He must therefore resign himself to being ex communicated, debarred from the family privileges and deprived of his share in the family property.
('29', 171, 3, 21, 358000) He must not only bear such hardships cheerfully but he must actively love his persecutors.
('29', 171, 3, 22, 358091) The latter honestly believe that the reformer is doing something sinful and therefore resort to the only means they know to be effective to wean him from his supposed error.
('29', 171, 3, 23, 358265) The satyagrahi on the other hand does not seek to carry out his reform by a system of punishments but by penance, self purification and suffering.
('29', 171, 3, 24, 358412) Any resentment of the persecution, therefore, would be an interruption of the course of discipline he had imposed upon himself.
('29', 171, 3, 25, 358540) It may be a prolonged course, it may even seem to be never ending.
('29', 171, 3, 26, 358607) A little
('29', 172, 0, 1, 358616) VOL. 29 : 16 AUGUST, 1924 26 DECEMBER, 1924 173
('29', 172, 1, 2, 358664) bullying or even moral persuasion or coercion may appear more expeditious.
('29', 172, 1, 3, 358739) What, however, I am showing here is not the greater efficacy of satyagraha but the implications of the method the satyagrahi has deliberately chosen for himself.
('29', 172, 1, 4, 358901) Indeed I have often shown in these pages that satyagraha is, as a matter of fact and in the long run, the most expeditious course.
('29', 172, 1, 5, 359032) But my purpose here is merely to show what the young satyagrahis of Vykom are doing.
('29', 172, 1, 6, 359117) The public know much of what they are doing in the shape of picketing but they know nothing of the silent suffering, some of them are undergoing at the hands of their families and caste men.
('29', 172, 1, 7, 359308) But I know that it is this silent and loving suffering which will finally break the wall of prejudice.
('29', 172, 1, 8, 359411) I am anxious therefore that the reformers should realize their responsibility to the full and not swerve by a hair’s breadth from their self imposed discipline.

('29', 174, 1, 2, 363085) 130. THE QUESTION OF QUESTIONS
('29', 174, 2, 3, 363116) As I am reaching Delhi, I read the following letter which I give almost word for word, save for two or three slight grammatical corrections:
('29', 174, 3, 4, 363257) The Mussalmans of Nagpur have run amuck.
('29', 174, 3, 5, 363298) Though a Hindu, I have hitherto studiously refrained from taking any part in the Hindu agitation at Nagpur.
('29', 174, 3, 6, 363406) I am a believer both in non violence and Hindu Muslim uniy.
('29', 174, 3, 7, 363466) Believe me, there is no sectarian spirit in me.
('29', 174, 3, 8, 363514) But the doings of the Mussalmans in Nagpur, as in many other places, are putting my faith to very severe test indeed.
('29', 174, 3, 9, 363632) The pity of it is that not a single responsible Mussalman of Nagpur has publicly condemned these acts.
('29', 174, 3, 10, 363735) Had it not been for the brave Doctor Moonje and the gallant Udaram followed by the Koshthis 1 there is no knowing
('29', 174, 4, 11, 363849) what atrocities the Mussalmans would have committed.
('29', 174, 4, 12, 363902) I know there is no bargaining in love.
('29', 174, 4, 13, 363941) I also agree that in love it is all giving.
('29', 174, 4, 14, 363985) But I cannot forget that the sacrifice and sufferings undergone for the sake of love are voluntary and not forced.
('29', 174, 4, 15, 364100) But the Hindu yields not out of his strength, not of his own free will, but out of his weakness and in spite of himself.
('29', 174, 4, 16, 364221) To my mind the Hindus are only trying to shake off the slavery of the British to become serfs of the Mussalmans.
('29', 174, 4, 17, 364334) Your pathetic article 2 on”Gulbarga Gone Mad” is an index of the depth of your own feelings in this rnatter.
('29', 174, 5, 18, 364443) But you have yourself several times declared that you would prefer violence to cowardice.
('29', 174, 5, 19, 364533) You also wrote in the Young India some weeks ago that
('29', 174, 6, 20, 364587) the average Mussalman was a bully, and that the average Hindu was a coward 3
('29', 174, 7, 21, 364664) this is only too true!
('29', 174, 7, 22, 364687) How else could the Mussalmans of Nagpur, who are in a minority, rise so often in the teeth of the overwhelming number of the Hindus?
('29', 174, 7, 23, 364820) The fact of the case is that the docile Hindu commands neither respect nor fear.
('29', 174, 7, 24, 364901) Whether or not Darwin was right is not my part to determine.
('29', 174, 7, 25, 364962) But one thing is clear, the world has no place for the weak.
('29', 174, 7, 26, 365023) They must become strong or cease to be.
('29', 174, 7, 27, 365063) If the Hindus want to live, they must organize, they must get strong, they must agitate, and they must learn the divine art of dying for the honour of their women and their gods.
('29', 174, 8, 28, 365242) But they are hopeless cowards.
('29', 174, 8, 29, 365273) For them non violence has no meaning.
('29', 174, 8, 30, 365311) It only serves as a mask to cover their abject cowardice.
('29', 174, 8, 31, 365369) To preach to
('29', 174, 9, 32, 365382) 1 A community of weavers.
('29', 174, 9, 33, 365408) 2 Of 28 8 1924. 3 Vide”Hindu Muslim Tension : Its Cause and Cure (subtopic The Bully and the Coward”, 29 5 1924.
('29', 175, 0, 1, 365521) 176 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('29', 175, 1, 2, 365563) them non violence sounds very much like preaching a sermon on moderation in diet to the famine stricken before providing them with the means of satisfying their hunger or is like feeding a sick and infirm man with food that even strong men find it difficult to digest.
('29', 175, 1, 3, 365832) Far from doing him the least good, it does him incalculable harm.
('29', 175, 2, 4, 365898) If you follow this line of thought, will you not feel constrained to concede that for a real and lasting Hindu Muslim unity, the Hindus must develop the spirit of manliness?

('29', 175, 2, 7, 366196) They corrupt both themselves and the strong, the latter by tempting them to bully.
('29', 175, 2, 8, 366279) Weakness curseth both him that is weak, and him that bullies him.
('29', 175, 2, 9, 366345) The Hindus may not retaliate in the sense of taking”a tooth for a tooth” and”an eye for an eye”.
('29', 175, 2, 10, 366442) They may not avenge themselves by violating the sanctity of Mussalman womanhood or by defiling or demolishing mosques.
('29', 175, 2, 11, 366561) But since non violence is beyond them, should you not advise them to learn to teach the wrong doers a salutary lesson?
('29', 175, 2, 12, 366680) Must they not develop the ability to defend themselves violently, before they could be expected to appreciate non violence?
('29', 175, 2, 13, 366804) Do not the good of the Hindus, real Hindu Muslim friendship, and, for that matter, swaraj lie that way?
('29', 175, 3, 14, 366908) These thoughts have been agitating my mind now for a pretty long time.
('29', 175, 3, 15, 366979) I tried to reason with myself, but I could not find a satisfactory answer to the questions named above.
('29', 175, 3, 16, 367083) Hence I turn to you for guidance.
('29', 175, 3, 17, 367117) I hope you will excuse me for encroaching upon your time with such a long letter.
('29', 175, 3, 18, 367199) I shall be earnestly awaiting your reply to this in the columns of the Young India at your
('29', 175, 4, 19, 367290) earliest convenience.
('29', 175, 5, 20, 367312) I would like to have my identity, though not my letter, kept private.
('29', 175, 6, 21, 367382) The earnestness of the writer is written in every part of the letter.
('29', 175, 6, 22, 367452) The reasoning is sound so far as it goes.
('29', 175, 6, 23, 367494) My difficulty, however, arises when we come to working out in practice the writer’s propositions and their corollaries.
('29', 175, 6, 24, 367614) The reader will find an outline of my scheme of work in the translation given else where, 1 and made for me by Mahadev Desai, of an article I wrote in Navajivan last week to meet a difficulty that has arisen in Gujarat and in answer to questions put both by Hindu and Mussalman friends.
('29', 175, 7, 25, 367901) Mine is at the present moment a most pitiable position.
('29', 175, 7, 26, 367957) Thousands, it may be said in truth, look to me for guidance at this time of trial for the nation.
('29', 175, 7, 27, 368055) I have taken a leading part in the Khilafat
('29', 175, 8, 28, 368099) 1 Vide”Hindu Muslim Unity”, 14 9 1924.
('29', 176, 0, 1, 368138) VOL. 29 : 16 AUGUST, 1924 26 DECEMBER, 1924 177
('29', 176, 1, 2, 368186) agitation.
('29', 176, 1, 3, 368197) I have unhesitatingly and fearlessly propounded the doctrine of giving without the stipulation of receiving anything in return.
('29', 176, 1, 4, 368325) There is no flaw in my reasoning.
('29', 176, 1, 5, 368359) But the correspondent’s question is,”Is my reasoning relevant to the situation?
('29', 176, 1, 6, 368439) Have Hindus anything to give?
('29', 176, 1, 7, 368469) One can give without taking, only out of the fulness of possession.” Let us see.
('29', 176, 2, 8, 368550) It is common cause between the correspondent and myself that the average Hindu is a coward.
('29', 176, 2, 9, 368642) How is he to be turned into a brave man?
('29', 176, 2, 10, 368683) Is he to become brave by muscular development or by developing the bravery of the soul?
('29', 176, 2, 11, 368771) My correspondent says,”The world has no place for the weak.” He means, I imagine,”physically weak”.
('29', 176, 2, 12, 368871) If so, the proposition is unsound.
('29', 176, 2, 13, 368906) There are many animals physically stronger than man and yet man lives.
('29', 176, 2, 14, 368977) Many muscular races have died out and some of them are even now in the process of dying out.
('29', 176, 2, 15, 369070) The proposition should therefore be, so far as man is concerned,”The world has no place for the weak in spirit.”
('29', 176, 3, 16, 369183) The die is cast for me.
('29', 176, 3, 17, 369207) The common factor of all religions is non violence.
('29', 176, 3, 18, 369259) Some inculcate more of it than others, all agree that you can never have too much of it.
('29', 176, 3, 19, 369348) We must be sure, however, that it is non violence and not a cloak for cowardice.
('29', 176, 4, 20, 369429) Now in order to arrive at a solution we must not think of the man in the street.
('29', 176, 4, 21, 369510) We must think of ourselves who are behind the man in the street and pulling the strings.
('29', 176, 4, 22, 369599) Let us take care that we do nothing out of fear.
('29', 176, 4, 23, 369648) I hate duelling, but it has a romantic side to it.
('29', 176, 4, 24, 369699) I am engaged in bringing that side of it to the fore.
('29', 176, 4, 25, 369753) I would love to engage in a duel with the Big Brother.
('29', 176, 4, 26, 369808) When we are both satisfied that there is no chance of unity without bloodshed, and that even we two cannot agree to live in peace, I must then invite the Big Brother to a duel with me.
('29', 176, 4, 27, 369993) I know that he can twist me round his thick fingers and dash me to pieces.
('29', 176, 4, 28, 370068) That day Hinduism will be free.
('29', 176, 4, 29, 370100) Or, if he lets me kill him in spite of the strength of a giant, Islam in India will be free.
('29', 176, 4, 30, 370193) He will have atoned for all the bullying by the average Mussalman.
('29', 176, 4, 31, 370260) What I detest is the match between goondas of both the parties.
('29', 176, 4, 32, 370324) Any peace based upon such a trial of strength will turn to bitterness in the end.
('29', 176, 4, 33, 370406) The way to get rid of the Hindu cowardice is for the educated portion to fight the goondas.
('29', 176, 4, 34, 370498) We may use sticks and other clean weapons.
('29', 176, 4, 35, 370541) My ahimsa will allow the use of them.
('29', 176, 4, 36, 370579) We shall be killed in the fight.
('29', 176, 4, 37, 370612) But that will chasten both the Hindus and the Mussalmans.
('29', 177, 0, 1, 370670) 178 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('29', 177, 1, 2, 370712) That would remove the Hindu cowardice in a moment.
('29', 177, 1, 3, 370763) As things are going, each party will be the slaves of their own goondas.
('29', 177, 1, 4, 370836) That means dominance of the military power.
('29', 177, 1, 5, 370880) England fought for the predominance of the civil power and won and lived.
('29', 177, 1, 6, 370954) Lord Curzon did much harm to us.
('29', 177, 1, 7, 370987) But he was certainly brave and right when he stood out for the predominance of civil authority.
('29', 177, 1, 8, 371083) When Rome passed into the hands of the soldiers, it fell.

('29', 177, 1, 10, 371248) Confining myself, therefore, for the present to the Hindus, I must respectfully but earnestly warn the thinking Hindus against relying upon the assistance of goondas for the protection of their temples, themselves and their wives and children.
('29', 177, 1, 11, 371492) With the weak bodies they have, they must be determined to stand at their post and to die fighting or without fighting.

('29', 177, 1, 19, 372098) I have offered to arbitrate singly or in company.
('29', 177, 1, 20, 372148) They have not yet repelled my advances.
('29', 177, 1, 21, 372188) There is no authentic story of the unfortunate trouble.
('29', 177, 1, 22, 372244) I must refuse to lose my head.
('29', 177, 1, 23, 372275) I am not satisfied that the Mussalmans alone are to blame for everything in every place.
('29', 177, 1, 24, 372364) I do not know what was the first cause.
('29', 177, 1, 25, 372404) I do know that an unscrupulous Press on either side is today poisoning the minds of the simple Hindus and the simple Mussalmans.
('29', 177, 1, 26, 372533) I do know also that more poison is being spread in private conversations, and incidents are exaggerated beyond all recognition.
('29', 177, 1, 27, 372661) I am going to leave no stone unturned to reach the bottom of this sea of darkness, doubt and despair.
('29', 177, 1, 28, 372763) A true statement of facts to date is the preliminary indispensable to a correct solution of the tension that threatens to paralyse all healthy public activity.
('29', 177, 1, 29, 372923) My intense desire to reach a solution of the trouble is not the least among the causes that have impelled me to a complete surrender to the Swarajists and all concerned.

('29', 178, 1, 2, 373164) 131. AN EXPLANATION
('29', 178, 2, 3, 373184) Some Mussalman friends of Delhi have been to me and ex pressed their surprise at my saying in Young India of August 21 that there was a Mussalman organization at the back of the desecration of Hindu temples and that these desecrations were unprovoked.
('29', 178, 2, 4, 373436) The friends tell me that my statement about organisation has been interpreted to mean an organization on behalf of Mussalmans as a community, and that about provocation to mean provocation of any kind whatsoever.
('29', 178, 2, 5, 373649) I told my visitors that by an organization I did not mean an organization formed or instigated by the Mussalman community, but an organization of some individuals.
('29', 178, 2, 6, 373813) I had no data to say how many.
('29', 178, 2, 7, 373844) These friends told me, as Hakim Sahib and Maulana Mahomed Ali had told me on my arrival in Delhi, that they knew of no such organization and that, had there been any, they should know it.
('29', 178, 2, 8, 374032) I told them that, whilst their repudiation shook my confidence in my statement, I was not prepared to dismiss from my mind the idea of an organization of the kind mentioned by me.
('29', 178, 2, 9, 374212) So many informants, including Mussalmans, had told me about it before the recent desecrations.
('29', 178, 2, 10, 374307) When they happened, I could not but come to the conclusion that they were not the chance work of frenzy, but that they took that particular shape by reason of organized instigation.
('29', 178, 2, 11, 374489) I should be glad to find that I was totally mistaken, and as soon as I was convinced of my error of judgement, I should readily make the needed correction.
('29', 178, 2, 12, 374645) It has been suggested that the organization might well be from a Government agency.
('29', 178, 2, 13, 374729) I said I was not prepared to deny the Government’s share in these disturbances.
('29', 178, 2, 14, 374809) I should certainly not be surprised to discover that the directing mind was Government agency.
('29', 178, 2, 15, 374904) As for provocation, the Young India writing, I told my visitors, quite clearly showed that I had referred to provocation in kind.
('29', 178, 2, 16, 375034) It says,”Presumption is against such provocation.
('29', 178, 2, 17, 375084) The desecration in Multan was an unprovoked act.
('29', 178, 2, 18, 375133) I have been trying to find proof for the allegations about Hindu desecration in the places referred to in my article on Hindu Muslim tension, but I have failed to receive any proof in support of them.” My visitors produced before me a Hyderabad Journal which is
('29', 179, 0, 1, 375395) 180 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('29', 179, 1, 2, 375437) said to hold that there was such Hindu provocation.
('29', 179, 1, 3, 375489) If it could be proved, whilst I would still hold under every conceivable circumstance desecration of temples and equally of mosques to be unjustified from my point of view, I admitted that my condemnation would lose much of its force.
('29', 179, 1, 4, 375724) I should be deeply hurt and ashamed, if the alleged Hindu desecration in Gulburga was found to be true.
('29', 179, 1, 5, 375828) My Visitors next asked me whether there was not a counter organisation on the part of Hindus.
('29', 179, 1, 6, 375922) I told them I know of no Hindu organization instigating desecration of mosques, but I did see that there was an organization of some Hindus, not an inconsiderable number, who were bent on provoking, writing insultingly of Islam and grossly exaggerating Mussalman misdeeds.
('29', 179, 1, 7, 376195) This was unpardonable.
('29', 179, 1, 8, 376218) In this respect, however, both parties were equally to blame.
('29', 179, 1, 9, 376280) The business of every well wisher of the country was to condemn those parties who promoted mischief and to leave no stone unturned to stop it.
('29', 179, 1, 10, 376423) I told my visitors that, if I was permitted and assisted whole heartedly by both the sections, I was prepared, singly if necessary and assisted if possible by colleagues, to conduct an inquiry and find out who started the mischief, how it spread and how it could be remedied.
('29', 179, 2, 11, 376699) Young India, 18 9 1924
('29', 179, 3, 12, 376722) 132. STATEMENT ANNOUNCING 21 DAY FAST 1
('29', 179, 4, 13, 376762) September 18, 1924
('29', 179, 5, 14, 376781) The following is the statement which Mr. Gandhi issued on September 18, at Delhi in announcing his fast of 21 days.
('29', 179, 5, 15, 376897) The recent events have proved unbearable for me.
('29', 179, 5, 16, 376946) My helplessness is still more unbearable.
('29', 179, 5, 17, 376988) My religion teaches me that whenever there is distress which one cannot remove, one must fast and pray.
('29', 179, 5, 18, 377092) I have done so in connection with my own dearest ones.
('29', 179, 5, 19, 377147) Nothing evidently that I say or write can bring the two communities together.
('29', 179, 5, 20, 377225) I am therefore imposing on myself a fast of 21 days commencing from today and ending on Wednesday, October 8. I reserve the liberty to drink water with or without salt.
('29', 179, 5, 21, 377394) It is both a penance and a prayer.
('29', 179, 5, 22, 377429) As penance I need not have taken the public into my
('29', 179, 6, 23, 377481) 1 This was communicated to the Associated Press of India by Gandhiji’s private secretary at 2 o’clock in the morning.
('29', 180, 0, 1, 377599) VOL. 29 : 16 AUGUST, 1924 26 DECEMBER, 1924 181
('29', 180, 1, 2, 377647) confidence, but I publish the fast as (let me hope) an effective prayer both to Hindus and Mussalmans, who have hitherto worked in unison, not to commit suicide.
('29', 180, 1, 3, 377809) I respectfully invite the heads of all the communities, including Englishmen, to meet and end this quarrel which is a disgrace to religion and to humanity.
('29', 180, 1, 4, 377965) It seems as if God has been dethroned.
('29', 180, 1, 5, 378004) Let us reinstate Him in our hearts.

('29', 183, 5, 10, 381665) 138. DISCUSSION WITH MAHADEV DESAI 2
('29', 183, 6, 11, 381702) [September 18, 1924] 3
('29', 183, 7, 12, 381725) We, who were privileged to be with Gandhiji, when he took that momentous decision to fast for 21 days, were also privileged to engage him in long discussions during the first week of the fast and my article produces the substance of two important conversations—one with me and one with Maulana Shaukat Ali 4. [GANDHIJI:] Do you see the meaning of my fast on account of the Bombay and Chauri Chaura incidents 5
('29', 183, 8, 13, 382135) [MAHADEV DESAI:] Yes.
('29', 183, 8, 14, 382157) Then why cannot you see the meaning of this fast?
('29', 183, 9, 15, 382207) [M.D.] There you fasted by way of penance for what you thought was a crime committed by you.
('29', 183, 9, 16, 382300) There is no such thing here.
('29', 183, 9, 17, 382329) There is not the semblance of an offence that may be attributed to you.
('29', 183, 9, 18, 382401) What a misconception!
('29', 183, 9, 19, 382423) In Chauri Chaura the culprits were those who had never seen me, never known me.
('29', 183, 9, 20, 382503) Today the culprits are those who know me and even profess to love me.
('29', 183, 10, 21, 382573) [M.D.] Shaukat Ali and Mahomed Ali are trying their best to quench the

('29', 184, 1, 2, 383019) conflagration.

('29', 184, 2, 14, 383624) My error!
('29', 184, 2, 15, 383634) Why, I may be charged with having committed a breach of faith with the Hindus.

('29', 192, 1, 9, 400966) After I have fasted and prayed I shall be all the stronger, with all my reverence for Islam, to appeal to both the communities.
('29', 192, 1, 10, 401094) It is my own firm belief that the strength of the soul grows in proportion as you subdue the flesh.
('29', 192, 1, 11, 401194) We have to fight hooliganism and we are not sufficiently spiritually strong to fight it.
('29', 192, 2, 12, 401283) At this point Shaukat Ali changed the line of his argument.
('29', 192, 2, 13, 401343) [S.A.] Are you not even bound to consider what a shock it will be to the country, this long fast of yours?
('29', 192, 2, 14, 401450) For man so often deceives himself !
('29', 192, 2, 15, 401486) He often does things to please others, which he should have avoided.
('29', 192, 2, 16, 401555) Religion therefore teaches him to stand before the world after having taken a particular resolve.
('29', 192, 2, 17, 401653) What vanity, to think that the world would be shocked at one’s own great penance!
('29', 192, 2, 18, 401735) And whose wishes are we to consider?
('29', 192, 2, 19, 401772) There would be no limit.
('29', 192, 2, 20, 401797) Had Rama stopped to consult and argue, he would never have gone on vanavasa and rid the earth of its suffering.
('29', 192, 2, 21, 401909) He awaited for no one’s advice.
('29', 192, 2, 22, 401941) He went forth.
('29', 192, 2, 23, 401956) For he prized his plighted word more than his life.
('29', 192, 2, 24, 402008) Only he can take great resolves who has indomitable faith in God and has fear of God.
('29', 192, 3, 25, 402094) [S.A.] One more question.
('29', 192, 3, 26, 402120) Do you need to consult no one before arriving at such a decision?
('29', 192, 3, 27, 402186) You need not even take into consideration the effect it would have on your health or body?
('29', 192, 3, 28, 402277) It is a matter between me and my Maker.
('29', 192, 3, 29, 402317) And if I must con sult someone, I had better not to take a vow at all.
('29', 192, 3, 30, 402388) You talk of the effect on my health and body?
('29', 192, 3, 31, 402434) Well, if I am too weak to stand it I may die.
('29', 192, 3, 32, 402480) What is the body worth?
('29', 192, 3, 33, 402504) Whilst I was in jail I read with rapturous delight the lives of the Companions of the Prophet.
('29', 192, 3, 34, 402599) There is a story that Hazarat Umar sent a present of 500 dinars to someone.
('29', 192, 3, 35, 402675) He shrank from it, and began to cry.
('29', 192, 3, 36, 402712) His wife asked him he was crying.
('29', 192, 3, 37, 402746) He said,”Maya—unreality—has come to me.
('29', 192, 3, 38, 402786) What will happen to me?” The dinars were a present from such a holy man as Hazrat Umar.
('29', 192, 3, 39, 402874) But he shrank from it because it was unreal, evanescent.
('29', 192, 3, 40, 402931) And so is life.
('29', 193, 0, 1, 402947) 194 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('29', 193, 1, 2, 402989) God keep this body if He has still to make some use of it.
('29', 193, 1, 3, 403048) Let it perish if it has fulfilled His purpose.
('29', 193, 1, 4, 403095) In fact, I had thought of going on a permanent vow of fasting if matters did not improve after the fast terminated.
('29', 193, 1, 5, 403211) Hakimji asked me not to think of it.”How can I cast it out of my mind?” said I. It is in my bones, it is part of my very being.
('29', 193, 1, 6, 403339) I would ask Mussalmans to befriend the Hindus, if they think it is not contrary to their religion.
('29', 193, 1, 7, 403438) If they think and tell me it is contrary to their religion, then I am sure I should have no cause to live any more.
('29', 193, 1, 8, 403554) I should die.
('29', 193, 1, 9, 403568) I had a plain talk with Khwaja Hassan Nizami Sahib also the other day.
('29', 193, 1, 10, 403639) I told him,”Why do you try to convert the waifs and strays and the untouchables?
('29', 193, 1, 11, 403720) Better convert me, so that after I am converted, many more might follow me.
('29', 193, 1, 12, 403796) If those poor people embrace Islam, they will not do so because they understand the beauty of Islam, but for other reasons.
('29', 193, 1, 13, 403920) Islam will not be a whit richer for them.”
('29', 193, 2, 14, 403963) It was an impressive dialogue.
('29', 193, 2, 15, 403994) I have not even done bare justice to it.
('29', 193, 2, 16, 404035) Shaukat Ali seemed quite overpowered.
('29', 193, 2, 17, 404073) As he rose he said,”Three things I pray for every day; the first is Hindu Muslim unity; the second, that my mother may live to see Islam and India free; the third, that Mahatma Gandhi’s mission may be fulfilled.” Young India, 23 10 1924

('29', 194, 1, 2, 404948) 146. NOTES
('29', 194, 2, 3, 404959) September 20, 1924
('29', 194, 3, 4, 404978) SPINNING MONTH BY MONTH
('29', 194, 4, 5, 405002) From 2,780 to 4,908 is not a bad rise in one month in the number of spinners.
('29', 194, 4, 6, 405080) The reader will note that the rise is appreciable in the number of members as well as non members.
('29', 194, 4, 7, 405179) Gujarat still holds the first place.
('29', 194, 4, 8, 405216) But Andhra is evidently running a close race.
('29', 194, 4, 9, 405262) Karnatak’s jump from 41 to 362, and Tamilnad’s from 90 to 456 is distinctly encouraging.
('29', 194, 4, 10, 405351) As a matter of fact Karnatak should come first class, seeing that Karnatak is to have the honour of having the Congress session this year.
('29', 194, 4, 11, 405490) More returns for the month have still to come, and they should show a distinct rise.
('29', 194, 4, 12, 405575) If the progress continues at this rate, we should soon have a respectable total.
('29', 194, 4, 13, 405656) The reader will understand that these totals are by no means exhaustive of all the voluntary spinners.
('29', 194, 4, 14, 405759) The number of irregular voluntary spinners is at least double the number of regular spinners.
('29', 194, 4, 15, 405853) And naturally these totals take no note of thousands of paid spinners.
('29', 194, 4, 16, 405924) If only those who have began regular spinning continue at least till we have attained swaraj (and this is by no means an immoderate expectation), we are bound to hasten its advent.
('29', 194, 5, 17, 406105) THE PRESTDENT’S PRIZE
('29', 194, 6, 18, 406127) Maulana Mahomed Ali on whom spinning is daily growing and who has been spinning even while conducting public business for hours sometimes, and who insisted, for the sake of finishing 2,000 yards for the past spinning month, on spinning till midnight, has asked me to announce a prize of five substantial charkhas to the province that would beat Gujarat during his term of office.
('29', 194, 6, 19, 406507) He intends that these charkhas might be presented to the most deserving poor spinners of the winning province.
('29', 194, 6, 20, 406618) The wheels would be after the latest Sabarmati pattern.
('29', 194, 6, 21, 406674) It is hard task to beat Gujarat in a spinning competition so far as the number of spinners and the quantity of yarn are concerned.
('29', 194, 6, 22, 406805) Bengal, Karnatak, Andhra, Tamilnad may beat Gujarat as to fineness of yarn; but Gujarat will not take a beating lightly as to the number of voluntary spinners and even less as to quantity.
('29', 194, 6, 23, 406994) But as the Maulana’s prize is confined to the number of spinners, so far as I can judge, the pressure of competition is likely to be felt from
('29', 195, 0, 1, 407137) 196 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('29', 195, 1, 2, 407179) Andhra, Bengal, Tamilnad and Karnatak.
('29', 195, 1, 3, 407218) I hope that the Congressmen will not consider the value of the prize, but will appreciate the fact of the President of the Congress awarding it.
('29', 195, 1, 4, 407363) I would like the competition to be serious and effective.
('29', 195, 1, 5, 407421) There are only three months for winning the prize.
('29', 195, 1, 6, 407472) If all the provinces will make an effort, I know that it would give the greatest satisfaction to the Maulana Saheb, for he has realized the national importance of voluntary spinning.
('29', 195, 1, 7, 407655) He takes the keenest delight in showing the specimens of his yarn and making daily improvement in the evenness and fineness of his production.

('29', 196, 1, 2, 408336) 148. LETTER TO VASUMATI PAND1T
('29', 196, 2, 3, 408367) Bhadarva Vad 7 [September 20, 1924] 1
('29', 196, 3, 4, 408405) VASUMATI,
('29', 196, 4, 5, 408415) My fast is for 21 days.
('29', 196, 4, 6, 408439) It began on Wednesday so today is the third day.
('29', 196, 4, 7, 408488) It will end on Wednesday, 8th October.
('29', 196, 4, 8, 408527) I undertook the fast because without it it was impossible to meet the demands of duty.
('29', 196, 4, 9, 408614) Hence you should not worry.
('29', 196, 4, 10, 408642) I am enjoying perfect peace.
('29', 196, 4, 11, 408671) You should not think of running down to me either.
('29', 196, 4, 12, 408722) You may come during the third week.

('29', 196, 4, 14, 408834) It should be so [on the address].
('29', 196, 4, 15, 408868) You will never cease to be a daughter to me.
('29', 196, 4, 16, 408913) I have forgotten what I used to write to you when you were at Deolali.
('29', 196, 4, 17, 408984) There is no harm in bathing immediately after taking a hip bath.
('29', 196, 4, 18, 409049) Try another experiment.
('29', 196, 4, 19, 409073) Buy a small yellow bottle.
('29', 196, 4, 20, 409100) Fill it with clean water and put it in the sun for three hours.
('29', 196, 4, 21, 409164) Drink two ounces from it before going to sleep at night.
('29', 196, 4, 22, 409221) Make it a practice to drink this much water after it is heated in the sun.
('29', 196, 4, 23, 409296) You need not worry if the water has cooled down.
('29', 196, 4, 24, 409345) The idea is that the water absorbs the rays of the sun passing through the yellow medium.
('29', 196, 4, 25, 409435) It is said that the water treated in this way helps bowel movement.

('29', 197, 1, 2, 409699) 149. NOTE
('29', 197, 2, 3, 409709) September 21, 1924
('29', 197, 3, 4, 409728) HELPLESSNESS, NOT HOPELESSNESS
('29', 197, 4, 5, 409759) I observe that in my note on fasting I have been made to say 1 — ”My hopelessness is still more unbearable.” My statement mentions”helplessness” and not”hopelessness”.
('29', 197, 4, 6, 409927) A man with a grain of faith in God never loses hope, because he ever believes in the ultimate triumph of Truth.
('29', 197, 4, 7, 410039) A man of God never strives after untruth and therefore he can never lose hope.
('29', 197, 4, 8, 410118) On the contrary, his hope shines the brightest”amid the encircling gloom”.
('29', 197, 4, 9, 410193) But my helplessness is a very patent fact before me.
('29', 197, 4, 10, 410246) I may not ignore it.
('29', 197, 4, 11, 410267) I must ever confess it.
('29', 197, 4, 12, 410291) There is a beautiful Tamil proverb which says:”God is the sole help of the helpless.” The truth of this never came upon me with so much force as it has come today.
('29', 197, 4, 13, 410455) Handling large masses of men, dealing with them, speaking and acting for them is no joke for a man whose capacity God has so circumscribed.
('29', 197, 4, 14, 410595) One has, therefore, to be ever on the watch.
('29', 197, 4, 15, 410640) And the reader may rest assured that I took the final step after I had realized to the full my utter hopelessness.
('29', 197, 4, 16, 410755) And I cried out to God even like Draupadi when she seemed to be abandoned by her five brave protectors.
('29', 197, 4, 17, 410859) And her cry did not ascend to the throne of the Almighty in vain.
('29', 197, 4, 18, 410925) That cry must not be from the lip.
('29', 197, 4, 19, 410960) It has to be from the deepest recesses of one’s heart.
('29', 197, 4, 20, 411015) And, therefore, such a cry is only possible when one is in anguish.
('29', 197, 4, 21, 411083) Mine has expressed itself in a fast which is by no means adequate for the issues involved.
('29', 197, 4, 22, 411174) My heart continually says :
('29', 197, 5, 23, 411202) Rock of Ages cleft for me, Let me hide myself in Thee.
('29', 197, 6, 24, 411257) Young India, 25 9 1924
('29', 197, 7, 25, 411280) 1 Evidently some newspaper reproducing the”Statement Announcing Fast”, 18 9 1924, had printed”hopelessness instead of”helplessness”.
('29', 197, 7, 26, 411413) Vide”Letter to Devdas Gandhi”, 21 9 1924.
('29', 198, 0, 1, 411455) VOL. 29 : 16 AUGUST, 1924 26 DECEMBER, 1924 199
('29', 198, 1, 2, 411503) 150. THE HALF HOUR DRILL
('29', 198, 2, 3, 411528) September 21, 1924
('29', 198, 3, 4, 411547) As a humble soldier I have no right to resent anything my chief writes 1 or says about me.
('29', 198, 3, 5, 411638) What did Mahatma Gandhi mean, and what warrant had he, when he made an assertion that I was physically unable to sit down to spin for half an hour?
('29', 198, 3, 6, 411786) Any clean work that gives me liberty and makes me and my country free must command every ounce of energy in my big body.
('29', 198, 3, 7, 411907) I can and will spin not only for half an hour, but for the whole day, if it will break—as I know it will—the chains of slavery that bind us so tight.
('29', 198, 3, 8, 412057) My tutor in Bombay will certify that, during the four days that I was in Bombay, for the first three days I struggled over two hours on the wheel to spin a few feet of bad yarn.
('29', 198, 3, 9, 412235) On the third day I was better and, thank God, on the fourth I knew how to adjust the movements of my left hand with that of the right.
('29', 198, 3, 10, 412370) I cannot tell how proud I was to send a tola of yarn to the A.I.K.B. as my quota.
('29', 198, 3, 11, 412452) I see that it has drawn many witty remarks from friends.
('29', 198, 3, 12, 412509) The Zamindar said that a man weighing thousands of tolas sent only a solitary tola as the result of his
('29', 198, 4, 13, 412613) labours.
('29', 198, 4, 14, 412622) I appreciate the remark.
('29', 198, 4, 15, 412647) This month I was ordered to go and tour in Kathiawar.
('29', 198, 4, 16, 412701) To work in Kathiawar for a man of my reputation meant an obstacle race.
('29', 198, 4, 17, 412773) D.O. letters between the Political Agent and the State authorities were being exchanged profusely.
('29', 198, 4, 18, 412872) Add to this fatwas 2 and pamphlets flying
('29', 198, 5, 19, 412914) about asking people not to help a man whom they accused of being a Kaffir unbeliever and whom they accused of calling Gandhi his god and thus Blaspheming God Himself !
('29', 198, 5, 20, 413082) Under these circumstances, if I gave a tola of yarn along with silver twice my weight—for which I was deputed—I think I
('29', 198, 6, 21, 413202) acquitted myself not badly.
('29', 198, 7, 22, 413230) I was very happy to see and also to report to my chief lying on his Bed of Sorrow under my brother’s roof at Delhi, that just before leaving Bombay I called on Mrs. Naidu and that it did my heart good to see that, while lying on her sofa suffering from a bad heart, she was struggling with her spinning wheel, with a determination to learn it and do it regularly.
('29', 198, 7, 23, 413594) Shankerlal Banker would be glad that the whole of the Khilafat office spins, and Dr. Ansari is an expert spinner and does it whenever he can snatch a few minutes from his humanitarian work.
('29', 198, 7, 24, 413784) Every man and woman and child in India, Hindu or Muslim, Parsi or Christian, Sikh or Jew, rich or poor, who wants to join God’s army, must qualify himself or herself by half an hour’s drill on the spinning wheel.
('29', 198, 8, 25, 413997) 1 Vide”Notes”, 21 8 1924, sub title,”Ali Brothers’ Quota”.
('29', 198, 9, 26, 414056) 2 Decrees of a Muslim divine
('29', 199, 0, 1, 414085) 200 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('29', 199, 1, 2, 414127) SHAUKAT ALI
('29', 199, 2, 3, 414139) Khadim i Kaba
('29', 199, 3, 4, 414153) I rather like the rebuke administered to me by Maulana Shaukat Ali.
('29', 199, 3, 5, 414221) Although I am in the surrendering mood all along the line, I did not know that I would have to suffer the pangs of surrender even to the Big Brother.
('29', 199, 3, 6, 414371) I thought that his big and unwieldy body would not respond to the gentle art of spinning.
('29', 199, 3, 7, 414461) I tender my apology to him for my having underrated his ability for lighter labours.
('29', 199, 3, 8, 414546) I should be content to be humbled a thousand times on the Maulana’s conditions.
('29', 199, 3, 9, 414626) What is my humiliation if the country thereby gains?
('29', 199, 3, 10, 414679) And I count it no small gain to have an indignant repudiation from the Maulana that anybody should dare to excuse him for lighter labours because of his bulk.
('29', 199, 3, 11, 414838) No task is too light or too heavy for him, if thereby the country benefits.
('29', 199, 3, 12, 414914) I wish that every worker accepted that rigid test for himself.
('29', 199, 3, 13, 414977) The information given by the Maulana about the staff of the Khilafat office having set to work, Dr. Ansari having begun spinning in the midst of heavy, incessant professional calls upon his time must make Shankerlal Banker’s mouth water.
('29', 199, 3, 14, 415215) If this enthusiasm continues, I expect a splendid response from the Mussalmans.
('29', 199, 3, 15, 415295) It speaks volumes for the Maulana’s popularity that, in spite of the libellous leaflets to which he has referred, his Kathiawar tour brought to the coffers of the Khilafat Committee no less than 25,000 rupees in cash and promises of nearly ten thousand.
('29', 199, 3, 16, 415549) The writers of the leaflets do not know the basis of our connection.
('29', 199, 3, 17, 415618) Dissimilar in everything else, as I have already pointed out, there is one common bond between us.
('29', 199, 3, 18, 415717) We are both impatient of slavery.
('29', 199, 3, 19, 415751) We resent the curtailment of any human being’s legitimate liberty.
('29', 199, 3, 20, 415818) And therefore we have accepted the slavery of God.
('29', 199, 3, 21, 415869) In order that we may be able to look the whole of the human kind straight in the face and even oppose it, if necessary, we have become as clay in the Potter’s hands.
('29', 199, 3, 22, 416035) He can mould us as He will, crush us, toss us about, still we are His.
('29', 199, 3, 23, 416106) That is the only cement between us.
('29', 199, 3, 24, 416142) I admit that it is adhesive, and therefore binds us indissolubly.
('29', 199, 3, 25, 416208) To say, then, that the Maulana worships me as his God is not only, as he says, a blasphemy of the Almighty, but it betrays the grossest ignorance of us and our relations.
('29', 199, 4, 26, 416379) Young India, 25 9 1924
('29', 200, 0, 1, 416402) VOL. 29 : 16 AUGUST, 1924 26 DECEMBER, 1924 201
('29', 200, 1, 2, 416450) 151. OUR DUTY TO THEM
('29', 200, 2, 3, 416472) September, 21 1924
('29', 200, 3, 4, 416491) With an artist’s pen Mr. Andrews in his article 1 on the”Aboriginal Tribes” has combined three things.
('29', 200, 3, 5, 416594) He has supported the fervent appeal of Mr. A. V. Thakkar for funds for the Bhil Seva Mandal in the Panchmahals.
('29', 200, 3, 6, 416706) I heartily echo Mr. Andrews’ sentiments.
('29', 200, 3, 7, 416747) Mr. Thakkar needs no introduction from me.
('29', 200, 3, 8, 416790) He had dedicated himself to the service of the motherland long before my return to India and becoming a famous man.
('29', 200, 3, 9, 416906) His services in connection with the administration of famine relief organized by Gujarat for the help of the distressed in Orissa are still fresh in our memory.
('29', 200, 3, 10, 417067) He has endeared himself to the untouchables of Gujarat by his single minded devotion to their cause.
('29', 200, 3, 11, 417168) But his restless nature has found a class of people in Gujarat more submerged and therefore more in need of a lifting hand than the untouchables themselves.
('29', 200, 3, 12, 417325) He has therefore become the high priest of the simple Bhils of the Panchmahals.
('29', 200, 3, 13, 417405) I hope that Mr. Thakkar’s appeal will not fall upon deaf ears.
('29', 200, 3, 14, 417468) In speaking about the aboriginal tribes it was impossible for Mr. Andrews to omit the name of his friend, disciple and fellow worker, Willie Pearson.
('29', 200, 3, 15, 417618) He loses no opportunity of paying a well deserved tribute to the memory of one of the noblest of Englishmen who dedicated his all to the service of India.
('29', 200, 3, 16, 417773) When Mr. Gokhale 2 asked Mr. Andrews at a moment’s notice to go to the rescue of the satyagrahis of South Africa, Willie Pearson volunteered his services and accompanied Mr. Andrews to South Africa.
('29', 200, 3, 17, 417972) For me it was love at first sight between these Englishmen and myself.
('29', 200, 3, 18, 418043) Pearson’s noble features with the frank benign and bewitching expression in his eyes rise before me as I dictate these lines.
('29', 200, 3, 19, 418169) I saw Pearson at work in South Africa and again at Shantiniketan.
('29', 200, 3, 20, 418235) More selflessness and more devotion to duty it would be difficult to find.
('29', 200, 3, 21, 418310) No honest toil was beneath Pearson’s dignity.
('29', 200, 3, 22, 418356) For him the lower the work was, the greater was the dignity.
('29', 200, 3, 23, 418417) He was the first at Shantiniketan to volunteer his services for cleaning the drains of its kitchen and the scavengers’
('29', 200, 4, 24, 418536) 1 In Young India, 2 10 1924 2 G. K. Gokhale (1866 1915); founder of the Servants of India Society; President, Indian National Congress at Banaras in 1905
('29', 201, 0, 1, 418690) 202 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('29', 201, 1, 2, 418732) quarters.
('29', 201, 1, 3, 418742) Pearson’s work was no less heroic, because it was non political in the conventional sense of the term.
('29', 201, 1, 4, 418845) Let it be remembered, however, that whilst in Japan Pearson wrote his furious indictment against British exploitation and dominance which brought him trouble which he never minded.
('29', 201, 1, 5, 419026) Whilst he was lying on his death bed, he dictated a will in which he did not forget a boy in Shantiniketan whom he loved as dearly as his own son.
('29', 201, 1, 6, 419173) On his death the Poet issued an appeal for 25,000 rupees to perpetuate his memory.
('29', 201, 1, 7, 419256) The money was to be devoted to build a Pearson Hospital in Shantiniketan.
('29', 201, 1, 8, 419330) When I was taking my convalescence at Juhu, and Andrews had appointed himself as my guardian angel, with a heart full of love and sorrow, he told me that there was very poor response to the Poet’s appeal.
('29', 201, 1, 9, 419535) I soothed him by saying that after all Pearson was not much known to the Indian public, and that therefore we who knew him so well ought not to fret for want of their support or feel uncharitable towards them.
('29', 201, 1, 10, 419745) I told him too that, when I found a natural occasion, I would take up the Poet’s appeal and try to enlist the support of the public for the memorial.
('29', 201, 1, 11, 419895) Mr. Andrews has given me the opportunity.
('29', 201, 1, 12, 419937) I now invite the readers of Young India to contribute their mite.
('29', 201, 1, 13, 420003) Over three thousand rupees have been collected.
('29', 201, 1, 14, 420051) Twenty one thousand rupees is nothing for the generous public to find.
('29', 201, 2, 15, 420122) The third thing Mr. Andrews has brought in is the spinning wheel, probably for my sake.
('29', 201, 2, 16, 420210) But I know that a time is coming when that simple wheel will no longer have to depend upon me for its existence.
('29', 201, 2, 17, 420323) The highest in the land who feel for the poor will be bound to support it.
('29', 201, 2, 18, 420398) There is only one thing which can be universally adopted in India and be yet paying so as to supplement the slender resources of the peasantry and even find enough to keep body and soul together for the starving millions.
('29', 201, 2, 19, 420620) The wheel is the one thing which can replace the degrading doles from the rich people for the famine stricken, and let them feel sure that they need not starve so long as they are prepared to spin.
('29', 201, 3, 20, 420818) Young India, 2 10 1924
