('29', 327, 1, 2, 659517) principles.
('29', 327, 1, 3, 659529) Swarajists claim to be a growing body.
('29', 327, 1, 4, 659568) That they have made an impression on the Government cannot be gainsaid.
('29', 327, 1, 5, 659640) Opinions may differ as to its value but it is not possible to question the fact itself.
('29', 327, 1, 6, 659728) They have shown determination, grit, discipline and cohesion and have not feared to carry their policy to the point of defiance.
('29', 327, 1, 7, 659857) Once assume the desirability of entering Councils and it must be admitted that they have introduced a new spirit into the Indian Legislatures.
('29', 327, 1, 8, 660000) That their very brilliance takes the nation’s mind away from itself is to one like me regrettable, but so long as our ablest men continue to believe in Council entry, we must make the best of the Legislatures.
('29', 327, 1, 9, 660210) Though an uncompromising No changer, I must not only tolerate their attitude and work with them, but I must even strengthen them wherever I can.
('29', 327, 1, 10, 660355) If they will not decide matters of important differences by means of the vote, the No changers can carry on Congress work only by mutual consent and forbearance unless, not wishing to fight, they will retire from Congress control altogether.
('29', 327, 1, 11, 660597) It is recognized that neither party can do without the other.
('29', 327, 1, 12, 660659) Both occupy an important position in the country.
('29', 327, 1, 13, 660709) The Congress was weakened by the secession of the Liberals and the Besantites.
('29', 327, 1, 14, 660788) The cleavage was inevitable because they were opposed to non co operation on principle.
('29', 327, 1, 15, 660876) We must avoid further cleavage if it is at all possible.
('29', 327, 1, 16, 660933) We must not lightly set up as principle mere matters of opinion and engage in pitched battles over them.
('29', 327, 1, 17, 661038) If the non co operation programme is suspended, as I feel sure it must be, it follows as a natural corollary that the Swaraj Party should have no odium attached to its activity.
('29', 327, 1, 18, 661216) It is beside the purpose to say or examine what would have happened if the Congressmen had never thought of the Councils.
('29', 327, 1, 19, 661338) We have to take the situation as it stands today and suit ourselves to it or make it suit us, if that is possible.
('29', 327, 1, 20, 661453) Lastly, the Bengal situation demanded that No changers gave the Swaraj Party the strongest support that it was in their power to give.
('29', 327, 1, 21, 661588) “But”, said some of the No changers and others to me,”how can you subscribe to a document which says that the Government have really attacked the Swaraj Party and not the anarchists?
('29', 327, 1, 22, 661771) Are you not unjust to the Government?” This attitude pleased me and flattered me.
('29', 327, 1, 23, 661853) It pleased me to notice in my questioners a sincere desire to do justice to a government they do not like.
('29', 327, 1, 24, 661960) It flattered my pride in that my questioners expected from me exact judgment and fullest justice.
('29', 328, 0, 1, 662058) VOL. 29 : 16 AUGUST, 1924 26 DECEMBER, 1924 329
('29', 328, 1, 2, 662106) confessed to them that I had against the Government the greatest prejudice based on past experience, that the writings in the British and British owned Indian Press had prepared me for an attack on the Swaraj Party, that it was the declared policy of the Government to lop off”tall poppies” and that whilst it was possible that among the arrested there may be some with anarchical tendencies, it was nevertheless a fact that the vast majority of them were Swarajists and that if it was a fact, as the Government contended, that the anarchists were a large party, it was curious that the Government could find in the main only Swarajists to lay their hands upon.
('29', 328, 1, 3, 662768) I told them further that if there was an extensive and active anarchical organization, the fiercest spirits were likely to be outside the Swaraj Party rather than inside it, that no arms, it is said, were found by the police during their night search.
('29', 328, 1, 4, 663020) Nothing that my questioners told me in reply shook my belief and I am inclined to think that if I did not bring my questioners round to my belief, I at least convinced them that I had good grounds for my opinion and that the burden lay upon the Government to show that they had no designs upon the Swaraj Party in Bengal.
('29', 328, 2, 5, 663342) But the proposed suspension does not affect the individual non co operators.
('29', 328, 2, 6, 663419) They are not only entitled to hold to their views but would be very little worth if they gave up their personal on co operation.
('29', 328, 2, 7, 663548) For instance, suspension of the non co operation programme cannot mean for me recall of my medals or resumption of practice or sending my children to Government schools.
('29', 328, 2, 8, 663718) Thus, whilst suspension will leave a convinced non co operator free to retain his non co operation, for those who took up non co operation only as a policy and in obedience to the Congress call, it makes it open, if they like, to recall their non co operation without the slightest stigma attaching to their so doing.
('29', 328, 2, 9, 664036) Further, if suspension is agreed upon it is not open to any Congressman as such to preach non co operation as part of the Congress policy or programme.
('29', 328, 2, 10, 664188) On the other hand it is open to him if he so chooses to dissuade people from taking up non co operation during the period of suspension.
('29', 328, 3, 11, 664325) Then there is the spinning franchise.
('29', 328, 3, 12, 664363) I wanted much more khaddar on all occasions and spinning 2,000 yards per month by all Congressmen except in case of illness or like disability.
('29', 328, 3, 13, 664507) This has been watered down to wearing khaddar on political occasions and Congress business and spinning by deputy even for unwillingness.
('29', 328, 3, 14, 664645) But here again it was not possible for me to insist up to the breaking point.
('29', 329, 0, 1, 664723) 330 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('29', 329, 1, 2, 664765) the first place the Maharashtra party had constitutional difficulty in agreeing to spinning or wearing khaddar being part of the franchise at all, and in the second place the Swaraj Party as a body does not attach the same importance either to the wearing of khaddar or to hand spinning.
('29', 329, 1, 3, 665053) It does not consider them to be indispensable as I do either for the attainment of swaraj or for the exclusion of foreign cloth.
('29', 329, 1, 4, 665182) It was, therefore, from their standpoint, a tremendous concession to have agreed 1 to make khaddar and hand spinning part of the franchise even in the modified form.
('29', 329, 1, 5, 665348) I, therefore, gratefully acknowledge the concession they have made for the sake of unity.
('29', 329, 1, 6, 665438) Let those who are disposed to grumble at the modification remember that it is a great advance to rise from the nominal four anna franchise to a tangible and effective franchise that requires every Congressman to testify his belief in the desirability of making India self supporting so far as her clothing requirements are concerned and that too by reviving the old Indian industry of hand spinning and thus distributing wealth where it is most needed.
('29', 329, 2, 7, 665891) It has been urged that everybody will take advantage of the relaxation and the idea of spinning as sacrifice will break down and that the wearing of khaddar will be confined only to political occasions and Congress business.
('29', 329, 2, 8, 666116) I should be sorry if such an untoward result were to follow the modification.
('29', 329, 2, 9, 666194) Those who fear such disaster seem to forget that spinning by every Congressman was as yet a mere idea of one man.
('29', 329, 2, 10, 666308) He has now resigned himself to a modification of his proposal.
('29', 329, 2, 11, 666371) Surely, therefore, the embodiment in the franchise of the idea even in a modified form is a distinct gain and must increase the number of wearers of khaddar and voluntary spinners.
('29', 329, 3, 12, 666552) Moreover it must be remembered that it is one thing to embody reforms in recommendatory or even obligatory resolutions; it is totally another thing to make them part of franchise.
('29', 329, 3, 13, 666732) Any test for franchise should have no vagueness about it and should be easily capable of being carried out.
('29', 329, 3, 14, 666840) For, inability to carry it out means disfranchisement.
('29', 329, 3, 15, 666895) The wearing of khaddar on all occasions and for all purposes may not be possible even for the best of us.
('29', 329, 4, 16, 667001) In practice, however, it will be found that the vast majority of us who can ill afford a variety of costumes will find it necessary to wear
('29', 329, 5, 17, 667141) 1 The source has”to their agreeing”.

('29', 330, 1, 2, 667226) khaddar on all occasions, if we have to wear it on all Congress occasions.
('29', 330, 1, 3, 667301) For an ardent Congressman every occasion is a Congress occasion and he or she would be an indifferent Congressman or Congresswoman who has no Congress work during consecutive twenty four hours.
('29', 330, 1, 4, 667495) We should have on our roll thousands of voters or original members.

('29', 330, 4, 19, 669202) HOW TO WORK
('29', 330, 5, 20, 669214) In these notes I propose to take up the agreement between the Swaraj Party and myself where I have left it in the leading article.

('29', 331, 1, 2, 669414) recommendation is accepted by the forthcoming meeting, it means revolutionizing the Congress organization and turning the members from being merely vote registering machines once or twice a year into day to day workers and contributing materially to the chief national activity.
('29', 331, 1, 3, 669693) It will make the Congress a huge manufacturing and receiving and distributing depot.
('29', 331, 1, 4, 669778) The work cannot he organized without method, industry, punctuality, patriotism, self sacrifice and strictest honesty and the required skill.
('29', 331, 1, 5, 669919) Though anybody can become a Congress member by paying four annas till the Congress accepts the proposal, if the forthcoming meeting approves of the proposals every province must begin to organize as if the franchise was accepted by the Congress.
('29', 331, 1, 6, 670165) That is to say, propaganda must be carried on among the existing members advising them of the proposed change and providing them with the necessary facility for learning spinning and procuring the wheel, etc.
('29', 331, 1, 7, 670374) The question will have to be considered as to how the yarn is to be collected and how disposed of.
('29', 331, 1, 8, 670473) Without any Congress resolution, save the one applicable to members of Congress executives, and by simple exhortation through these columns we have today over seven thousand men and women spinning voluntarily.
('29', 331, 1, 9, 670683) Their number is on the increase.
('29', 331, 1, 10, 670716) It is, therefore, reasonable to suppose that when and if the Congress accepts the franchise proposal we should be able to reach at least one hundred thousand in a few months.
('29', 331, 1, 11, 670891) Assuming the average output of yarn to be 5 tolas of 20 counts per month per member it would mean 312.5 maunds of yarn per month or 12,500 dhotis or saris, 45 inches in width and 6 yards in length.
('29', 331, 1, 12, 671089) And when we remember that labour on the material up to spinning is to be free, the dhotis must compete with any similar article on the market.
('29', 331, 1, 13, 671232) If only the nation could concentrate all effort on this one national work, exclusion of foreign cloth can be achieved without the slightest difficulty and by means the most honourable and non violent.

('29', 332, 0, 1, 671915) VOL. 29 : 16 AUGUST, 1924 26 DECEMBER, 1924 333
('29', 332, 1, 2, 671963) meeting has also to frame an effective policy in answer to the Bengal repression.
('29', 332, 1, 3, 672045) Whatever our differences as to the method of reaching our goal, there are no two opinions about the desirability of ending the exercise of arbitrary powers.
('29', 332, 2, 4, 672202) There is no freedom for India so long as one man, no matter how highly placed he may be, holds in the hollow of his hands the life, property and honour of millions of human beings.
('29', 332, 2, 5, 672383) It is an artificial, unnatural and uncivilized institution.
('29', 332, 2, 6, 672443) The end of it is an essential preliminary to swaraj.
('29', 332, 3, 7, 672496) OUR HELPLESSNESS
('29', 332, 4, 8, 672513) This is apparent.
('29', 332, 4, 9, 672531) We seem to have lost all power beyond passing resolutions.
('29', 332, 4, 10, 672590) But if we could all unite on the constructive programme, it will by itself be a step towards regaining self confidence and power of action.
('29', 332, 4, 11, 672730) It must be clear to everyone that if Hindus and Mussalmans regain their senses, if Hindus treat untouchables as their brothers and if we have so popularized spinning and khaddar as to be within easy reach of exclusion of foreign cloth, we should not need to do any more to command attention to our will.
('29', 332, 4, 12, 673034) What is more, we should need neither secret societies for the promotion of violence nor open non violent disobedience.
('29', 332, 4, 13, 673153) Such a desirable consummation can be effected only by united, determined and ceaseless pursuit of the constructive programme.
('29', 332, 4, 14, 673279) That, therefore, is my method of effective reply to the volcanic eruption of repression or the chronic and helpless subordination of a whole nation.
('29', 332, 5, 15, 673428) OTHER THINGS?
('29', 332, 6, 16, 673442) Mr. Andrews drew my attention even during my fast to a note in the Modern Review expressing surprise at the omission from the constructive programme of the movement for abstinence from intoxicating drinks and drugs.
('29', 332, 6, 17, 673658) Other friends drew attention much earlier to the omission of reference to national schools.
('29', 332, 6, 18, 673750) I may inform these friends that the constructive programme that forms part of the agreement contains only those items without which swaraj appears to me to be an impossibility.
('29', 332, 6, 19, 673927) Unaided and unaffiliated national schools are there and they must be maintained.
('29', 332, 6, 20, 674008) They help us to carry the programme through.
('29', 332, 6, 21, 674053) A drink and drugs reform is silently but surely going on.
('29', 332, 6, 22, 674111) It cannot be given up.
('29', 332, 6, 23, 674134) One sees no excitement about it because we have done away with picketing as it led to violence.
('29', 332, 6, 24, 674230) Nor for that matter are we going to give up the idea of
('29', 333, 0, 1, 674286) 334 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('29', 333, 1, 2, 674328) promoting private arbitrations.
('29', 333, 1, 3, 674360) Only, none of these things is absolutely essential for achieving swaraj in the sense in which the three items included in the agreement are.
('29', 333, 1, 4, 674501) Nor is there any difference of opinion among national workers on these as there is on the three items.
('29', 333, 1, 5, 674604) In mentioning national schools and private arbitration in the same breath as the drink and drugs reform, I do not wish to be understood to give the same value to them.
('29', 333, 1, 6, 674772) The drink and drugs reform is a problem of the highest national importance.
('29', 333, 1, 7, 674848) If by any honest means we could be wholly free today from the drink and the opium evils, I should adopt and advise them now.
('29', 333, 1, 8, 674973) But we have no such heroic remedy.
('29', 333, 1, 9, 675008) Apart from picketing we are powerless to deal with the evil, root and branch, till we have an effective voice in the Government of the country.
('29', 333, 1, 10, 675152) Happily, bad as the evil is it is not national vice.
('29', 333, 1, 11, 675205) It is confined to a small though unfortunately growing minority.

('29', 333, 1, 15, 675523) But we can and ought to penalize the drink and the drug habit and by closing all liquor and opium shops and dens make it as difficult as possible to indulge in it.
('29', 333, 2, 16, 675687) IS IT COMPULSION?
('29', 333, 3, 17, 675705) The reader must have read Mr. Stokes’ passionate protest against hand spinning being made compulsory for every Congress member.
('29', 333, 3, 18, 675833) It is evident to me that his excessive regard for liberty of the individual has disabled him from distinguishing between voluntary acceptance and compulsion.
('29', 333, 3, 19, 675991) Compulsion means submission of protestants to the thing they oppose under pain of being fined or imprisoned.
('29', 333, 3, 20, 676100) They cannot escape the obligation or the penalty by remaining outside the corporation of which they find themselves members.
('29', 333, 3, 21, 676225) But when a man joins a voluntary association such as the Congress he does so willingly and tacitly or explicitly undertakes to obey its rules.
('29', 333, 3, 22, 676368) These rules generally include submission of the minority to the wishes of the majority.
('29', 333, 3, 23, 676456) The voluntary nature of every act of every member is clear from the fact that he can secede whenever the majority pass a rule which is in conflict with his conscience.
('29', 333, 3, 24, 676624) Mr. Stokes’ reasoning is subversive of all corporate self government.
('29', 333, 3, 25, 676694) Every franchise has some condition attached to it.
('29', 333, 3, 26, 676745) As a rule there is opposition from some to every form of restrictive franchise.
('29', 333, 3, 27, 676825) May the opposers consider the restriction carried by the
('29', 334, 0, 1, 676882) VOL. 29 : 16 AUGUST, 1924 26 DECEMBER, 1924 335
('29', 334, 1, 2, 676930) majority compulsion?
('29', 334, 1, 3, 676951) Obviously not.
('29', 334, 1, 4, 676966) For if they may, then there can never be any corporate activity.
('29', 334, 2, 5, 677031) When the new Congress creed was passed in 1920, there was a minority that opposed it on principle and therefore seceded when it was carried by a majority.
('29', 334, 2, 6, 677186) Under the old creed many more were kept out because they could not conscientiously subscribe to it.
('29', 334, 2, 7, 677286) In either case I hold that the majority had a right to pass the rules.
('29', 334, 2, 8, 677357) Whether in the one case the restriction was wise and in the other relaxation was unwise is a matter of opinion.
('29', 334, 2, 9, 677469) And so in the matter of the present proposal to make hand spinning part of the Congress franchise may be bad policy and may kill the very object that I have in view, but I submit that there is nothing inherently wrong in it, that it is not wrong in principle, that it is an unconscious misuse of language to call it compulsion.
('29', 334, 2, 10, 677797) On merits I have no misgivings.
('29', 334, 2, 11, 677829) If hand spinning is an effective method of making India self supporting, it must be made part of the franchise.
('29', 334, 2, 12, 677941) It is the best way of expressing national will and determination.

('29', 335, 9, 32, 681058) Courtesy: Narayan Desai
('29', 336, 0, 1, 681082) VOL. 29 : 16 AUGUST, 1924 26 DECEMBER, 1924 337
('29', 336, 1, 2, 681130) 296. LETTER TO COL.
('29', 336, 2, 3, 681150) AS AT SABARMATI, Novmeber 13, 1924
('29', 336, 3, 4, 681185) DEAR COL.
('29', 336, 3, 5, 681195) MEL, Mr. Pragji K. Desai 1 whom I know well and who was with me in South Africa is at present a prisoner in the Hyderabad Central Jail.
('29', 336, 3, 6, 681331) He was convicted some time ago at Surat under section 124 A of the Indian Penal Code.
('29', 336, 3, 7, 681417) I am told that 1. Mr. Desai has lost in weight, 2. he is isolated from the rest of the prisoners and has therefore no human contact save that of his keepers, 3. the greens he gets are said to be as a rule grassy and uneatable, 4. he has applied for permission to spin cotton but he is permitted only to twist prepared yarn.
('29', 336, 3, 8, 681741) If the authorities are not prepared to supply Mr. Desai with slivers, I can arrange for such supply if permitted.
('29', 336, 3, 9, 681855) Rather than publish the above information in the Press, I am passing it on to you for kind inquiry.
('29', 336, 3, 10, 681955) I may state that Mr. Desaiis a vegetarian and did not possess a robust constitution by any means when he was outside.
('29', 336, 3, 11, 682073) In my opinion therefore he needs a light but nourishing diet such as milk and baker’s bread.

('29', 337, 3, 9, 683157) 298. SPEECH AT RAMJAS COLLEGE, DELHI
('29', 337, 4, 10, 683194) November 13, 1924
('29', 337, 5, 11, 683212) Mahatmaji then addressed the students, sitting as usual.
('29', 337, 5, 12, 683269) He excused himself for having come much earlier than the appointed time, the reason for which, he said, was that he had to attend the funeral of Bi Amma.
('29', 337, 5, 13, 683423) He advised the students not to follow his example in that respect but to cultivate the habit of time sense.
('29', 337, 5, 14, 683531) He referred to the wonderful punctuality of Gokhale.
('29', 337, 5, 15, 683584) He said that Indians very much lacked the virtue of punctuality which should be specially cultivated.
('29', 337, 6, 16, 683686) He then referred to R. S. Kidar Nath’s great sacrifice for the college and regretted that he could not visit the college before, when he is invited by Principal Gidwani some time back.
('29', 337, 6, 17, 683871) He had wondered why Rai Sahib Kidar Nath established the college on a hill away from the city.
('29', 337, 6, 18, 683966) When it was explained to him by Sukumar Babu on the way that the founder’s ideal was brahmacharya and that he wanted to keep the
('29', 337, 7, 19, 684095) students away from the attractions of cinemas and theatres, he was convinced.
('29', 337, 7, 20, 684173) Brahmacharya is inherent in Hindu civilization, and Western civilization lacks it.
('29', 337, 8, 21, 684256) might be said the people of the West had prospered, but he would ask what was the age of their civilization.
('29', 337, 8, 22, 684365) Egypt, Babylon, Greece and other great civilizations had perished, but Indian civilization still lives.
('29', 337, 8, 23, 684469) The reason for it was, he said, that Indian civilization has what they had not, viz., brahmacharya.
('29', 337, 9, 24, 684569) He then quoted a verse from the Bhagavata about the control of the tongue.
('29', 337, 10, 25, 684644) control of the tongue he meant control of diet and speech.
('29', 337, 10, 26, 684703) This he specially enjoined upon the students.
('29', 337, 11, 27, 684749) He next spoke about good company.
('29', 337, 11, 28, 684783) His advice was that every student should strive to keep company with the best books and the best thoughts of the world.
('29', 337, 11, 29, 684903) While he was a student, a class fellow of his recommended to him to read Reynolds’ novels, but he never read them in his life.”Non co operate with all that is bad”, said Mahatmaji.
('29', 338, 0, 1, 685084) VOL. 29 : 16 AUGUST, 1924 26 DECEMBER, 1924 339
('29', 338, 1, 2, 685132) He concluded by referring to the efficacy of prayer.
('29', 338, 1, 3, 685185) He said that he had felt it specially while he was in jail.
('29', 338, 1, 4, 685245) When the mind is full of prayerful thoughts, everything in the world seems good and agreeable.
('29', 338, 1, 5, 685340) Prayer is essential for progress in life.
('29', 338, 1, 6, 685382) The name of Rama or Khuda is sure to banish all evil thoughts and give new
('29', 338, 2, 7, 685457) strength and energy.
('29', 338, 3, 8, 685478) He said he was still very weak and was not in a mood to speak more.
('29', 338, 4, 9, 685546) He left the college at about 3.30 p.m.
('29', 338, 4, 10, 685585) amidst showers of flowers and shouts of Vandemataram and Mahatma Gandhiki jai.
('29', 338, 5, 11, 685664) The Hindustan Times, 15 11 1924

('29', 339, 4, 4, 686857) THE”WORLD TOMORROW” 396, BROADWAY NEW YORK U. S. A. My study and experience of non violence have proved to me that it is the greatest force in the world.
('29', 339, 4, 5, 687011) It is the surest method of discovering the truth and it is the quickest because there is no other.
('29', 339, 4, 6, 687110) It works silently, almost imperceptibly, but none the less surely.
('29', 339, 4, 7, 687177) It is the one constructive process of Nature in the midst of incessant destruction going on about us.
('29', 339, 4, 8, 687279) I hold it to be a superstition to believe that it can work only in private life.
('29', 339, 4, 9, 687360) There is no department of life public or private to which that force cannot be applied.
('29', 339, 4, 10, 687448) But this non violence is impossible without complete self effacement.

('29', 343, 7, 9, 693211) 307. STATEMENT ON KOHAT 1
('29', 343, 9, 10, 693237) November 16, 1924
('29', 343, 10, 11, 693255) Mr. Gandhi has issued the following statement regarding the visit to Rawalpindi and the settlement of the Kohat question: I have seen references in the Press asking me to go to Rawalpindi to meet the refugees from Kohat.
('29', 343, 10, 12, 693476) I have also had messages to the same effect from them directly.
('29', 343, 10, 13, 693540) I am extremely sorry that I am unable at the present moment to respond to the call.
('29', 343, 10, 14, 693624) My health is not such as yet to bear the strain of continuous journies, and I dare not postpone my visit to Bombay to attend the forthcoming conference in connection with Bengal repression.
('29', 343, 10, 15, 693814) I hope, however, immediately on my return from Bombay, to proceed to Rawalpindi.
('29', 343, 10, 16, 693895) Meanwhile, I wish to give my assurance to the refugees that they have never been out of my mind.
('29', 343, 10, 17, 693992) As soon after the fast as I was able to move about a little, I made all preparations to go to Kohat and applied for permission to proceed there.
('29', 343, 10, 18, 694137) Had I been permitted, it would have been my first duty to go there in the company of some Hindu and Mussalman friends.
('29', 343, 10, 19, 694256) I felt that I could then have rendered useful service, and in company with the friends, contributed my humble share towards reconciliation between the Hindus and Mussalmans of Kohat.
('29', 343, 10, 20, 694439) But, my visit to Kohat having been prohibited, I did not feel
('29', 343, 11, 21, 694501) 1 Young India, 20 11 1924, published this under”Notes” with the subtitle”Kohat Refugees”.
('29', 344, 0, 1, 694591) VOL. 29 : 16 AUGUST, 1924 26 DECEMBER, 1924 345
('29', 344, 1, 2, 694639) that a visit to Rawalpindi would serve any useful purpose.
('29', 344, 1, 3, 694698) I knew that many friends were assisting the refugees and that Pandit Malaviyaji was giving special attention to them, and even though, in obedience to the call from the refugees, as already stated, I shall go to Rawalpindi, I realize that, beyond giving comfort to the refugees, I might be of little service.
('29', 344, 1, 4, 695007) This much, however, I shall venture to urge upon the attention of the refugees, that the Kohat question is an all India question.
('29', 344, 1, 5, 695137) Both the Hindus and Mussalmans of India are interested in a proper, honourable and correct solution.
('29', 344, 1, 6, 695238) Any settlement, therefore, that they may agree to, should be viewed from a national as distinguished from a parochial standpoint, and they would be well advised before accepting any settlement to secure the approval of Hindu and Mussalman leaders.
('29', 344, 1, 7, 695486) Indeed, I will venture respectfully to tender the same advice to the Government.
('29', 344, 1, 8, 695567) I am glad to observe that they have repudiated the terms of the settlement said to have been offered by them.
('29', 344, 1, 9, 695677) The Government have declared themselves in favour of unity.
('29', 344, 1, 10, 695737) It would be an earnest of good faith if they would take the public into confidence and secure public approval of any terms of settlement that they might propose for the acceptance of the two communities.
('29', 344, 2, 11, 695941) New India, 17 11 1924

('29', 346, 3, 8, 698713) 311. LETTER TO AMIRCHAND C. BOMBWAL
('29', 346, 4, 9, 698749) [Before November 18, 1924] 2
('29', 346, 5, 10, 698778) DEAR FRIEND, Though I think we have never met personally I know you through Pandit Malaviyaji.
('29', 346, 5, 11, 698873) He spoke to me of you in glowing language and told me how brave, honest and self sacrificing you were.
('29', 346, 5, 12, 698976) He told me also that you counted your health of no cost in serving the refugees.
('29', 346, 5, 13, 699057) This is however to tell you, and through you the refugees, how sorry I am that I cannot come to Rawalpindi at the present moment.
('29', 346, 5, 14, 699187) My objective was Kohat.
('29', 346, 5, 15, 699211) That having fallen through for the time being, I was in no hurry to go to Rawalpindi.

('29', 348, 1, 2, 702282) 313. N0TES
('29', 348, 2, 3, 702293) BI AMMA
('29', 348, 3, 4, 702301) It is difficult to think of Bi Amma as dead.
('29', 348, 3, 5, 702346) Who does not know the stately figure of Bi Amma or her voice at public gatherings?
('29', 348, 3, 6, 702429) Though old in years, she possessed the energy of youth.
('29', 348, 3, 7, 702485) She travelled ceaselessly in the cause of the Khilafat and swaraj.
('29', 348, 3, 8, 702552) A staunch follower of Islam, she realized that the cause of Islam, in so far as it depended on human effort, depended upon the freedom of India.
('29', 348, 3, 9, 702697) She realized with equal conviction that freedom of India was impossible without Hindu Muslim unity and khaddar.
('29', 348, 3, 10, 702809) She therefore ceaselessly preached unity which had become an article of faith with her.
('29', 348, 3, 11, 702897) She had discarded all her foreign or mill made clothing and taken to khaddar.
('29', 348, 3, 12, 702975) Maulana Mahomed Ali tells me she had enjoined upon him that on her death she should have nothing but khaddar.
('29', 348, 3, 13, 703085) Whenever I had the privilege of going to her bedside, her inquiry was about swaraj and unity.
('29', 348, 3, 14, 703179) The inquiry was invariably followed by the prayer that God might grant wisdom to Hindus and Mussalmans to understand the necessity of unity and that He may in His mercy let her live to see swaraj established.
('29', 348, 3, 15, 703388) The best way in which we can treasure the memory of this brave and noble soul is to imitate her in her zeal for the common cause.
('29', 348, 3, 16, 703518) Hinduism without unity and swaraj is as much in peril as Islam.
('29', 348, 3, 17, 703582) Would that Hindus and Mussalmans had the common sense of Bi Amma to appreciate this elementary fact.
('29', 348, 3, 18, 703683) God grant her soul peace and the Ali Brothers strength to continue the mission bequeathed to them.
('29', 348, 3, 19, 703782) I must not omit to mention the impressive and solemn scene that I had the good fortune to witness on the night of Bi Amma’s death.
('29', 348, 3, 20, 703913) Having heard that life was ebbing away in her, Sarojini Devi and I hurried to her bedside.
('29', 348, 3, 21, 704004) She was surrounded by many members of the family.
('29', 348, 3, 22, 704054) Dr. Ansari, the friend and physician of the family, was also in attendance.
('29', 348, 3, 23, 704130) I heard no sobbing, though I noticed tears trickling down Maulana Mahomed Ali’s cheeks.
('29', 348, 3, 24, 704218) The Big Brother restrained himself with difficulty, though there was an unusual solemnity about his face.
('29', 348, 3, 25, 704324) They were all chanting the name of Allah.
('29', 348, 3, 26, 704366) One friend was reciting the last prayers.
('29', 348, 3, 27, 704408) The Comrade Press was situated within earshot of Bi Amma’s bedroom.
('29', 348, 3, 28, 704476) But the work was not interrupted for a single moment.
('29', 348, 3, 29, 704530) Nor did the Maulana interrupt his own editorial duties.
('29', 349, 0, 1, 704586) 350 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('29', 349, 1, 2, 704628) Indeed no essential public duty was suspended.
('29', 349, 1, 3, 704675) Maulan Shaukat Ali would not dream of my postponing my visit to the Ramjas College.
('29', 349, 1, 4, 704759) And like a good soldier he kept the appointment he had made with the Hindus of Muzaffarnagar although he had to proceed there almost immediately after Bi Amma’s death.
('29', 349, 1, 5, 704927) All this was as it should have been.
('29', 349, 1, 6, 704964) Birth and death are not two different states, but they are different aspects of the same state.
('29', 349, 1, 7, 705060) There is as little reason to deplore the one as there is to be pleased over the other.
('29', 349, 2, 8, 705147) LATE PARSI RUSTOMJEE
('29', 349, 3, 9, 705168) A cable received from Durban from his son gives me the sad news of the death of Rustomjee Jiwanjee Ghorkhodoo.
('29', 349, 3, 10, 705279) For me it is a personal loss.
('29', 349, 3, 11, 705309) He was a valued client, dear friend and faithful co worker.
('29', 349, 3, 12, 705369) He was as true a Parsi as he was a true Indian.
('29', 349, 3, 13, 705417) He was an equally true man.
('29', 349, 3, 14, 705445) He was an orthodox Parsi, but his Zoroastrianism was as broad as humanity itself.
('29', 349, 3, 15, 705527) He befriended all without distinction.
('29', 349, 3, 16, 705566) He could act pleasingly towards officials, but he could be unbending when the occasion demanded it.
('29', 349, 3, 17, 705666) His word was as good as his bond.
('29', 349, 3, 18, 705700) He was brave as a lion.
('29', 349, 3, 19, 705724) He was chary of making promises, but if he made them, he strove his best to keep them.
('29', 349, 3, 20, 705811) After he declared himself a satyagrahi, he never swerved even during the darkest hours of the movement, not even when the end seemed never to be coming.
('29', 349, 3, 21, 705964) When he took the pledge, he was by no means a young man.
('29', 349, 3, 22, 706021) Nor was he untrammelled by business pre occupations.
('29', 349, 3, 23, 706074) But he never counted the cost.
('29', 349, 3, 24, 706105) He suffered losses without a murmur.
('29', 349, 3, 25, 706142) He gave almost beyond his means and yet never unthinkingly.
('29', 349, 3, 26, 706202) His charities were most catholic.
('29', 349, 3, 27, 706236) He gave donations for mosques, madrasas, national schools.
('29', 349, 3, 28, 706295) Many a young man owed his rise to Parsi Rustomjee, as he was called throughout South Africa.
('29', 349, 3, 29, 706388) Personally I owe much to him.
('29', 349, 3, 30, 706418) I have many friends in South Africa.
('29', 349, 3, 31, 706455) But I have not known a warmer one.
('29', 349, 3, 32, 706490) He harboured me when I was lynched.
('29', 349, 3, 33, 706526) His house was a place of refuge for me and mine.
('29', 349, 3, 34, 706575) People wonder why I am partial to Parsis.
('29', 349, 3, 35, 706617) I am not partial, but I am thankful that I can bear testimony to their admirable virtues.
('29', 349, 3, 36, 706707) So long as the memory of Parsi Rustomjee persists with me, so long will that portion of humanity claim my respectful admiration.
('29', 349, 3, 37, 706836) If we had many Rustomjees in our public life, we should not be long in reaching our cherished goal.
('29', 349, 3, 38, 706936) May his soul rest in peace, and may God give wisdom and strength to his two sons to follow in the footsteps of their noble father !

('29', 350, 1, 2, 707116) SUPERSTITIOUS PRACTICE
('29', 350, 2, 3, 707139) The following extract from a letter recently received by me will cause pain to the reader as it has to me:
('29', 350, 3, 4, 707246) I am here in the very heart of the jungle villages where 90 per cent of the Gonds are living.
('29', 350, 3, 5, 707340) While touring I happened to come to a village named Silagota in Dangargarh Tahsil of the Khairagarh estate of Chattisgarh Division in the Central Provinces.
('29', 350, 3, 6, 707497) On Sunday last there was a great gathering from the surrounding villages.
('29', 350, 3, 7, 707571) Many of them had come from a distance perhaps of more than 15 miles.
('29', 350, 3, 8, 707640) I inquired into the cause of the gathering and came to know that for the past two years they had been enjoying every Sunday as a Gandhi day.
('29', 350, 3, 9, 707781) On that day they do not work at all.
('29', 350, 3, 10, 707818) Some men or women in the congregation are supposed to be visited by your spirit and are said to be inspired.
('29', 350, 3, 11, 707927) They tell fortunes and promise children to barren women.
('29', 350, 3, 12, 707984) I know this news will pain you.
('29', 350, 3, 13, 708016) Can you not send one of your workers to stop this practice?
('29', 350, 3, 14, 708076) If this practice of worshipping you is not stopped now, I think the day is not far off when they will actually place an idol of you in a mandir and
('29', 350, 4, 15, 708224) commence worshipping you.
('29', 350, 4, 16, 708250) There is already enough superstition in our country No effort should be spared to resist further addition in the shape of Gandhi worship.
('29', 350, 4, 17, 708388) Personally I have a horror of all adoration.
('29', 350, 4, 18, 708433) I believe in adoring virtue apart from the wearer.
('29', 350, 4, 19, 708484) And that can be done only after the wearer’s death.
('29', 350, 4, 20, 708536) Form is nothing.
('29', 350, 4, 21, 708553) It is perishable.
('29', 350, 4, 22, 708571) Virtue persists and incarnates in one person or another.
('29', 350, 4, 23, 708628) The poor Gonds know nothing of me or my mission.
('29', 350, 4, 24, 708677) I know I have no power to give any person anything.
('29', 350, 4, 25, 708729) The very idea of my spirit visiting and possessing any persons is repugnant to me.
('29', 350, 4, 26, 708812) The practice can only do harm and lead to fraud.
('29', 350, 4, 27, 708861) I urge co workers to put down the worship the correspondent describes.
('29', 350, 4, 28, 708932) It is a sin to let simple folk such as the Gonds to be encouraged in the practice of superstition.
('29', 350, 5, 29, 709031) THE FORTHCOMING PUNJAB CONFERENCE
('29', 350, 6, 30, 709065) Mr. Bharucha, who is fast becoming a specialist as khadi vendor, after a successful selling tour in the Punjab complained to me that the khadi sales were likely to be interrupted by the excitement and preparations for the conference that is to take place early next month.

('29', 351, 3, 6, 709971) 314. ON TRIAL
('29', 351, 4, 7, 709985) It is not to be wondered at that No changers are intensely dissatisfied with the agreement arrived at between the Swarajists and myself.
('29', 351, 4, 8, 710122) I have repeatedly admitted that I am but an humble explorer of the science of non violence.
('29', 351, 4, 9, 710214) Its hidden depths sometimes stagger me just as much as they stagger fellow workers.
('29', 351, 4, 10, 710298) I observe that the agreement seems just now to satisfy no one but the parties to it.
('29', 351, 4, 11, 710383) Many Englishmen regard it as an ignominious surrender to the Swarajists on my part.
('29', 351, 4, 12, 710467) Many No changers regard it as a lapse, if not a betrayal.
('29', 351, 4, 13, 710525) A friend says that it has caused consternation among students.
('29', 351, 4, 14, 710588) Why, they ask, should they remain in national schools if non co operation is suspended?
('29', 351, 4, 15, 710676) They are the greatest sufferers and they have not been considered in the pact at all.
('29', 351, 4, 16, 710762) I hold a letter from an Andhra friend which arrests attention and calls for a reasoned reply.
('29', 351, 5, 17, 710856) Surrender on my part, it undoubtedly is.
('29', 351, 5, 18, 710897) It is a conscious surrender, but not, as an English paper puts it, to the party of violence.
('29', 351, 5, 19, 710990) I refuse to believe that the Swaraj Party is a party of violence.
('29', 351, 5, 20, 711056) Such charges were I know levelled against even the late Dadabhai Naoroji and Justice Ranade.
('29', 351, 5, 21, 711149) They were suspected and shadowed.
('29', 351, 5, 22, 711183) Lala Harkishen Lal who had no more to do with any party of violence than Sir Michael O’Dwyer himself was arrested and imprisoned by that satrap.
('29', 351, 5, 23, 711328) I would have been false to the country if I had not stood by the Swaraj Party in the hour of its need.
('29', 351, 5, 24, 711431) Let it be unequivocally demonstrated that it has had anything to do with violence, and I shall be prepared to denounce it in as strong language as is open to me to use.
('29', 351, 5, 25, 711600) On such proof I shall sever all connection with it.
('29', 351, 5, 26, 711652) But till then, I must stand by it even though I do not believe in the efficacy of Council entry or even some of the methods of conducting Council warfare.
('29', 351, 5, 27, 711807) But recognition of the party as an integral part of the Congress does not mean surrender by individuals of their non co 
('29', 352, 0, 1, 711928) VOL. 29 : 16 AUGUST, 1924 26 DECEMBER, 1924 353
('29', 352, 1, 2, 711976) operation.
('29', 352, 1, 3, 711987) It means an admission that the Swaraj Party is a strong and growing wing of the Congress.
('29', 352, 1, 4, 712077) And if it refuses to take a back seat without a fight, and if it is necessary or even expedient to avoid a fight, the claim to a definite official recognition is irresistible.
('29', 352, 1, 5, 712253) Every Congressman, however, is not, by reason of his being a Congressman, assumed to be a believer in all the items of a Congress programme.
('29', 352, 1, 6, 712394) My own position, I admit, is somewhat different.
('29', 352, 1, 7, 712443) I have made myself instrumental in bringing the agreement into being.
('29', 352, 1, 8, 712513) I am not sorry for it.
('29', 352, 1, 9, 712536) Rightly or wrongly, the country expects me to give it some guidance.
('29', 352, 1, 10, 712605) And I have come to the conclusion that it is in the interest of the country to give the Swaraj party the fullest possible chance of working out its programme without let or hindrance from No changers.
('29', 352, 1, 11, 712806) The latter are not bound to participate in its activity, if they do not like it.
('29', 352, 1, 12, 712887) They are free and bound, as the Swarajists are bound, to pursue the constructive programme only.
('29', 352, 1, 13, 712984) They are free also to retain their individual non co operation.
('29', 352, 1, 14, 713048) But suspension by the Congress means that non co operators can derive no support or strength from the Congress.
('29', 352, 1, 15, 713160) They must derive all their strength from within.
('29', 352, 1, 16, 713209) And that is their test and trial.
('29', 352, 1, 17, 713243) If their faith abides, it is well with them and non co operation.
('29', 352, 1, 18, 713309) If it vanishes with suspension, non co operation dies as a force in public life.
('29', 352, 1, 19, 713390) But a friend says:”If you waver, what about lesser men?” I have not wavered.
('29', 352, 1, 20, 713467) My faith in non co operation is as bright as ever.
('29', 352, 1, 21, 713518) For it has been with me a principle of life for over thirty years.
('29', 352, 1, 22, 713585) But I cannot impose my personal faith on others, never on a national organization.
('29', 352, 1, 23, 713668) I can but try to convince the nation of its beauty and usefulness.
('29', 352, 1, 24, 713735) And if I find in reading the national mind, that the nation in so far as it is represented by the Congress must have breathing time, I must cry halt.
('29', 352, 1, 25, 713885) I may misread the mind of the Congress.
('29', 352, 1, 26, 713925) When that happens, I shall cease to be any force in the Congress.
('29', 352, 1, 27, 713991) That will be no calamity.
('29', 352, 1, 28, 714017) But it would be a calamity if by my obstinacy I stand in the way of the country’s progress by other means, so long as they are not positively mischievous and harmful.
('29', 352, 1, 29, 714184) I should for instance rise, even if I was alone, against methods of actual violence.
('29', 352, 1, 30, 714269) But I have recognized that the nation has the right, if it so wills, to vindicate her freedom even by actual violence.
('29', 352, 1, 31, 714388) Only, then India ceases to be the land of my love even though she be the land of my birth, even as I should take no pride in my mother if she went astray.
('29', 352, 1, 32, 714543) But the Swaraj Party is a party of orderly progress.
('29', 352, 1, 33, 714596) It may not swear by non violence as I do, but it accepts non violence as a policy and it discountenances violence, because it considers it to be useless if
('29', 353, 0, 1, 714752) 354 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('29', 353, 1, 2, 714794) not even harmful.
('29', 353, 1, 3, 714812) It occupies a prominent position in the Congress.
('29', 353, 1, 4, 714862) I do not know that if its strength was tested, it might not be found even to occupy a predominant position.
('29', 353, 1, 5, 714970) It is easy enough for me to secede from the Congress and let the party run the Congress.
('29', 353, 1, 6, 715059) That I can and will do when I find that I have nothing in common with the party.
('29', 353, 1, 7, 715140) But so long as I have the faintest hope of its redemption, I shall cling to it like a child to its mother’s breast.
('29', 353, 1, 8, 715256) I will not weaken it by disowning or denouncing it or by retiring from the Congress.
('29', 353, 1, 9, 715341) I have used the word”redemption” in no offensive sense.
('29', 353, 1, 10, 715397) I have too my method of shuddhi and tabligh.
('29', 353, 1, 11, 715442) It is the best the world has yet seen.
('29', 353, 1, 12, 715481) Conscious of my own ground and strength, I let the party act upon me and influence me as much as it will.
('29', 353, 1, 13, 715587) It enables me to know it at its best.
('29', 353, 1, 14, 715625) I make no secret of my intention that by coming under its influence, I hope to influence it in favour of my method.
('29', 353, 1, 15, 715741) If in the process, it redeems me and converts me, all honour to it.
('29', 353, 1, 16, 715809) I should then declare my conversion from the house top.
('29', 353, 1, 17, 715865) It is shuddhi by reason appealing to reason and heart speaking to heart.
('29', 353, 1, 18, 715938) It is the non violent method of conversion.
('29', 353, 1, 19, 715982) Let non co operators join forces with me.
('29', 353, 1, 20, 716024) At the same time let them remain firm in their individual conduct.
('29', 353, 1, 21, 716091) If their non co operation springs from love, I promise that they will convert the Swarajists, and even if they don’t succeed, they will have lost nothing, personally.
('29', 353, 1, 22, 716258) If the country is with them, the Swarajists, if they do not follow, will naturally take a back seat.

('29', 353, 1, 24, 716531) They may register me in advance as one of that minority.
('29', 353, 1, 25, 716588) The problem with the students is the same.
('29', 353, 1, 26, 716631) Non co operation may be suspended, but schools will not be suspended.
('29', 353, 1, 27, 716701) They are an accomplished fact.
('29', 353, 1, 28, 716732) They are among the best fruit of non co operation.

('29', 353, 1, 30, 716959) It is poor faith that needs fair weather for standing firm.

('29', 354, 5, 6, 717295) 316. SPEECH AT CONGRESS WORKING COMMITTEE MEETING, BOMBAY
('29', 354, 6, 7, 717353) November 21, 1924
('29', 354, 7, 8, 717371) The Working Committee of the Congress met on November 21 at 8.30 a.m.
('29', 354, 7, 9, 717441) in Gandhiji’s house.
('29', 354, 7, 10, 717462) The following members were present: Mahomed Ali, M. K. Gandhi, Shaukat Ali, Dr. Ansari, Konda Venkatappayya, G. B. Deshpande, Vallabhbhai J. Patel and S. G. Banker.
('29', 354, 7, 11, 717627) After disposing of unimportant items of a routine and administrative character on the agenda, the Working Committee of the Congress resumed discussion on items 2 and 3 of the agenda, viz., (1) to consider present political situation in the country and (2) the programme to be placed before the Congress.
('29', 354, 7, 12, 717931) Gandhiji suggested that there being no two opinions on that question, it would be in the fitness of things to place before that conference a resolution which should be acceptable to all the parties in the conference.
('29', 354, 7, 13, 718148) He argued that if they handled other questions such as the creed of the Congress and the spinning franchise there might arise disagreement which would be prejudicial to the main object of calling the conference.
('29', 354, 7, 14, 718360) Gandhiji therefore suggested that instead of taking a hazardous step of placing a resolution drafted by the Working Committee they should ask the conference to appoint a representative committee to deal with the repressive policy of the Government of India.
('29', 354, 7, 15, 718618) The members of the Working Committee unanimously agreed to this suggestion.
('29', 354, 8, 16, 718694) Bombay Secret Abstracts, 1924, p.

('29', 354, 10, 18, 718772) November 21, 1924

('29', 354, 12, 20, 719013) It is resolved that a small committee containing the leaders of the several parties represented at the Conference be appointed forthwith to prepare
('29', 355, 0, 1, 719161) 356 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('29', 355, 1, 2, 719203) and draft a resolution for submission to the Conference with reference to the repressive measures adopted by the Government of Bengal, with the concurrence and approval of the Government of India, the Committee to report to the Chairman at or before 10 p.m.

('29', 355, 3, 4, 719478) MR. CHAIRMAN, LADIES AND GENTLEMEN, In response to the invitation issued by Maulana Mahomed Ali, we have met here in order to consider certain things, one of which, and perhaps the most pressing, is to advise some action which should be taken by this Conference, if it is at all possible, in connection with the repressive policy adopted by the Government of Bengal with the concurrence and approval of the Government of India.
('29', 355, 3, 5, 719906) It was the desire of those who are associated with Mr. Mahomed Ali and the Working Committee as well as the members of the Swarajya Party that there should be a resolution on the repressive policy arrived at by the different parties represented here, and that the resolution should be passed unanimously.
('29', 355, 3, 6, 720211) 2 We have gathered here, not to emphasize the points of difference (“Hear, hear!”), but to find points of agreement (“Hear, hear!”) and to see whether it is possible for us to come
('29', 355, 4, 7, 720392) 1 This paragraph is from The Bombay Chronicle, 22 11 1924.
('29', 355, 5, 8, 720451) 2 The resolution as finally adopted the next day by the conference read: (a) While firmly of the opinion that anarchical organizations can never secure swaraj to the people of India, and while disapproving and condemning most emphatically such organizations, if any, this Conference, representing all classes and communities of India and every variety of political opinion, views with the strongest disapproval and condemns the action of the Governor General in promulgating the Criminal Law Amendment Ordinance of 1924, as such an extraordinary measure, being a direct invasion upon individual liberty, should not have been enacted without the sanction of the Legislature, and as it easily lends itself at the hands of the Executive to grave abuses resulting in implicating innocent persons and interfering with constitutional political activity, as past experience of similar measures has repeatedly demonstrated.
('29', 355, 5, 9, 721367) (b) This Conference urges the immediate withdrawal of the Ordinance and the trial, if necessary, and in accordance with the ordinary law, of the persons detained under it (c) This Conference further urges that Regulation III of 1818, which gives the Government powers of arresting and confining persons suspected of crimes without warrant, without trial, and without statement of reasons for such arrest and confinement, should be forthwith withdrawn.
('29', 355, 5, 10, 721819) (d) This Conference records its conviction that the present political situation in India is due to the denial of the just rights, long overdue, of the people, and that the speedy establishment of swaraj is the only effective remedy therefor.

('29', 356, 3, 13, 723302) 318. SPEECH REPLYING TO DEBATE AT ALL PARTY CONFERENCE, BOMBAY
('29', 356, 4, 14, 723365) November 21, 1924
('29', 356, 5, 15, 723383) Mr. Gandhi, in replying to the debate, pointed out that the issue raised by Mr. Ramaswami Mudaliar’s amendment 1 was a large question, and the speaker wanted to dispose of the smaller question before taking up the bigger one of the unity of all parties.
('29', 356, 5, 16, 723637) He characterized the amendment as putting the cart before the horse.
('29', 356, 5, 17, 723706) If they failed to come to an agreement on this matter, what hope was there, asked Mr. Gandhi, that they would come to an agreement on a larger matter?
('29', 356, 5, 18, 723857) He assured his hearers that the committee would, if it thought fit, support the Bengal Ordinance, or condemn it, as the case might be.
('29', 356, 5, 19, 723992) He reminded the audience of its duty to Bengal and even to the Government, who had asked them to help them.
('29', 356, 5, 20, 724100) New India, 22 11 1924

('29', 357, 1, 2, 724238) 319. INTERVIEW TO ASSOCIATED PRESS OF INDIA
('29', 357, 2, 3, 724282) BOMBAY, November 21, 1924
('29', 357, 3, 4, 724308) Mr. Gandhi stated to an Associated Press representative this evening that there was absolutely no truth in the report of a local newspaper that he offered the Liberals the withdrawal of the spinning franchise and the limitation of the word”swaraj” to Dominion status.
('29', 357, 3, 5, 724576) What, as a matter of fact, Mr. Gandhi told Mr. Chintamani and other Moderate leaders was that, if they desired those things, they should join the Congress and press for the acceptance of their views.

('29', 358, 4, 18, 727848) 321. CITIZEN’S HONOUR IS COUNTRY’S HONOUR
('29', 358, 5, 19, 727890) The honour of Bengal is the honour of the whole of India.
('29', 358, 5, 20, 727948) Swaraj will not be far off when we come to realize that a single Indian’s honour is the country’s honour.
('29', 358, 5, 21, 728054) This feeling is fairly widespread; but it has not yet spread as far as it should.
('29', 358, 5, 22, 728136) If my brother is in danger, if his honour is at stake for no fault of his, I will not sit content after passing a resolution of sympathy; I will run to his assistance.
('29', 358, 5, 23, 728304) We have not yet developed such a sentiment with regard to the country.
('29', 358, 5, 24, 728375) When hundreds of thousands of Indians feel that their own brother has suffered if any Indian anywhere from Kashmir to Kanyakumari and from Assam to Sind endures agony, we shall soon find a way to end the policy of the Bengal Government.
('29', 358, 5, 25, 728612) Today, we are groping in the dark because there is no such fervour in our feeling.
('29', 358, 5, 26, 728695) When pure feelings are aroused, their light will show us our path.
('29', 358, 5, 27, 728762) Today we are apathetic.
('29', 358, 5, 28, 728786) We shall gain great momentum when feelings simmer like steam within us.
('29', 358, 5, 29, 728858) Today we are
('29', 359, 0, 1, 728871) 360 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('29', 359, 1, 2, 728913) disunited, we are fighting amongst ourselves.
('29', 359, 1, 3, 728959) When we are welded together by ardent feelings, we will embrace one another and cling so close that we shall appear to be one though we are many.
('29', 359, 1, 4, 729105) Our brother is starving; we know that he can earn a living by plying the spinning wheel but he does not do so out of laziness and that he will if we give him an object lesson by spinning ourselves; in that case, we shall certainly take to the spinning wheel.
('29', 359, 1, 5, 729364) In India today, hundreds of thousands are in this predicament.
('29', 359, 1, 6, 729427) Nevertheless, we find it difficult to ply the spinning wheel even for half an hour in order to set an example for them, because we do not feel like brothers towards one another.
('29', 359, 2, 7, 729605) If all of us give up the use of foreign cloth and meet the country’s need for cloth by plying the spinning wheel, this Government would in large measure become redundant.
('29', 359, 2, 8, 729776) Despite this knowledge, many of us refuse to spin because we have not developed such fervent feelings.
('29', 359, 2, 9, 729879) Actually, there is no fellow feeling between Hindus and Muslims in many cities.
('29', 359, 2, 10, 729959) In such circumstances, millions of throats cannot chant the words”Our Country”.
('29', 359, 2, 11, 730039) And it is futile to hope for swaraj until such a situation is brought about.
('29', 359, 2, 12, 730116) We can all see that the path to swaraj is also the path to the repeal of the policy being pursued in Bengal.
('29', 359, 2, 13, 730225) The terrorism of the anarchists aims at winning swaraj.
('29', 359, 2, 14, 730281) It is meaningless.
('29', 359, 2, 15, 730300) However, the absence of swaraj is the root cause of the disease of terrorism.
('29', 359, 2, 16, 730378) The reason behind the Government’s terrorism is also the same.
('29', 359, 2, 17, 730441) The Government, so far as it is possible, does not wish to give up its own authority.
('29', 359, 2, 18, 730527) There would be no such terrorism, if there is swaraj.
('29', 359, 2, 19, 730581) I, therefore, claim that if the spinning wheel is the weapon for swaraj, if Hindu Muslim unity is the means of securing swaraj, they are also the means for reversing the Government’s policy of repression.
('29', 359, 3, 20, 730786) Moreover, as there is no fellow feeling between Hindus and Muslims, what is the state of affairs between the untouchable Hindus and other Hindus?
('29', 359, 3, 21, 730932) There can be no untouchability between brothers.
('29', 359, 3, 22, 730981) It cannot be the case that one brother eats sweet dishes, while the other eats his left overs.
('29', 359, 3, 23, 731076) Only those who work for the abolition of untouchability know of the many barriers that stand in the way of its abolition.
('29', 359, 3, 24, 731198) Where the situation is so clear, where one is well aware of the disease and the remedy, to refuse to use the ready remedy and impatiently seek alternative remedies is as good as killing the patient.
('29', 360, 0, 1, 731397) VOL. 29 : 16 AUGUST, 1924 26 DECEMBER, 1924 361
('29', 360, 1, 2, 731445) Some say that the people want agitation.
('29', 360, 1, 3, 731486) Agitation may have its uses but, to this day, no nation has achieved its independence through agitation alone.
('29', 360, 1, 4, 731597) India will never be able to do so.
('29', 360, 1, 5, 731632) It is our clear duty to give up agitation and take to our professions.
('29', 360, 1, 6, 731703) To the extent we who realize this do not look to others but fulfil our own obligations, we may be considered to have come closer to swaraj.
('29', 360, 1, 7, 731843) Hence, I have no doubt that whatever others in the country do, if those who have understood this will adhere to their duty, the whole country will follow in their footsteps.

('29', 360, 4, 11, 732137) 322. GUJARAT’S DHARMA
('29', 360, 5, 12, 732159) My advice to the Congress to suspend non co operation should not be interpreted to mean that Gujarat should give it up.
('29', 360, 5, 13, 732279) Just as this advice does not apply to individuals, similarly it does not apply to provinces.
('29', 360, 5, 14, 732372) If the Congress suspends non co operation for the time being, it means that, taking the circumstances into account, it makes a concession to the people.
('29', 360, 5, 15, 732525) However, in those places where the people and their leaders have faith in non co operation, where there are no disputes, where there is no lack of organization, the resolution for suspension should have no adverse effects.
('29', 360, 5, 16, 732748) On the contrary, these provinces should consolidate their work and ennoble it.
('29', 360, 5, 17, 732827) For instance, the national schools in Gujarat should continue to function and grow, those lawyers who have given up their practice should abide firmly by their decision; besides, goodwill should prevail where there has been a feeling of animosity.
('29', 360, 5, 18, 733075) No one should condemn or revile those who enter the legislatures or resume practice.
('29', 360, 5, 19, 733160) Everyone, following the dictates of his own conscience, should continue non co operation or resume co operation.
('29', 360, 5, 20, 733273) The Congress resolution should result in suspension of that non co operation which is being practised because of the compulsion imposed by the [old] resolution—non co operation should cease to be a strategy or an experiment but should rather come to stay as a dharma.
('29', 360, 5, 21, 733541) In other words, the people or individuals should carry on peaceful non co operation as a matter of duty wherever the policy of the Government is by and large harmful.
('29', 361, 0, 1, 733708) 362 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('29', 361, 1, 2, 733750) Those who would like to stick to non co operation even without the resolution will, therefore, continue to do so.

('29', 361, 3, 11, 734649) Peaceful non co operation will emulate nature.

('29', 361, 3, 13, 734835) Ether is a powerful medium, but who has seen it?
('29', 361, 3, 14, 734884) We know it through its results.

('29', 372, 8, 15, 761845) SABARMATI , November 26, 1924 After much prayer, after much heart searching, and not without fear and trembling, I have decided to accept the honour of presiding at the forthcoming Congress.
('29', 372, 8, 16, 762036) I am to preside at a time when a gulf seems to be yawning between educated India and myself with some notable exceptions, and, save for a few young educated Indians of little fame, the intellect of the country seems to be ranged against my ways of thought and action and yet as I seem to be popular with the masses, and as many educated countrymen believe me to be as good a lover of the country as themselves, they want me to direct the Congress at this critical juncture in the history of our country.
('29', 372, 8, 17, 762540) I feel that I must not resist them.
('29', 372, 8, 18, 762576) On the contrary, I must let myself be used, as I hope, for the benefit of the country.
('29', 372, 8, 19, 762663) I was waiting, before coming to a final decision, for the verdict of the All India Congress Committee.
('29', 372, 8, 20, 762766) At its meeting the Swarajists were eloquent by their silence.
('29', 372, 8, 21, 762828) I know that many of them are not enthusiastic about the proposed alteration of the franchise.
('29', 372, 8, 22, 762922) But for the sake of peace and unity, they gave their vote in silence in favour of the change.
('29', 372, 8, 23, 763016) The No changers were despondent, chafing at the surrender, as they felt it to be, of their cherished ideals.

('29', 376, 5, 14, 770275) 332. SHALL WE UNITE?
('29', 376, 6, 15, 770296) That the Conference 1 that met in Bombay last week did not result immediately in uniting all parties on a common platform shows the difficulty of the task.
('29', 376, 6, 16, 770452) The appointment of a committee to consider the ways and means of bringing about a union shows that the Conference does not consider the task to be hopeless or impossible.
('29', 376, 6, 17, 770623) Indeed Mr. Jesukhlal Mehta who moved that the committee should report on or before 15th December next had a very fair number of supporters.
('29', 376, 6, 18, 770763) They were quite sanguine of immediate success.
('29', 376, 6, 19, 770810) The cautious many, by fixing the date of the report at 31st March, if they have realized the difficulty, have also by implication thrown on the committee the burden of finding an acceptable solution.
('29', 376, 6, 20, 771010) Writers in the Press can considerably help the committee by guiding public opinion in the right channel.
('29', 376, 6, 21, 771115) The chief bodies to influence the committee are the Liberals, the Independents and the National Home Rulers.
('29', 376, 6, 22, 771224) The last led by Dr. Besant have practically accepted the position set forth in the agreement between the Swaraj Party and me and now ratified by the A.l.C.C. The difficulties in the way of the Liberals and the Independents are practically the same.
('29', 376, 6, 23, 771473) They are: the creed, the transfer of all Council work to the Swaraj Party and the franchise.
('29', 376, 6, 24, 771566) It is said that the creed is equivocal.
('29', 376, 6, 25, 771606) I venture to deny the charge.
('29', 376, 6, 26, 771636) It is a recognition of the existing condition.
('29', 376, 6, 27, 771683) It means swaraj within the Empire if possible, and without if necessary.
('29', 376, 6, 28, 771756) It is intended to throw the
('29', 376, 7, 29, 771784) 1 All Party Conference
('29', 377, 0, 1, 771807) 378 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('29', 377, 1, 2, 771849) burden on Englishmen of making it possible for us to be and remain equal partners in the Empire.
('29', 377, 1, 3, 771946) It manfully declares the country’s ability to stand on its own legs as an absolutely independent nation, if it became necessary.
('29', 377, 1, 4, 772075) Swaraj within the Empire is a free State, a voluntary remaining in the Empire, ability to secede if India thought it desirable.
('29', 377, 1, 5, 772203) Swaraj within the Empire must be a partnership at will between free nations.
('29', 377, 1, 6, 772280) This is a vital position which cannot be surrendered.
('29', 377, 1, 7, 772334) Even if those who are guiding the Congress at the present moment desired to alter the creed to mean swaraj within the Empire only and therefore that of a subject State, the vast majority of Congressmen will decline to accept the humiliation.
('29', 377, 1, 8, 772576) To aim at changing the creed in the direction desired by the Liberals and the Independents is to run counter to the present national temper.
('29', 377, 1, 9, 772717) The only thing they can do is to join the Congress and attempt to convince Congressmen of the utility or the necessity of the change, even as Maulana Hasrat Mohani has been attempting to change the creed so as to make independence of British connection the only goal of the Congress.
('29', 377, 1, 10, 773001) I respectfully submit that there is nothing immoral or harmful in the present creed.

('29', 377, 1, 12, 773253) No nation that has the will, need be powerless for independence.
('29', 377, 1, 13, 773318) In any case, I trust that all parties will recognize that the Congress has an electorate which can become insistent at times and that it is well that it is so.

('29', 377, 2, 20, 774143) The scope for widening the Congress electorate is infinite, and practically anybody can form Congress circles or committees, if he can find men and women of his way of thinking.
('29', 377, 3, 21, 774321) The third objection is the franchise.
('29', 377, 3, 22, 774359) If it were not for its novelty, it would not only excite any surprise, but it would be welcomed as the
('29', 378, 0, 1, 774462) VOL. 29 : 16 AUGUST, 1924 26 DECEMBER, 1924 379
('29', 378, 1, 2, 774510) best franchise test.
('29', 378, 1, 3, 774531) Had it been workmen who had been the most influential people and not capitalists or educated men and a property or an education test had been proposed, the powerful workmen would have ridiculed the suggestion and might have even called it immoral.
('29', 378, 1, 4, 774779) For they would have argued that while capital or education were the possession of a few, bodily labour was common to all.
('29', 378, 1, 5, 774901) My suggestion to make one form of labour, i.e., hand spinning the test, may be valueless, may be fantastical, but it is neither immoral nor harmful to the nation.
('29', 378, 1, 6, 775064) I hold that it is a positive gain to the nation, if thousands of men and women labour for the nation, even if it is for only half an hour every day.

('29', 378, 1, 12, 775760) One has no faith in the Council programme as a means for attaining swaraj and is satisfied with the khaddar activity, till the country is ready for peaceful disobedience or non co operation.
('29', 378, 1, 13, 775951) The other, while claiming to believe in the economic value of khaddar, believes that, if swaraj cannot be gained through Council entry, at the very least some steps may be taken towards it and some check might be placed upon bureaucratic extravagance.
