('29', 379, 3, 21, 779054) 333. THE NO CHANGERS’ PLIGHT
('29', 379, 4, 22, 779083) The position of No changers is truly pathetic.
('29', 379, 4, 23, 779130) The thought that I am largely if not wholly responsible for it makes me sad.
('29', 379, 4, 24, 779207) My consolation—let it be theirs also—is that I am probably the most confirmed No changer of all.
('29', 379, 4, 25, 779304) But what is a No changer?
('29', 379, 4, 26, 779330) It is an ugly word.
('29', 379, 4, 27, 779350) It explains nothing.
('29', 379, 4, 28, 779371) But it has been used to denote one who swears by the original Non co operation Resolution passed at Calcutta in 1920. Its operative part is non violence.
('29', 379, 4, 29, 779525) We were non co operating
('29', 380, 0, 1, 779550) VOL. 29 : 16 AUGUST, 1924 26 DECEMBER, 1924 381
('29', 380, 1, 2, 779598) even before 1920 in that our minds were in revolt against the Government, whilst we seemed to co operate with it by our conduct.
('29', 380, 1, 3, 779727) All this was changed in 1920. We endeavoured to establish co operation between thought, word and deed.
('29', 380, 1, 4, 779830) We discovered that such co operation was possible only through non violence.
('29', 380, 1, 5, 779907) And we further discovered that, if we withdrew from the Government as much voluntary co operation as was possible, it must capitulate to the people.
('29', 380, 1, 6, 780056) A No changer therefore is one who, not wishing ill to the governors but still seeking to destroy their system, renounced the privileges (so called) of the system, viz., Councils, courts, schools, titles and tempting foreign cloth.
('29', 380, 1, 7, 780287) This was its negative part.
('29', 380, 1, 8, 780315) Its positive and permanent part was establishment of independent schools, voluntary arbitration and manufacture of hand spun yarn and from the latter of hand woven khaddar.
('29', 380, 1, 9, 780488) The Congress took the place of the Central Legislature, and solid work by volunteer workers was itself the highest title.
('29', 380, 1, 10, 780610) But the five Government institutions not having been destroyed, and the new ones not having shown any effective results, some of us lost heart and sought in the Councils a means of rendering national service.
('29', 380, 1, 11, 780819) Now the No changers, if they had truly believed in non violence, should not have been irritated over the lack of faith on the part of their erstwhile co workers.
('29', 380, 1, 12, 780981) They should have given them the same credit for honesty and patriotism that they claimed for themselves.
('29', 380, 1, 13, 781086) But they violently opposed their co workers, who now came to be called Swarajists.
('29', 380, 1, 14, 781169) If they were truly non violent, they would have been tolerant and have honoured them for their difference and allowed them to go their way.
('29', 380, 1, 15, 781309) But their intolerance was not their fault.
('29', 380, 1, 16, 781352) They did not even know that they were intolerant.
('29', 380, 1, 17, 781402) Instead of being self reliant and having an unquenchable faith in their own programme, they sought strength from the Swarajists, even as we all, not wishing or being unable to overcome our weaknesses, seek strength from our rulers.
('29', 380, 1, 18, 781634) That mentality of helplessness still survives, and hence the dissatisfaction with the agreement.
('29', 380, 1, 19, 781731) Have the No changers real love for the Swarajists, even though they may not be all that they claim to be and even if they may be as bad as some of us believe them to be?
('29', 380, 1, 20, 781901) If they have that love, they will not worry about what the Swarajists are doing.
('29', 380, 1, 21, 781982) Again, the vast majority of No changers have no activity to absorb them the whole of their time, save khaddar.
('29', 380, 1, 22, 782093) They must have a correct attitude about Hindu Muslim relations and untouchability.
('29', 380, 1, 23, 782176) But all cannot have any active work to do in regard to these items.
('29', 381, 0, 1, 782244) 382 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('29', 381, 1, 2, 782286) national schools can but absorb only a few workers and they must have special qualifications.
('29', 381, 1, 3, 782380) But khaddar is an activity that can absorb all the time of all available men and women and grown up children, if they have faith.
('29', 381, 1, 4, 782510) If they are truly non violent, they must also realize that civil disobedience is an impossibility till the preliminary work of construction is done.
('29', 381, 1, 5, 782659) Civil disobedience means capacity for unlimited suffering, without the intoxicating excitement of killing.
('29', 381, 1, 6, 782766) That cannot come until we have attained a certain calmness in the atmosphere and until we have a reasonable certainty that Hindus and Mussalmans, Brahmins and non Brahmins, caste Hindus and untouchables will not quarrel and until we have understood the secret of hand spinning and hand weaving to the extent, by their aid, of feeling independent of public support for workers.
('29', 381, 1, 7, 783143) We may be only a few such or many.
('29', 381, 1, 8, 783178) If we are many, we have ensured a calm atmosphere.
('29', 381, 1, 9, 783229) If we are few, we must perish in the attempt to quench the conflagration raging about us.
('29', 381, 1, 10, 783319) If there are such No changers, they cannot quarrel with the agreement.
('29', 381, 1, 11, 783390) For it is but a method of finding out the number of unbending and unbendable No changers, No changers whose love will stand the severest test and whose faith in the triple constructive programme will, if necessary, outlast the faithlessness of the rest of India.
('29', 381, 1, 12, 783653) They stand in no need of sympathy from anyone.
('29', 381, 1, 13, 783700) On the contrary it is I who need and ask for all the sympathy and support that they can give me.
('29', 381, 1, 14, 783797) These consist in self effacing, silent and sustained service without grumbling and without the expectation of reward, save the approbation of one’s own conscience.
('29', 381, 1, 15, 783961) Let the reader be sure that there are such workers.
('29', 381, 1, 16, 784013) They need no introduction or advertisement through the pages of Young India.
('29', 381, 2, 17, 784090) Young India, 27 11 1924
('29', 381, 3, 18, 784114) 334. NOTES
('29', 381, 4, 19, 784125) IF I WERE VICEROY
('29', 381, 5, 20, 784143) Two English friends seeking to justify the repressive policy now being pursued in Bengal asked me what I would have done if I had been in Lord Reading’s or Lord Lytton’s place.
('29', 381, 5, 21, 784320) The answer came ready to my lips.
('29', 381, 5, 22, 784354) But I observed that I gave no satisfaction to the friends.
('29', 381, 5, 23, 784413) The reason for dissatisfaction was that they thought that it was easy enough for me to give the answer so readily, as I was not as a matter of fact in the place of these distinguished Englishmen.
('29', 381, 5, 24, 784609) But as,
('29', 382, 0, 1, 784617) VOL. 29 : 16 AUGUST, 1924 26 DECEMBER, 1924 383
('29', 382, 1, 2, 784665) after having thought over my answer from every point of view, I regard it to be sound, and as I have no doubt that many Englishmen, who honestly believe that repression is justified, think like the two friends, I venture to reproduce my answer with some amplification.
('29', 382, 1, 3, 784934) The very first thing then that I would have done would have been to summon Indians of position and trust, and I would have shown them all the papers and would have been guided by them.
('29', 382, 1, 4, 785119) In the case of Subhas Chandra Bose, I would have confronted him with my suspicion and published his statement.
('29', 382, 1, 5, 785230) In consultation with those Indians of position and trust, I would also have summoned Deshban dhu Das and put the whole burden of responsibility on his shoulders, in so far as the suspected members of his party were concerned.
('29', 382, 1, 6, 785456) By this procedure I would have quietly ensured public peace or been assured that the information given to me was wrong.
('29', 382, 1, 7, 785576) This is the least I would have done, and that too if I had no trust in my legislature, or if there was no time to summon it.
('29', 382, 1, 8, 785701) What is more, I would have realized my own unenviable position.
('29', 382, 1, 9, 785765) I would have seen at once its hypocrisy.
('29', 382, 1, 10, 785806) Having therefore dealt with the crisis, I would have tried to discover the true disease, of which the crisis was but a symptom.
('29', 382, 1, 11, 785934) For that purpose, I would have summoned representative Indians before me and tried to ascertain why there were young, able and otherwise peace ful men, who would mercilessly kill innocent men and recklessly put their own lives in danger.
('29', 382, 1, 12, 786172) I would have learnt that they had no selfish end and that they wanted liberty for their country.
('29', 382, 1, 13, 786269) I would therefore have been guided, in dealing with the root cause, by the advice of the summoned representatives, taking care that no legitimate foreign interest was thereby jeopardized, and having done this I would have breathed free in the knowledge that it would be equally the business of my legislature as mine to deal with any such future eruption.
('29', 382, 1, 14, 786625) I know that in the foregoing I have made no new suggestion.
('29', 382, 1, 15, 786685) But its staleness is its merit.
('29', 382, 1, 16, 786717) The existing system has lived on terrorism and Viceroy after Viceroy as a rule has shut his eyes to the obvious necessity of consulting Indian opinion.
('29', 382, 1, 17, 786869) The obduracy proves not the uselessness of the advice, it proves the worthlessness of the system under which such systematic defiance of public opinion is possible.
('29', 382, 1, 18, 787034) No wonder the Viceroy, instead of obtaining the public support which he thought he should have had, is obliged to face severe condemnation from practically the whole Indian opinion.
('29', 383, 0, 1, 787216) 384 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('29', 383, 1, 2, 787258) A MISUNDERSTANDING
('29', 383, 2, 3, 787277) My note 1 on the Gaya Congress resolution about the repudiation of public debts has, I observe, given rise to some misunderstanding.
('29', 383, 2, 4, 787410) It was unfortunate that it was published at a time when we are thinking of unity.
('29', 383, 2, 5, 787492) The fact is that the note was written three months ago in answer to a correspondent.
('29', 383, 2, 6, 787577) From week to week my assistants put it by to give place to other things that in their opinion were moreimportant.
('29', 383, 2, 7, 787691) When it was finally published they did not see any incongruity between that note which was bound to raise useless controversy and other writings which were intended to emphasize matters of agree ment.
('29', 383, 2, 8, 787892) Whilst, therefore, I consider the appearance of the note inoppor tune at the present moment, I must say that it still represents my view of public debts.
('29', 383, 2, 9, 788046) Whatever the Gaya resolution may mean, my note is quite clear.
('29', 383, 2, 10, 788109) I do not seek to repudiate all debts incurred by the present Government but I do submit that when the final transference of power comes, it will be necessary to examine all the transactions of the Government and they will have to stand the light of examination.
('29', 383, 2, 11, 788371) Suppose for instance the Government were to make a gift of a hundred million to a foreign syndicate for the exploitation of the mineral resources of the country, it would not only be just for, but it will be the duty of, the Swaraj Government to repudiate it.
('29', 383, 2, 12, 788631) Indeed perhaps I go a step further in one respect than the Gaya resolution.
('29', 383, 2, 13, 788707) I would claim to bring under scrutiny not merely the transactions since the date of the resolution but every transaction of the Government which may appear to bear an immoral taint.
('29', 383, 2, 14, 788889) For this Government claims to be and is presumed to act justly, honourably and as trustee for the millions of the people of India.
('29', 383, 2, 15, 789020) Breach of trust or any other unjust dealing cannot claim the protection that prescription gives to honourable dealings.
('29', 383, 3, 16, 789140) Young India, 27 11 1924
('29', 383, 4, 17, 789164) 1 Vide”Notes”, 13 11 1924, sub title,”Public Debts”.
('29', 384, 0, 1, 789217) VOL. 29 : 16 AUGUST, 1924 26 DECEMBER, 1924 385
('29', 384, 1, 2, 789265) 335. THE TRUTH ABOUT NATIONALISM 1
('29', 384, 2, 3, 789300) It is becoming clearly a matter of first rate importance for the younger generation of Indians, who are faced with the altered world situation after the Great War, to think out afresh, in the light of that experience, the truth about Western nationalism and its application to the East....
('29', 384, 2, 4, 789590) The truth is that during my recent travels in Malaya and Burma I found on all sides this hostility towards Indians, as foreigners, being awakened.
('29', 384, 2, 5, 789737) it meant to me that the whole world was going mad after”nationalism” of a European type, and not Europe only....
('29', 384, 2, 6, 789850) These things had disturbed me before Mahatma Gandhi’s fast; but during the fast itself the further thought came to me, that just as in Europe the wars of hostile religions had ended in the wars of hostile nations, so in India the Hindu Muslim tension might easily take the same course, unless we were forewarned about it....
('29', 384, 2, 7, 790175) We have, alas !
('29', 384, 2, 8, 790191) also today to acknowledge in India a class warfare, equivalent to the class warfare between Labour and Capital in Europe.
('29', 384, 2, 9, 790313) There is the cruelly narrow hostility between class and class contained in”untouchability”....
('29', 384, 2, 10, 790408) Are we truly representing the universal spirit of India in all our new developments?
('29', 384, 2, 11, 790493) Or, are we merely copying over again some of the most retrograde features of the West?
('29', 384, 2, 12, 790580) Is our picture of swadeshi becoming clouded with thoughts of hostility and ill will to others?
('29', 384, 2, 13, 790675) The sovereign test is non violence....
('29', 384, 2, 14, 790714) It is because I have felt all along that this spirit of Ahimsa or Love was fundamentally behind the national movement, in spite of its forbiding name of non co operation, that I have stuck to it, through thick and thin, and remained its defender, even when”violence was in the very air”....
('29', 384, 2, 15, 791005) There is no fear of Indian swadeshi becoming impure or racial so long as it confines itself principally to khaddar and things which can be and should be manufactured in India.
('29', 384, 2, 16, 791181) It is not exclusive but conservative.
('29', 384, 2, 17, 791219) It is not anti British or anti foreign but pro Indian by necessity.
('29', 384, 2, 18, 791287) India must protect her primary industries even as a mother protects her children against the whole world without being hostile to it.
('29', 384, 2, 19, 791421) Violent nationalism, otherwise known as imperialism, is the curse.
('29', 384, 2, 20, 791488) Non violent nationalism is a necessary condition of corporate or civilized life.
('29', 384, 3, 21, 791569) Young India, 27 11 1924

('29', 387, 7, 9, 794220) 342. MY NOTES
('29', 387, 8, 10, 794234) BI AMMA
('29', 387, 9, 11, 794242) I have already written about Bi Amma’s death in Young India.
('29', 387, 10, 12, 794303) That lady had unbounded love for religion.
('29', 387, 10, 13, 794346) Her passion for religion was worth emulating.
('29', 387, 10, 14, 794392) Her patriotism was rooted in her love for religion and this very same love was responsible for her desire for Hindu Muslim unity.
('29', 387, 10, 15, 794522) She had finally come to such a state that she made no distinction between religion, patriotism and communal unity.
('29', 387, 10, 16, 794637) She saw that Islam could not be safe if India did not attain independence; the latter was dependent on communal unity.
('29', 387, 10, 17, 794756) This, in turn, is impossible without Hindu Muslim unity.
('29', 387, 10, 18, 794813) In this manner, because she had seen it with her own eyes, this good woman repeatedly talked of these three things till her death.
('29', 387, 10, 19, 794944) During her days, I had the good fortune of having her darshan a number of times.
('29', 387, 10, 20, 795025) She would ask me: When will Hindus and Muslims unite?
('29', 387, 10, 21, 795079) When shall we win independence?
('29', 387, 10, 22, 795111) Shall I live to see it?” Every soul is immortal; such a pure soul, however, manifests its immortality clearly.
('29', 387, 10, 23, 795222) Although Bi Amma is no longer physically with us, her deeds and her words will not die so long as Hindus and Muslims survive.
('29', 387, 10, 24, 795348) The mother who has left sons like the Ali Brothers cannot possibly perish.
('29', 387, 10, 25, 795423) My love for these Brothers grows as I recall their love for their mother.
('29', 387, 10, 26, 795497) That old lady’s word was law to them.
('29', 387, 11, 27, 795535) 1 Vide footnote to the preceding item.
('29', 387, 12, 28, 795574) 2 Vide”Notes”, 20 11.1924, sub title,”Bi Amma”.
('29', 388, 0, 1, 795622) VOL. 29 : 16 AUGUST, 1924 26 DECEMBER, 1924 389
('29', 388, 1, 2, 795670) They believe that the credit for whatever they are goes to their mother.
('29', 388, 1, 3, 795743) The night of Bi Amma’s death is unforgettable.
('29', 388, 1, 4, 795790) Maulana Shaukat Ali was present at my prayers that day when a telephone message said that Bi Amma’s illness had taken a serious turn.
('29', 388, 1, 5, 795924) On hearing this, the Maulana left immediately along with Dr. Ansari.
('29', 388, 1, 6, 795993) I was informed of this after the prayers.
('29', 388, 1, 7, 796035) I took Sarojini Devi along with me and went over to their place.
('29', 388, 1, 8, 796100) The whole family had gathered around Bi Amma.
('29', 388, 1, 9, 796146) All were chanting the name of Allah.
('29', 388, 1, 10, 796183) Pearl like tears were trickling down Maulana Mahomed Ali’s face; but I did not hear him utter any word except the name of Allah.
('29', 388, 1, 11, 796312) Maulana Shaukat Ali was trying to restrain his tears but his face disclosed his grief.
('29', 388, 1, 12, 796399) Nevertheless, he retained his presence of mind.
('29', 388, 1, 13, 796447) He was well aware of what was going on around him.
('29', 388, 1, 14, 796498) Arrangements were being made for the subsequent ceremonies.
('29', 388, 1, 15, 796558) He pressed me to leave as he felt that I was weak and should not stay there long.
('29', 388, 1, 16, 796640) I have many such instances of his attentiveness and his kindness.
('29', 388, 2, 17, 796706) I could not but compare the patience and the faith in God that I witnessed in that small room with our custom of crying and screaming.
('29', 388, 2, 18, 796841) I have seen many deaths among Hindus.
('29', 388, 2, 19, 796879) I have often seen that even when the person is still alive, instead of chanting the name of Rama for his sake, people start weeping aloud.
('29', 388, 2, 20, 797018) Al1 religions forbid weeping for the dead.
('29', 388, 2, 21, 797061) Hinduism regards birth and death as modifications of the very same state; and yet I have not come across the barbarous and godless custom of weeping and wailing among any other people except the Hindus.
('29', 388, 2, 22, 797264) I have been present at deaths among Parsis, Jews, Christians and Muslims.
('29', 388, 2, 23, 797338) Nowhere have I seen any weeping and wailing.
('29', 388, 2, 24, 797383) I was pleased to find only devotion to God on the occasion of Bi Amma’s death.
('29', 388, 2, 25, 797462) I wish that thoughtful Hindu families will immediately discontinue the harmful, barbarous and futile practice of weeping and wailing as irreligious.
('29', 388, 3, 26, 797611) I learned much else by my association with Bi Amma.
('29', 388, 3, 27, 797663) That lady used only khadi till the very end, and that too not of fine quality but of a coarse, common variety.
('29', 388, 3, 28, 797774) Her orders were for the use of pure khadi even for her burial.
('29', 388, 3, 29, 797837) I saw these being carried out.
('29', 388, 3, 30, 797868) In the home of the Ali Brothers, I saw everyone, old and young, wearing khadi.
('29', 388, 3, 31, 797947) Neither the Brothers nor anyone else in the house suspended their work even for a moment.
('29', 388, 3, 32, 798037) Maulana Mahomed Ali did not stop writing.
('29', 388, 3, 33, 798079) He continued to issue instructions regarding Hamdard and Comrade.
('29', 388, 3, 34, 798145) Maulana Shaukat Ali did not stop his work even for a single
('29', 389, 0, 1, 798205) 390 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('29', 389, 1, 2, 798247) He had to visit Muzaffarnagar the very next day.
('29', 389, 1, 3, 798296) He punctually fulfilled that appointment.
('29', 389, 1, 4, 798338) I had to go to Ramjas College that very day.
('29', 389, 1, 5, 798383) Even though the time coincided with the hour of the funeral, they did not allow me to cancel this engagement.
('29', 389, 1, 6, 798493) They sent me away after assuring me that they would send for me to act as a pall bearer before taking her remains to the burial ground.
('29', 389, 1, 7, 798629) All this suggests devotion to duty, courtesy and faith in God.
('29', 389, 1, 8, 798692) I have heard all this said of Tilak Maharaj.
('29', 389, 1, 9, 798737) Whatever the nature of the sad news that he received, it made no difference to his daily routine.
('29', 389, 1, 10, 798835) I have frequently come across such devotion to duty among Englishmen.
('29', 389, 1, 11, 798905) It is not an exaggeration to say that without such patience one is not fit to be called a human being.
('29', 389, 2, 12, 799008) PARSI RUSTOMJEE
('29', 389, 3, 13, 799024) In the death of Bi Amma, as Maulana Shaukat Ali says, India has lost a true soldier.
('29', 389, 3, 14, 799109) With the passing away of Parsi Rustomjee also India has lost a true soldier.
('29', 389, 3, 15, 799186) So far as I am concerned, I have lost a true friend.
('29', 389, 3, 16, 799239) I have come across few men like Parsi Rustomjee.
('29', 389, 3, 17, 799288) He had had hardly any education.
('29', 389, 3, 18, 799321) He knew a little English and his knowledge of Gujarati was not much.
('29', 389, 3, 19, 799390) He was not too fond of reading.
('29', 389, 3, 20, 799422) Right from his youth he was in business.
('29', 389, 3, 21, 799463) Through sheer hard work he had risen from the status of a common clerk to that of a big businessman.
('29', 389, 3, 22, 799564) Despite this, he had a keen common sense and great generosity and he was so tolerant that, although he was an orthodox Parsi, he had the same affection for Hindus, Muslims and Christians.
('29', 389, 3, 23, 799752) I have never seen anyone going round for funds return empty handed from him.
('29', 389, 3, 24, 799829) His loyalty to his friends was so staunch that many gave him their power of attorney.
('29', 389, 3, 25, 799915) I have seen many prominent Muslim businessmen name Parsi Rustomjee their representative in preference to their own relations.
('29', 389, 3, 26, 800041) No poor Parsi was sent away from Rustomjee’s shop.
('29', 389, 3, 27, 800092) It was as sparing towards himself as he was generous towards others.
('29', 389, 3, 28, 800161) Luxuries had no place in his life.
('29', 389, 3, 29, 800196) He spent money after great hesitation on himself and his family.
('29', 389, 3, 30, 800261) He continued to live in great simplicity till the end.
('29', 389, 3, 31, 800316) Parsi Rustomjee’s shop was the only place where Gokhale, Andrews, Sarojini Devi and such others stayed.
('29', 389, 3, 32, 800420) The minutest detail did not escape his eyes.
('29', 389, 3, 33, 800465) Who else but he could be given the responsibility of packing Gokhale’s forty five packages consisting of innumerable addresses of welcome and such other things, making a list of these and loading them on the steamer?
('29', 389, 3, 34, 800682) By making a trust in the name of his dearly loved wife Jerbai
('29', 390, 0, 1, 800744) VOL. 29 : 16 AUGUST, 1924 26 DECEMBER, 1924 391
('29', 390, 1, 2, 800792) after her death, he gave away the larger part of his wealth in charity.
('29', 390, 1, 3, 800864) He has not pampered his children at all but has rather brought them up in simplicity and left them an inheritance sufficient only to prevent them from starving.
('29', 390, 1, 4, 801025) He has remembered all his relations in making his will.
('29', 390, 1, 5, 801081) He took part in public affairs with the same degree of precision and firmness described above.
('29', 390, 1, 6, 801176) At the time of satyagraha, Parsi Rustomjee was the first among the businessmen of Natal who were prepared to sacrifice their all.
('29', 390, 1, 7, 801306) It was his way not to give up a task once he had undertaken it, whatever the risks involved.
('29', 390, 1, 8, 801399) He had to serve a longer sentence in prison than expected, but this did not frighten him.
('29', 390, 1, 9, 801489) The struggle continued for eight years; many staunch warriors fell.
('29', 390, 1, 10, 801557) Rustomjee, however, did not waver.
('29', 390, 1, 11, 801592) He made his son Sorabjee also plunge into the struggle.
('29', 390, 1, 12, 801648) I first made the acquaintance of this good Indian in 1893. At first I was not greatly impressed by him.
('29', 390, 1, 13, 801752) However, as I got more and more involved in public work, I learnt more and more to value the gemlike qualities in Parsi Rustomjee.
('29', 390, 1, 14, 801883) He was my client, my colleague in public work and finally he became my friend.
('29', 390, 1, 15, 801962) He did not hesitate to come to me and describe his faults like a child.
('29', 390, 1, 16, 802034) He astounded me by his faith in me.
('29', 390, 1, 17, 802070) When the whites attacked me in 1897, Rustomjee’s house sheltered me and my sons.

('29', 391, 0, 1, 802991) 392 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('29', 391, 1, 2, 803033) 343. AN OPPOSITIONIST FRIEND
('29', 391, 2, 3, 803062) Very often we learn more from a person who opposes us than from one who shares our views.
('29', 391, 2, 4, 803152) This depends, however, on our having the tolerance and patience to listen to and understand criticism.
('29', 391, 2, 5, 803255) I have learnt much from my critics because, I believe, I have these two qualities.
('29', 391, 2, 6, 803338) I give below a letter from a critic: 1
('29', 391, 3, 7, 803377) I believe this letter has been written sincerely.
('29', 391, 3, 8, 803427) The writer is angry but he has written what he believes.
('29', 391, 3, 9, 803484) He has read a causal connection in what was merely a coincidence.
('29', 391, 3, 10, 803550) He has found all my activities blameworthy because he did not get a reply to a telegram he sent me.
('29', 391, 3, 11, 803650) I have all along believed that I am very regular in answering communications and the colleagues around me are not only not wicked but are engaged in the pursuit of truth.
('29', 391, 3, 12, 803821) Nevertheless, even the most regular man cannot answer all the letters and telegrams he receives.
('29', 391, 3, 13, 803918) It was impossible for me to read all the telegrams I received during the fast.
('29', 391, 3, 14, 803997) It was also not possible for my colleagues to reply to all of them.
('29', 391, 3, 15, 804065) It is indeed sad that the correspondent has not understood this obvious fact.
('29', 391, 3, 16, 804143) His argument runs as follows: Non co operation is on and business in India is slack, hence the former is responsible for the latter; and since I am the author of non co operation I am the one who is to be held responsible.
('29', 391, 3, 17, 804366) I wish to present the opposite argument.
('29', 391, 3, 18, 804407) People did not implement non co operation in full, they did not wholly accept the religion of the spinning wheel, hence India too became a prey to the economic depression that has affected the world.
('29', 391, 3, 19, 804607) The people did not grasp the significance of non co operation because there are, in India, many impatient and impetuous persons like the correspondent.
('29', 391, 3, 20, 804759) Hence India has to suffer.
('29', 391, 3, 21, 804786) If they were patient and tried to understand non co operation and practise it, India would be free today.
('29', 391, 3, 22, 804892) Moreover, the correspondent’s denunciation of innocent khadi has often been answered.
('29', 391, 3, 23, 804978) Nevertheless I repeat the argument for the sake of the correspondent and other sceptics like him.
('29', 391, 3, 24, 805076) It is not khadi alone that gets dirty, all white clothes get dirty.
('29', 391, 3, 25, 805144) It is a little troublesome to wash khadi as it is coarse.
('29', 391, 3, 26, 805202) However, if we had not become delicate by Western pampering, we would not have disliked washing khadi but enjoyed it.
('29', 391, 3, 27, 805320) Moreover, those who wear khadi use fewer clothes and hence, on the whole, the trouble of washing is less.
('29', 391, 3, 28, 805426) I would even go further and say that those who are unhappy about coarse khadi should spin fine yarn and have it woven so that khadi
('29', 391, 4, 29, 805558) 1 The letter is not translated here.
('29', 392, 0, 1, 805595) VOL. 29 : 16 AUGUST, 1924 26 DECEMBER, 1924 393
('29', 392, 1, 2, 805643) will be as fine as muslin and it will be less expensive than the latter because all the processes right up to spinning will have been free of cost.
('29', 392, 1, 3, 805791) Ever since voluntary spinning was introduced the facility to obtain fine khadi for those who wish to wear it has been provided.
('29', 392, 1, 4, 805919) Those who, through laziness, do not spin fine yarn will no longer have the right to blame khadi for its roughness.
('29', 392, 1, 5, 806034) If voluntary spinning continues and spreads, it will be possible to obtain from the market as much fine khadi as one wants.
('29', 392, 1, 6, 806158) The spinning wheel is intended to increase one’s income.
('29', 392, 1, 7, 806215) It is an annapoorna.
('29', 392, 1, 8, 806236) The correspondent is a lawyer.
('29', 392, 1, 9, 806267) He cannot be aware of the condition of the poor.
('29', 392, 1, 10, 806316) If he were to stroll in a poor village, he would realize that even a single pice is welcome to the destitute.
('29', 392, 1, 11, 806426) Crores of labourers do not earn even an anna a day.
('29', 392, 1, 12, 806478) For them the spinning wheel would be like a Kamadhenu 1. Acharya Ray has testified to this.
('29', 392, 1, 13, 806570) The writer’s sarcasm about law breaking is well worth considering.
('29', 392, 1, 14, 806637) It is quite true.
('29', 392, 1, 15, 806655) Just as people failed to understand that”peaceful” was the first concomitant of non co operation, similarly, they failed to realize that disobedience of law should necessarily be”civil”.
('29', 392, 1, 16, 806842) There is no doubt that unwelcome results have followed this.
('29', 392, 1, 17, 806903) Many people have taken it for granted that anyone has the right to disobey any order or any law.
('29', 392, 1, 18, 807000) This should be regarded not as civil disobedience, but as an impudent, uncivil and rainous breaking of the law; it is, in some respects, even more harmful than an armed revolt.
('29', 392, 1, 19, 807177) However, this cannot be considered a drawback in civil disobedience.
('29', 392, 1, 20, 807246) It is a fault which may be attributed to a lack of understanding on the part of the person who resorts to breaking the law.
('29', 392, 1, 21, 807370) Such lack of understanding does arise in any new movement.
('29', 392, 1, 22, 807429) Such imperfection is to be expected when an imperfect man works among other imperfect men.
('29', 392, 1, 23, 807520) However if both the parties—the reformer and society—make bona fide mistakes out of ignorance, the divine law is that the error corrects itself.
('29', 392, 1, 24, 807665) I repent wherever I discover errors.
('29', 392, 1, 25, 807702) The public too corrects mistakes without any ill feeling.
('29', 392, 1, 26, 807760) Between the two, there is a section of people which deliberately interferes with and hampers the movement.
('29', 392, 1, 27, 807867) The only remedy lies in a wider propagation of these principles which appear new and a greater understanding of them by all.
('29', 392, 1, 28, 807992) However, I welcome the outburst of the correspondent which serves us as a warning.

('29', 393, 0, 1, 808171) 394 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('29', 393, 1, 2, 808213) 344. WHAT SHOULD BE DONE NOW?
('29', 393, 2, 3, 808243) Step by step khadi is gaining ground.
('29', 393, 2, 4, 808281) The All India Congress Committee has accepted the suggestion of introducing khadi franchise.
('29', 393, 2, 5, 808374) We hope that the Congress too will accept this.
('29', 393, 2, 6, 808422) Whether the Congress accepts it or not, those who believe in the efficacy of spinning will glorify their membership by spinning.
('29', 393, 2, 7, 808551) The Swarajists have in good faith agreed to include spinning and khadi as conditions for the right to vote.
('29', 393, 2, 8, 808659) In order to encourage them and confirm their faith, the No changers should forge ahead and make others do so.
('29', 393, 2, 9, 808769) There are about 2,000 voluntary spinners in Gujarat today.
('29', 393, 2, 10, 808828) We find it difficult to keep up this number; this is a measure of our organizing ability and a test of our tact.
('29', 393, 2, 11, 808941) All our abilities will be on trial in making the progress rapid.
('29', 393, 2, 12, 809006) We shall succeed only when a large number of workers continuously strive to achieve this.
('29', 393, 2, 13, 809096) Thousands of persons may contribute their labour.
('29', 393, 2, 14, 809146) They cannot contribute cotton, nor can they obtain it.
('29', 393, 2, 15, 809201) Neither can all of them prepare their own slivers.
('29', 393, 2, 16, 809252) Hence in every Village, in every taluka, we should have good carders.
('29', 393, 2, 17, 809322) In every town, in every taluka there should be persons who can make good frames for the spinning wheel and for the carding bow.
('29', 393, 2, 18, 809450) The committee or the sub committee should have a godown for cotton.
('29', 393, 2, 19, 809518) The province which can do all this well will be regarded as having acquired executive or administrative ability.
('29', 393, 2, 20, 809631) How shall we acquire the ability to run the government under swaraj, if we cannot do even this much?
('29', 393, 2, 21, 809732) We shall not automatically acquire such ability on securing swaraj.
('29', 393, 2, 22, 809800) We shall, however, realize that swaraj is implicit in the acquisition of such ability.
('29', 393, 2, 23, 809887) The East India Company gained control over us by destroying our spinning industry.
('29', 393, 2, 24, 809970) Our salvation lies in the revival of this very thing.
('29', 393, 2, 25, 810024) So far, it is only those who have been able to get the spinning wheel, slivers, etc., that have spun yarn.
('29', 393, 2, 26, 810131) If we now expect half an hour’s labour from many more people, the committees must provide all these needs.
('29', 393, 2, 27, 810238) If there is a true awakening amongst us, thousands should participate in this great sacrifice which requires little effort.
('29', 393, 2, 28, 810362) Moreover, since swaraj cannot be won without the spinning wheel, it should not be surprising if thousands take part in it.
('29', 393, 2, 29, 810485) In my opinion, the spinning wheel is the easiest means for winning swaraj.
('29', 393, 2, 30, 810560) It can illumine all other activities, and the latter will be meaningless without it.
('29', 394, 0, 1, 810645) VOL. 29 : 16 AUGUST, 1924 26 DECEMBER, 1924 395
('29', 394, 1, 2, 810693) We have no other peaceful means of ascertaining whether people are really capable, whether they truly desire swaraj.
('29', 394, 1, 3, 810810) The ability to win swaraj is not proved by thousands or lakhs of people attending mammoth meetings.
('29', 394, 1, 4, 810910) It is not acquired by thousands of persons contributing money.
('29', 394, 1, 5, 810973) Money has no value where there is no one to make use of it.
('29', 394, 1, 6, 811033) Swaraj cannot be won even by a large number of people studying Hindi or English.
('29', 394, 1, 7, 811114) On the other hand, I have often and in many ways shown how the power to win swaraj lies in spinning.
('29', 394, 1, 8, 811215) I am convinced that if the spinning wheel does not yield results, the only way open to India for winning swaraj will be bloodshed.
('29', 394, 1, 9, 811346) True independence can never be won through legislative assemblies alone.
('29', 394, 1, 10, 811419) Every Indian has understood and learnt by heart this axiom.
('29', 394, 1, 11, 811479) What remains then is to tread the path of strength.
('29', 394, 1, 12, 811531) First, there is the path of peaceful strength, where we have to suffer, where we have to do some constructive work.
('29', 394, 1, 13, 811647) Secondly, there is the path of violent strength, where we have to punish our adversary.
('29', 394, 1, 14, 811735) Today, all of us regard this as fit only to be renounced.
('29', 394, 1, 15, 811793) It is a fact simple enough to be grasped even by a child that today India can achieve nothing by pursuing the path of violence.
('29', 394, 1, 16, 811921) The reader should therefore forgive me if I see before my eyes only the spinning wheel.
('29', 394, 1, 17, 812009) And I would invite him to take full part in this grand sacrifice, if he too sees what I see.

('29', 395, 4, 13, 813559) 346. SPEECH AT GUJARAT NATIONAL COLLEGE, AHMEDABAD
('29', 395, 5, 14, 813610) November 30, 1924
('29', 395, 6, 15, 813628) Addressing the students of the Gujarat National College, Mr. Gandhi said that the proposed suspension of non co operation by the Congress did not mean the closing of national educational institutions, or their affiliation with Government universities.
('29', 395, 6, 16, 813880) The existence of these institutions was an accomplished fact, and it was up to the Provincial Congress Committee to keep them intact.
('29', 395, 6, 17, 814014) The speaker would not only suggest a resolution to be passed by the Congress that such institutions should be kept up, but would suggest that whenever they were desired by the people, even new ones should be established.
('29', 395, 6, 18, 814235) If there were students who did not believe in non co operation as a national necessity but had given up Government educational institutions merely out of loyalty to the Congress resolution, they were free, without any stigma attaching to them, to rejoin Government colleges.
('29', 395, 6, 19, 814510) The proposed suspension of non co operation would enable the country to know the strength of confirmed non co operators.
('29', 395, 6, 20, 814631) Non co operation as a national programme might be suspended, but that did not mean suspension by an individual or even by provinces, if the provinces would retain it without causing bad blood or internal dissensions.
('29', 395, 6, 21, 814848) The movement, like every other human activity, might have its periods of ebbs and flow, but it had come to stay, and would continue in some shape or form among men and women or groups so long as the existing system of Government lasted.
('29', 395, 7, 22, 815085) Replying to a question, Mr. Gandhi said that the national schools and colleges identified themselves with national politics in so far as they had to be a living
('29', 396, 0, 1, 815246) VOL. 29 : 16 AUGUST, 1924 26 DECEMBER, 1924 397
('29', 396, 1, 2, 815294) advertisement of what Hindu Muslim unity should be, or what the correct relation between the so called untouchables and caste Hindus was to be, and what the spinning wheel meant.
('29', 396, 1, 3, 815473) The future historian would measure the progress of non co operating educational institutions by the progress in them of these three items.
('29', 396, 1, 4, 815612) These three items were common cause between Swarajists and No changers.
('29', 396, 1, 5, 815684) The difference was a difference in emphasis.
('29', 396, 1, 6, 815729) They should not believe that the Swarajists had accepted the khaddar programme without any belief in it.
('29', 396, 1, 7, 815834) It would be unjust to believe, unless there was proof to the contrary, that any party said what it did not mean.
('29', 396, 1, 8, 815947) There was no question whatever of giving a go by to khaddar.
('29', 396, 1, 9, 816008) The speaker had no hesitation in saying that those students who did not believe in the khaddar programme were wasting time in remaining in national schools and colleges.
('29', 396, 1, 10, 816178) New India, 1 12 1924

('29', 401, 2, 4, 824673) HAND SPINNING AT ADYAR
('29', 401, 3, 5, 824696) The reader will be glad to read the following letter received by Dr. Besant from Mme.
('29', 401, 3, 6, 824782) de Manziarly and her comments thereon which I reproduce from the current number of the Theosophist:
('29', 401, 4, 7, 824882) I read in New India about your talk with Mr. Gandhi concerning
('29', 401, 5, 8, 824945) spinning and would like you to know what is going on in that respect in Adyar.
('29', 401, 5, 9, 825024) In May (when you were absent in London) I learned to spin.
('29', 401, 5, 10, 825083) I was the first to do it on the compound, because I was so intensely interested in village welfare, home industries and dreaming of active help to the villages round Adyar through spinning, weaving, dyeing with vegetable dyes, embroidery and other rural industries.
('29', 401, 5, 11, 825349) Later, others learned to spin, and now in our new vocational shed belonging to Miss Barrie’s Montessori school, Mrs. Peramma gives lessons to eleven village women, besides several ladies and children of the compound.
('29', 401, 5, 12, 825566) The charkhas are made by the carpenter belonging to the vocational shed.
('29', 401, 5, 13, 825639) I am now learning to weave, and we have already two looms in the shed, and soon I will start the dyeing.
('29', 401, 5, 14, 825744) It may be of use to you to know and to be able to tell about our endeavour.
('29', 401, 6, 15, 825820) There must be not so many European women spinning in India, and it is perhaps interesting that a theosophist does it, and not out of a political conviction, but only from the wish to help—which coincides with politics.
('29', 401, 6, 16, 826039) We even could send yarn through you to Mr. Gandhi for the Congress, if you wish us to do so instead of weaving it into khaddar ourselves.
('29', 401, 6, 17, 826177) Now at least a dozen people are spinning regularly.
('29', 401, 7, 18, 826229) To the spinning and weaving we will add other things—beauty, which will enrich soul and spirit and give creative joy, and in this way not only the economic life of this poor people will be improved, but their spiritual life too—and by it our synthetic theosophical programme fulfilled.
('29', 401, 7, 19, 826515) We dream too—and being neither old nor young, I combine the two—see visions and dream of a wonderful work before us.
('29', 401, 8, 20, 826632) It is interesting—and curious to those who live on the surface—that this has been going on in my absence, and that I, knowing nothing of it, just on my return to India, said to Mr. Gandhi in Bombay, I was willing to spin half an hour a day, if it would help unity.
('29', 401, 8, 21, 826897) de Manziarly is a very charming woman and”has a way wid her”, as the Irish say.
('29', 401, 8, 22, 826977) So she suggested to the women who began to spin salable yarn, that they should spin for a charkha
('29', 402, 0, 1, 827075) VOL. 29 : 16 AUGUST, 1924 26 DECEMBER, 1924 403
('29', 402, 1, 2, 827123) that would be their own; they preferred the annas, but she so praised the usefulness of having a charkha with which they could go on spinning annas perennially, that they exchanged yarn for charkhas and then carried them home for their own use.
('29', 402, 1, 3, 827368) Now yarn is made and woven into cloth in the Craft Shed, and out of the cloth little jackets of the South Indian fashion are made for the children and these are becoming the uniform of the school.
('29', 402, 1, 4, 827565) de Manziarly bought various kinds of charkhas, and she and the carpenter between them made one which is very simple and effective.
('29', 402, 1, 5, 827696) They spin from the seeds directly, without any intermediate processes.
('29', 402, 1, 6, 827767) Now she has gone off to learn vegetable dyeing, which is still done in Southern India, and which she wishes to add to our villages here.
('29', 402, 1, 7, 827904) This is a well considered plan, and the idea may spread.
('29', 402, 1, 8, 827961) Parts of it might be taken up in any village, and the whole in the larger villages.
('29', 402, 1, 9, 828045) If a panchayat were added to it, the village would be on the right road.
('29', 402, 2, 10, 828118) BREACH OF FAITH?
('29', 402, 3, 11, 828135) It is a healthy sign of the times that there are people in the country who are jealous of the morals of the nation.
('29', 402, 3, 12, 828251) A friend, not himself a Liberal, asks,”Was not the ratification of the agreement between the Swarajists and Gandhiji by the A.I.C.C. a breach of faith with the All Parties Conference?” The answer, in my humble opinion, is an emphatic”No.” The agreement is the basis of invitation.
('29', 402, 3, 13, 828532) The two wings of the Congress must first unite.
('29', 402, 3, 14, 828580) In the absence of the Congress, that unity can be expressed by the A.I.C.C. The agreement is final so far as the two wings of the Congress are concerned.
('29', 402, 3, 15, 828734) But it is open to attack and even to revision at the instance of any outside party.
('29', 402, 3, 16, 828818) The attack can succeed only if it appeals to the reason of both the wings.
('29', 402, 3, 17, 828893) No party is called upon to surrender its principle for the sake of unity.
('29', 402, 3, 18, 828967) The agreement now ratified by the A.I.C.C. is not an ultimatum— either this or nothing.
('29', 402, 3, 19, 829055) There are many things outside the agreement which all the parties have to consider.
('29', 402, 3, 20, 829139) Congressmen are not expected to suspend their principles or policy pending decision of the All Parties Conference.
('29', 402, 3, 21, 829254) But they are expected to keep an open mind on everything.
('29', 402, 3, 22, 829312) They must approach the question with a receptive mind.
('29', 402, 3, 23, 829367) Subject to that one essential condition, it is better that all parties declare their principles, policies and intentions.
('29', 402, 3, 24, 829489) There should be no mental reservations.
('29', 402, 3, 25, 829529) Not to proceed with the ratification of the agreement would have meant a mental reservation.
('29', 402, 3, 26, 829622) What we must aim at is the same spirit of toleration that we need and are strivings after in the relations between Hindus and Mussalmans.
('29', 402, 3, 27, 829760) We want to unite and
('29', 403, 0, 1, 829781) 404 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('29', 403, 1, 2, 829823) respect one another in spite of the sharpest differences of opinion, that is to say, if we have a common goal to pursue.
('29', 403, 1, 3, 829944) We may find to our great grief that there is no common goal, that swaraj does not mean the same thing in any of its aspects to all parties, that our interests are not the same.
('29', 403, 1, 4, 830121) Then I admit there is no uniting of all parties on the Congress platform.

('29', 404, 2, 3, 832025) On learning that Mr. Pragji Desai who, as the editor of the Navayug of Surat, was the other day sentenced to two years’ imprisonment with hard labour, was wasting and was not getting proper food, I wrote 1 to the Inspector General of Prisons inquiring about Mr. Desai’s condition.
('29', 404, 2, 4, 832306) The following was his reply:
('29', 404, 3, 5, 832335) I have enquired into the allegations regarding Mr. P.K. Desai.
('29', 404, 4, 6, 832398) 1. It is true that his weight has fallen from 138 lbs.
('29', 404, 4, 7, 832453) on admission to 128 lbs.
('29', 404, 4, 8, 832478) But as he is unduly obese, this can hardly be regarded as a ground for complaint.
('29', 404, 4, 9, 832560) He is still 17 lbs.
('29', 404, 4, 10, 832580) above the normal weight of a man of his height.
('29', 404, 4, 11, 832628) 2. He is not isolated from the rest of the prisoners.
('29', 404, 4, 12, 832682) A convict night watchman is always with him and they work together.
('29', 404, 4, 13, 832750) He is also within sight of other prisoners.
('29', 404, 5, 14, 832794) 3. The Superintendent denies that the vegetables given to any prisoner are as a rule grassy and uneatable.
('29', 404, 5, 15, 832901) Considering that there is a large and excellent garden at Hyderabad Prison, there is no reason why this should be so.
('29', 404, 6, 16, 833019) 4. He was sentenced to rigorous (not simple) imprisonment and therefore cannot be allowed to choose the work on which he shall be employed in jail.
('29', 404, 7, 17, 833167) 5. The Medical Officer of the Hyderabad Central Prison is at present an Indian Officer of the I.M.S. who can be entirely trusted suitably to regulate the diet of all prisoners according to the requirements of their health and constitution.
('29', 404, 7, 18, 833407) He reports that Mr. Desai does not look weak or debilitated.
('29', 404, 8, 19, 833468) In conclusion I may say that I inspected Hyderabad Prison three weeks ago and on that occasion saw Mr. Desai.
('29', 404, 8, 20, 833578) He did not complain to me of any of the matters mentioned by you.
('29', 404, 8, 21, 833644) His only request was that he should be transferred, as the climate of Hyderabad did not agree with him.
('29', 404, 8, 22, 833748) As there was no reason for thinking that such was the case, I did not consider it necessary to take any action.
('29', 404, 8, 23, 833860) It is quite true that Mr. Desai made no complaint.
('29', 404, 8, 24, 833911) He did not because he thought he should not complain against officials who were all Indians.
('29', 404, 8, 25, 834004) He wanted to put up with the inconvenience.
('29', 404, 8, 26, 834048) I knew that Mr. Desai was a hard labour prisoner, but even a hard labour prisoner may ask for the kind of labour for which he is best

('29', 405, 6, 22, 835676) BORO DADA ON EDUCATION
('29', 405, 7, 23, 835699) Boro Dada has sent me the following note for publication in Young India:
('29', 405, 8, 24, 835772) A celebrated English poet of eighteenth century said:
('29', 405, 9, 25, 835826) “A little learning is a dangerous thing,
('29', 405, 10, 26, 835867) Drink deep or taste not the Pierian spring.”
('29', 405, 11, 27, 835912) To this I add that the education, which is spreading among our people, is worse than a little learning.
('29', 405, 11, 28, 836016) The right sort of knowledge, which is rooted in the heart of the Indian people, is a gift of God, and of those rishis of olden times who devoted their
('29', 405, 12, 29, 836167) whole lives to the service of God.
('29', 405, 12, 30, 836202) This is positive knowledge, while the education of the present day, which has not heart in it, gives a sort of negative knowledge.
('29', 405, 13, 31, 836333) acquisition of negative knowledge is tantamount to a loss of positive knowledge.
('29', 406, 0, 1, 836414) VOL. 29 : 16 AUGUST, 1924 26 DECEMBER, 1924 407
('29', 406, 1, 2, 836462) Minus a hundred is a hundred times less than minus one.
('29', 406, 1, 3, 836518) Therefore, the most highly modern educated man in India of the present day is in reality an ignoramus in comparison with a rightly educated son of India, who may never in his life have crossed the threshold of schools and colleges.
('29', 406, 2, 4, 836750) Young India, 4 12 1924
('29', 406, 3, 5, 836773) 354. NOT EVEN HALF MAST
('29', 406, 4, 6, 836797) The perplexity of No changers continues unabated.
('29', 406, 4, 7, 836847) Some of the best among them, those whose advice and co operation I value above everything else, are bewildered.
('29', 406, 4, 8, 836959) They feel that I have probably given up even lifelong principles for a patchwork.
('29', 406, 4, 9, 837041) One such communication I quote below:
('29', 406, 5, 10, 837079) You are reported to have said that not having the power to give battle to the Swarajists immediately, you are forbearing, marking time.
('29', 406, 5, 11, 837215) But why thus?
('29', 406, 5, 12, 837229) The cause of truth and non violence demands that you keep the flag flying for us collectively outside the Swaraj Party and the Congress, in no spirit of hostility to anybody, even as Mohammed did.
('29', 406, 5, 13, 837426) His followers dwindled to three depending upon the holy God’s strength.
('29', 406, 5, 14, 837498) Personally you undoubtedly gain by surrendering and helping opponents, but the cause suffers irretrievably when non co operators are neither asked nor allowed to hoist the flag collectively.
('29', 406, 5, 15, 837689) No spiritually minded man can take interest in politics which neither promotes nor draws sustenance from truth and non violence.
('29', 406, 5, 16, 837818) No strategic unity will attract God, because fight with the Government then becomes immoral.
('29', 406, 5, 17, 837911) Further, under the Swarajist regime there will be nothing to purify the criminal tendencies of impatient idealists as under your previous regime of high moral idealism and spiritual endeavour.
('29', 406, 5, 18, 838104) Now utter futility and blank despair will stare them in the face.
('29', 406, 5, 19, 838170) The friend represents a large body of non co operators.
('29', 406, 5, 20, 838226) He himself was attracted to the struggle because of its spiritual nature.
('29', 406, 5, 21, 838300) I have therefore carefully read the message more than once.
('29', 406, 5, 22, 838360) My hope is that he has formed judgment on garbled, even misleading, reports of my speeches.
('29', 406, 5, 23, 838452) He was not present at the Conference.
('29', 406, 5, 24, 838490) He was not in Bombay.
('29', 406, 5, 25, 838512) It is most difficult to follow any movement merely from newspaper reports.
('29', 406, 5, 26, 838587) I have not seen the report to which the friend makes reference.
('29', 406, 5, 27, 838651) The expression”giving batte, to the Swarajists”, torn from its context, may bear a meaning opposite to the one intended by me.
('29', 406, 5, 28, 838778) Let me explain: I cannot give battle to the Swarajists, if they misunderstand me, if No changers do not understand the spirit in
('29', 407, 0, 1, 838907) 408 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('29', 407, 1, 2, 838949) which a battle of non violence conceived in a humble spirit can be offered, if the Government takes of such a battle advantage not contemplated by me, or if tile atmosphere required for it is wanting.
('29', 407, 1, 3, 839150) What has happened in fact is that all these things have more or less come about.
('29', 407, 1, 4, 839231) Let it be further remembered that with me the safety of the cause has not lain in numbers.
('29', 407, 1, 5, 839322) My so called popularity has been perhaps the greatest stumbling block in the swift execution of my plans.
('29', 407, 1, 6, 839428) I should not have done penance either for the Bombay riots or Chauri Chaura if the people who tools part in them had been utter strangers to me and made no profession of non violence.
('29', 407, 1, 7, 839612) So long therefore as I continue to attract crowds, I have to walk warily.
('29', 407, 1, 8, 839686) A general with a large army cannot march as swiftly as he would like to.
('29', 407, 1, 9, 839759) He has to take note of all the different units in his army.
('29', 407, 1, 10, 839819) My position is not very unlike such a general’s.
('29', 407, 1, 11, 839868) It is not a happy position, but it is there.

('29', 407, 2, 14, 840077) I have in no way”lowered the flag” of non co operation.
('29', 407, 2, 15, 840133) It is not even brought half mast.
('29', 407, 2, 16, 840167) For not a single non co operator is called upon to deny his faith.
('29', 407, 2, 17, 840234) It is always risky to bring in the illustrations of the great prophets or religious teachers of the world.
('29', 407, 2, 18, 840341) I may in the world feeling my way to light”amid the encircling gloom”.
('29', 407, 2, 19, 840412) I often err and miscalculate.

('29', 407, 2, 21, 840660) My trust is solely in God.
('29', 407, 2, 22, 840687) And I trust men only because I trust God.
('29', 407, 2, 23, 840729) If I had no God to rely upon, I should be like Timon, a hater of my species.
('29', 407, 2, 24, 840806) But if we are to draw a moral from the lives of the great teachers, let us also remember that the Prophet entered into treaty with those with whom he had little in common and who are described in scathing terms in the Koran.
('29', 407, 2, 25, 841031) Non co operation, exodus, resistance and even violence were with the Prophet phases in the same battle of life wherein truth was everything.
('29', 407, 3, 26, 841172) I do not believe as the friend seems to do that an individual may gain spiritually and those who surround him suffer.
('29', 407, 3, 27, 841290) I believe in advaita, I believe in the essential unity of man and for that matter of all that lives.
('29', 407, 3, 28, 841391) Therefore I believe that if one man gains spiritually, the whole world gains with him and, if one man falls, the whole world falls to that extent.
('29', 407, 3, 29, 841538) I do not help opponents without at the same time
('29', 408, 0, 1, 841587) VOL. 29 : 16 AUGUST, 1924 26 DECEMBER, 1924 409
('29', 408, 1, 2, 841635) helping myself and my co workers.
('29', 408, 1, 3, 841669) I have not asked or advised believing non co operators not to”hoist their flag” either collectively or individually.
('29', 408, 1, 4, 841786) On the contrary I expect them to keep it flying top most against all odds.
('29', 408, 1, 5, 841861) But that does not mean that the nation or the Congress non co operates.
('29', 408, 1, 6, 841933) What we must recognize, if we will not ignore facts, is that the nation, i.e., the Congress in so far as it represents the nation, is not carrying out the programme of Non co operation.
('29', 408, 1, 7, 842119) It must therefore be confined to individuals.
('29', 408, 1, 8, 842165) Non co oper ating ex lawyers, ex title holders, ex schoolmasters, ex councillors may remain that to the full and still belong to the Congress.
('29', 408, 1, 9, 842308) Their special programme is hand spinning and Khadi.
('29', 408, 1, 10, 842360) These the Congress has not yet rejected.
('29', 408, 1, 11, 842401) The Swarajists are gracefully accommodating No changers in this respect to the fullest extent compatible with their convictions.
('29', 408, 1, 12, 842530) They do not consider, as No changers do, that univers ailzing hand spinning is necessary for accelerating the exclusion of foreign cloth.
('29', 408, 1, 13, 842668) And yet in order to retain the co operation of No changers, if you will, my co operation, they, seeing that they have no objection on principle to hand spinning, have become party to its introduction in the franchise.
('29', 408, 1, 14, 842886) It is well to bear in mind that the introduction of hand spinning as part of the franchise is an extraordinary proposal.
('29', 408, 1, 15, 843007) A conscientious man like Mr. Stokes opposes it tooth and nail, although he is himself an enthusiastic spinner.
('29', 408, 1, 16, 843118) Many of our distinguished countrymen laugh at it.
('29', 408, 1, 17, 843168) It is no small thing then that the Swarajists have accepted.
('29', 408, 1, 18, 843229) Therefore if they prove true to their word (and I have no reason to doubt it), non co operators do not need any separate organization.
('29', 408, 1, 19, 843364) The No changers need not, ought not, to take part in the Council activity and therefore the Swarajists have the sole authority and consequently sole responsibility for the Council programme.
('29', 408, 1, 20, 843555) They will use the name of the Congress as of right but they will not therefore use the name of the No changers.
('29', 408, 1, 21, 843667) The Congress is a joint concern in which the liability and responsibility for certain items are joint and for a particular activity given to and taken over by a section.
('29', 408, 1, 22, 843837) If unity, removal of untouchability and the charkha are an integral part of the politics of this country, then No changers have all the truth, all the non violence and all the spirituality that they may wish for.
('29', 408, 1, 23, 844050) A No changer’s fight with the Government consists chiefly in purifying himself and developing his own strength.
('29', 408, 1, 24, 844162) But he must not by any act of his impair the power of the Swarajists whom he is bound to regard as honest as himself.
('29', 408, 1, 25, 844280) A No changer should be the
('29', 409, 0, 1, 844307) 410 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('29', 409, 1, 2, 844349) last person to arrogate sanctity for himself to the exclusion of others.
('29', 409, 1, 3, 844422) And granting that the Swarajist system is bad, let him not act as if the existing system of Government is not much worse.
('29', 409, 1, 4, 844544) Even a believer in non violence has to say between two combatants which is less bad or whose cause is just.
('29', 409, 1, 5, 844652) Between Japan and Russia, Tolstoy gave his verdict for Japan.
('29', 409, 1, 6, 844714) Between England and Dutch South Africa, W.T Stead 1sided with the Boers and prayed for England’s defeat.
('29', 409, 1, 7, 844819) Between Swarajists and the Government, I do not take a single second to make my choice.
('29', 409, 1, 8, 844907) There is danger of our vision being blurred because of the Swarajist revolt against the programme of 1920. Assume for the moment that the Swarajists are as bad as the Government should have us believe, even so their government will be infinitely preferable to a government which has limitless resources for crushing the slightest attempt at independence of conduct or real resistance.
('29', 409, 1, 9, 845292) I am not aiming at any”strategic” unity.
('29', 409, 1, 10, 845333) I am simply aiming at representation of all parties in the Congress, so that we may learn to tolerate one another’s opinions, we may know one another better, we may react upon one another and, if we cannot find a common method of execution, we may at least frame a common scheme of swaraj.
('29', 409, 1, 11, 845623) I agree with the friend in his concluding remarks that it is not the Council programme that will ultimately keep the impatient idealist from mischief, but it is the non violent non co operation which evokes the highest spirit of self sacrifice that will wean him from the error of his ways.
('29', 409, 1, 12, 845914) I promise that I have done nothing to weaken the strong non co operator.
('29', 409, 1, 13, 845987) With myself, I have put him on his mettle.
('29', 409, 1, 14, 846030) Let him sacrifice himself to the utmost on the altar of unadulterated love and the whole Congress will follow him like one man.
('29', 409, 1, 15, 846158) But such love acts in an unseen manner.
('29', 409, 1, 16, 846198) The more efficient a force is, the more silent and the more subtle it is.
('29', 409, 1, 17, 846272) Love is the subtlest force in the world.
('29', 409, 1, 18, 846313) If the No changer has it in him, it is well with him and everyone else.

('29', 409, 3, 20, 846408) 355. SUSPEND OR ABANDON?
('29', 409, 4, 21, 846433) The answer to the question whether non co operation should be suspended or abandoned depends purely upon the temperamental state of the answerer.
('29', 409, 4, 22, 846579) He who has never believed in non co operation
('29', 409, 5, 23, 846625) 1 English journalist; an enthusiastic supporter of the peace movement in Great Britain
('29', 410, 0, 1, 846712) VOL. 29 : 16 AUGUST, 1924 26 DECEMBER, 1924 411
('29', 410, 1, 2, 846760) naturally wants it abandoned for ever.
('29', 410, 1, 3, 846799) He who like me has always believed in and practised it, whenever and wherever necessary, and who therefore swears by it can with difficulty only be persuaded to vote for suspension in the hope no doubt that some time or other he will be able to carry the sceptic and the unbeliever with him and make its national working a success.
('29', 410, 1, 4, 847131) Suspension therefore is the neutral state that can be accepted by all parties.
('29', 410, 1, 5, 847210) Those who believe in the efficacy and necessity of non violent non co operation may be permitted to cherish the hope that if the occasion necessitated revival, the nation would take it up.
('29', 410, 1, 6, 847399) Those who disbelieve in it will be free under suspension to preach the evil effects in their opinion of non co operation to convert Congressmen to their views.
('29', 410, 1, 7, 847559) That is the grand opportunity that suspension gives them.
('29', 410, 1, 8, 847617) And in my opinion a wholly non co operating Congress cannot be expected to go further than suspension.
('29', 410, 1, 9, 847720) I say”wholly non co operating Congress” because Swarajists too claim to have faith in non co operation.
('29', 410, 1, 10, 847824) Let me give up a secret, if secret it can be called.
('29', 410, 1, 11, 847877) The very first draft prepared now more than three months ago began with a preamble reiterating belief in non co operation.
('29', 410, 1, 12, 848000) It was quite acceptable to Swarajists.
('29', 410, 1, 13, 848039) But it was removed by mutual consent in order to make it easier for Liberals and others to join.
('29', 410, 1, 14, 848136) It was pointed out by some friends that Liberals and National Home Rulers might object to voting for the preamble.
('29', 410, 1, 15, 848251) In fact consistently with principles extraordinary care was taken by all who had a hand in drafting the final agreement to anticipate and meet the requirements of those who have remained outside the Congress.
('29', 410, 1, 16, 848460) I know that even so, the agreement falls short of the full requirements of the various political groups and parties.
('29', 410, 1, 17, 848577) The reason for the defect is not due to want of effort or will, but it is due to both the Swarajists and myself having to take into account our respective principles, or call them limitations if that word is preferable.
('29', 410, 2, 18, 848797) Moreover, I cannot too often repeat the fact that we had the great Congress electorate in mind.
('29', 410, 2, 19, 848893) It is true that it is as yet not always assertive when it ought to be but I have noticed that on occasions it can assert its will despite the effort of the leaders to the contrary.
('29', 410, 2, 20, 849074) It is the same electorate that all of us have to affect and be affected by.
('29', 410, 2, 21, 849150) In findings the ways and means of agreement I venture to think that each party if it is to work in unison has to be satisfied with just sufficient and no more for the requirements of its conscience.
('29', 410, 2, 22, 849349) After all, no one wants non co operation for the sake of it.
('29', 411, 0, 1, 849410) 412 THE COLLECTED WORKS OF MAHATMA GANDHI
('29', 411, 1, 2, 849452) one prefers imprisonment to freedom.
('29', 411, 1, 3, 849489) But when freedom is in jeopardy, non co operation may be a duty and prison may be a palace.
('29', 411, 1, 4, 849581) It is for all those who would under every circumstance avoid non co operation to make it unnecessary for non co operators to resort to it.
('29', 411, 1, 5, 849720) And one of the best methods of bringing about such a result is for all parties to unite, devise a scheme of swaraj acceptable to all parties and discover at the same time if it is possible a common method of enforcing that scheme.

('29', 411, 3, 8, 849974) 356. WHAT IS SEDITIOUS?
('29', 411, 4, 9, 849998) The Allahabad High Court pronounced Professor Ramdas Gaud’s Hindi Readers as seditious, although it was admitted that the Readers contained nothing but selections from books already in circulation.
('29', 411, 4, 10, 850196) The High Court has also awarded costs against the professor in the sum of Rs. 300. The Readers have been proscribed three years after their publication.
('29', 411, 4, 11, 850349) I admit that evil does not cease to be such because of lapse of time.
('29', 411, 4, 12, 850419) But it is fair to ask why the Government allowed the evil to run for such a long time.
('29', 411, 4, 13, 850506) It is a just presumption that the Government chose a time when non co operation was at its ebb.
('29', 411, 4, 14, 850602) The relevant question however is, what Professor Ramdas Gaud or better still those parents and those institutions that are using the Readers should do?
('29', 411, 4, 15, 850754) It is not an easy question to answer.
('29', 411, 4, 16, 850792) We are about to suspend non co operation and therefore also civil disobedience.
('29', 411, 4, 17, 850872) Such acts therefore cannot receive the moral support of the Congress.
('29', 411, 4, 18, 850942) Every individual and every institution must act on its own responsibility.
('29', 411, 4, 19, 851017) The extracts quoted in the judgment divide themselves into three parts : 1. Those that are said to excite hatred against the Government.
('29', 411, 4, 20, 851154) 2. Those that are said to excite hatred against Western civilization and by implication against Europeans.
('29', 411, 4, 21, 851261) 3. Those that excite hatred against persons belonging to different religious communities.
('29', 411, 4, 22, 851351) In the first instance I venture to suggest that almost any book can be held objectionable, if isolated passages from it torn from their context are to be judged.
('29', 411, 4, 23, 851513) So far as I know the judges had nothing more.
('29', 411, 4, 24, 851559) Secondly almost every Indian newspaper can be declared seditious, because it does excite disaffection towards the”Government
('29', 412, 0, 1, 851684) VOL. 29 : 16 AUGUST, 1924 26 DECEMBER, 1924 413
('29', 412, 1, 2, 851732) (i.e., the system, not the men composing it) established by law”.
('29', 412, 1, 3, 851798) For almost every Indian has pronounced against it and is seeking to end or mend it.
('29', 412, 1, 4, 851882) So far as the Western civilization is concerned, it is possible to find terrible passages from Hindu scriptures holding up the modern system to ridicule and contempt.
('29', 412, 1, 5, 852049) My booklet, from which passages referring to Western civilization have been quoted, has been placed in the hands of children with impunity.
('29', 412, 1, 6, 852189) I may have erred in my condemnation.
('29', 412, 1, 7, 852226) But it was written not to preach hatred against any portion of mankind but love for all that lives.
('29', 412, 1, 8, 852326) I know of no instance in which a single mind has been corrupted by the reading of that booklet.
('29', 412, 1, 9, 852422) It has been translated both in India and abroad into several languages.
('29', 412, 1, 10, 852494) It was once proscribed by the Government of Bombay.
('29', 412, 2, 11, 852546) But the proscription has been removed in practice if not in theory.
('29', 412, 2, 12, 852614) It is strange then that Prof.
('29', 412, 2, 13, 852644) Ramdas Gaudy should be punished, when I am left untouched.
('29', 412, 2, 14, 852703) In support of the third charge, namely promotion of inter religious hatred, I see only one passage quoted.
('29', 412, 2, 15, 852810) I do not know in what context it occurs.
('29', 412, 2, 16, 852851) But it is clear to me that the books have not been proscribed for the sake of that one passage.
('29', 412, 2, 17, 852947) I know that the professor has a clear conscience.
('29', 412, 2, 18, 852997) He has not intended to excite hatred against any individual.
('29', 412, 2, 19, 853058) I know too that he has made no profits out of the sales.
('29', 412, 2, 20, 853115) If I were he, I would leave the circulation undisturbed.
('29', 412, 2, 21, 853172) The books in stock must have been confiscated by the Government already.
('29', 412, 2, 22, 853245) But where the Readers are already being taught, I would continue to teach them unless the parents or the trustees decide otherwise.

('29', 412, 6, 26, 853449) SIR, Nearly three years ago the Government of India sent a Commission to Fiji Islands to enquire into the condition of Indians resident there and to ascertain the causes of discontent among them and to advise whether or not, having regard to all the circumstances of the case, Fiji offers a suitable field for Indian colonization.
('29', 412, 6, 27, 853780) The Commission visited the Islands in the beginning of the year 1922 and submitted a report of their enquiry to the Indian
('29', 412, 7, 28, 853903) 1 The reference is to Hind Swaraj; vide”Johannesburg”, March 13, 1910.

('29', 413, 1, 2, 854016) Government in September, 1922. So the report has been with the Government of India for more than two years.
('29', 413, 1, 3, 854124) In the last session of the Legislative Assembly, Mr. Gaya Prasad Sinha asked the Government of India some questions about this report.
('29', 413, 1, 4, 854259) Here are three of his questions: (c) When do the Government of India intend to publish the report?
('29', 413, 1, 5, 854358) (d) Is it a fact that the Colonial Office has taken strong objections to certain views expressed in the report?
('29', 413, 1, 6, 854470) (e) Will the Government be pleased to lay on the table communication on the subject which may have passed between the Colonial Office and the Government of India?
('29', 413, 2, 7, 854633) Mr. J. W. Bhore replied on behalf of the Government:
('29', 413, 3, 8, 854686) (c) The question of publication is still under consideration.
('29', 413, 3, 9, 854748) (d) & (e) In view of the answer given to part (c) of the question, I hope that the Hon’ble member will not press for an answer.

('29', 415, 1, 2, 858157) 360. HARRY THUKU OF KENYA 1
('29', 415, 2, 3, 858185) [December 5, 1924] 2
('29', 415, 3, 4, 858206) Tyranny is the same all over the world.
('29', 415, 3, 5, 858246) The essence of tyranny lies in the repression of the individual without any trial by his fellow men and without any evidence being given in public against him .
('29', 415, 4, 6, 858407) When I was in East Africa, I met one of the brightest lads I had seen in that country.
('29', 415, 4, 7, 858494) His name was Harry Thuku and he was a Christian...At a meeting of the Natives of East Africa in Victoria Park at Nairobi, which he had organized for me, I spoke to the Africans themselves about Queen Victoria the Good, and the ideals of liberty and racial equality which she had professed in the Proclamation of 1858. .
('29', 415, 5, 8, 858814) About a year after this experience, I saw one day in the papers that the Africans had been fired on and many killed and wounded, because of excitement in Nairobi, and that Harry Thuku himself had been deported to a place called Kisumayu, without trial.
('29', 415, 5, 9, 859067) He sent a message to me, through Mr. Manibhai Desai, asking me for help and claiming the right of a British subject to be tried face to face with his accusers, instead of being secretly taken away to a distant place and interned without any trial whatever.
('29', 415, 5, 10, 859324) I did my very best at the time to make his voice heard in England, but without effect.
('29', 415, 5, 11, 859411) Again, quite recently, another appeal from him has come to me.
('29', 415, 6, 12, 859474) “In the month of March, 1922, I was arrested under the authority of His Excellency, the Governor, Sir Edward Northey and deported to Kisumayu for detention I was not tried by any tribunal.
('29', 415, 7, 13, 859663) “Is it because of my insisting, that the unmarried African girls should not be forced by Government to work on the plantations of white settlers, as it inevitably resulted in immorality and separation of domestic ties, or because I protested that my country people should not be flogged to death, etc., etc., that I have been deported?
('29', 415, 8, 14, 859999) “I was simply caught hold of by the Government and deported.
('29', 415, 8, 15, 860060) The rule applied to me is without doubt ‘Might is Right’.
('29', 415, 9, 16, 860118) “I therefore pray, Sir, that you may be pleased to recommend my release as I have already suffered a great deal.
('29', 415, 9, 17, 860231) .” Poor Harry Thuku!
('29', 415, 9, 18, 860252) His appeal to Mr. Andrews and my
('29', 415, 10, 19, 860285) 1 From this article by C. F. Andrews on which Gandhiji has commented, only extracts are reproduced here.
('29', 415, 10, 20, 860390) 2 Vide”Letter to C. F. Andrews”, 5 12 1924.
('29', 416, 0, 1, 860434) VOL. 29 : 16 AUGUST, 1924 26 DECEMBER, 1924 417
('29', 416, 1, 2, 860482) publication of it in these columns will secure no relief for this victim of lust for power.
('29', 416, 1, 3, 860574) If however he ever sees these lines, he will perhaps find comfort in the thought that even in distant India many will read the story of his deportation and trials with sympathy.
('29', 416, 1, 4, 860752) He may also find solace in the fact that many perhaps as innocent as Harry Thuku are today locked up in Bengal without any trial or hope of it in the near future.

('29', 417, 1, 2, 862150) 362. SPEECH AT GOLDEN TEMPLE, AMRITSAR 1
('29', 417, 2, 3, 862191) December 5, 1924
('29', 417, 3, 4, 862208) Mahatma Gandhi who had been presented a saropa from the Akal Takht rose amidst shouts of Sat Sri Akal.
('29', 417, 3, 5, 862311) He spoke while sitting and the feeble voice was
('29', 417, 4, 6, 862359) distinctly audible owing to the dead silence prevailing at the moment.
('29', 417, 4, 7, 862430) He said that Sardar Mangal Singh had said that he had been moved to tears by his description, whereas this was not the case; for he did not weep over these troubles as he knew that greater calamities were yet to befall them.

('29', 426, 4, 17, 887563) 368. SAVE COTTON

('29', 427, 1, 7, 888448) I have no doubt that this will be more fruitful than collecting funds.
('29', 427, 1, 8, 888519) Money multiplies only through interest and the latter is the wealth of the idle.
('29', 427, 1, 9, 888600) Farm products increase through labour which is the wealth of the industrious.
('29', 427, 1, 10, 888678) We, men and women of the middle classes, have not realized the value of manual labour at all.
('29', 427, 1, 11, 888772) Through labour, we can bring together all people.
('29', 427, 1, 12, 888822) If we have a stock of cotton and can get persons who wish to serve the country to work on it, we can to that extent raise the value of cotton as much as we choose.
('29', 427, 1, 13, 888986) If cotton is got as a gift and labour too is given as a gift, it is easy to see that we can sell khadi at a very low price.

('29', 427, 1, 17, 889425) But before we can think of all this we must accumulate large stocks of cotton.

('29', 427, 1, 24, 889934) And when all these things are done with a view to public good, the wise reader will easily realize what power lies in them.
